DYc6SH1WSY13knFOdI-ymg.review_text: Took the bf here for a nice lil surprise dinner after a musical show on a Sunday. Yummy seafood dishes! We ordered the lobster and the whole crab! Deliciousness! Amazing lemon drop martinis! Great service!  If you're like me and you enjoy dining with a view, then this is the place to be. Do the romance hehe =)

9oEBAWFlZTs2TB5i2P0aqQ.review_text: I've always heard about San Francisco's infamous clam chowder & fish and chips. We were going to eat at 2 separate places for the items, but found this place served both and had good reviews so we went here instead.   We started with the clam chowder in a bread bowl and the crab cake risotto fritters. The clam chowder was delicious, best I've tried. As someone stated in the tips below, just get the soup because they serve bread and butter for free, so our bread bowl was pretty much left un-eaten. The crab cake fritters were amazing as well. It was so much food so we shared the fish and chips. Fries were good, but the fish was underwhelming. The fish itself was flaky and light but the batter was unseasoned and made the whole thing just bland. I didn't care for the tarter sauce or cole slaw either.   Overall, pretty good! I'd come back just for the clam chowder.

GdkQR7PJ6dRPP_ezYs3cpg.review_text: The view is beautiful. Food and service is okay. My friends were traveling in SF for the first time and wandering around Fisherman's Wharf. That's why I was dining in the place, just to meet my friends. I probably wouldn't go there if otherwise.

c8nRvIM_Pqz8CbfYaTu8vA.review_text: I came here for "fresh" oysters and lobster which were highly recommended by lots of people. It tasted OK BUT this is what I got after this--viral gastroenteritis (another name for the "stomach flu". I had to run to bathroom every 5 minutes and I threw up like crazy.   I was sent to the emergency department and was told by the doctor this disaster was caused by virus in food. And yes, the food at this place is all what I ate before all the symptoms started. The "fresh" oysters here are absolutely poisonous. I paid more than 2000 bucks in the emergency department (and extra 300 bucks for my health).  I will NEVER go to this place again, and I'm worrying that those poor tourists (maybe without insurance) CANNOT withstand going to the hospital in the middle of the night. DONOT go here. DONOT risk your life.

Z2c1Sx1rfzg0I5-N8yBhgA.review_text: Clam chowder was something else, the bread was fresh out of the oven and all the rest of the food was exceptional.

hTAKG103EUfeHrFA1TXFng.review_text: Absolutly worth to wait at the front desk - if you have too!  Service was friendly, food was delicious and the view into the harbor of Pier 39, Alcatraz in the background - just amazing.

znAu0tFeqEvAJ8GO1YnntA.review_text: Went there twice and each time it amazes me how good their seafood meals are! Love their clam chowder and it is definitely a must get.   If you happen to be there, do check out their coffee shop that sells biscoff cookie downstairs.

QTSm9Z1092hv2rDSw12Sng.review_text: After a long day biking in the city we decided to stop here to get some seafood. Our server, Khaiman, was really helpful with advice on what to order and checking in on us the entire time we were eating. He was also hilarious. I ordered the crab roll which was delicious! (P.s. The portions are pretty big) My boyfriend got the seafood combo and loved the calamari. I got the blackberry press which is a type of lemonade that they make which was also wonderful. The only thing that was less than spectacular was probably the clam chowder which was a bit above average. Overall I would recommend this place and hope to come back soon!

MvzUoye4DKsBdB4dylgpDw.review_text: Why would this Finding Nemo lovin' girl like the Fog Harbor Fish House?   I'll tell you why. Lean in...  ...a little closer...  ...juuuuust a bit closer...  Because it does. The End.  (Just Kidding!) The food has great quality, you'll fill up on the free sourdough bread (the best I've had), they have wonderful meals and for a fishy joint, it's not all bad. Compared to OTHER restaurants that primarily serve seafood, I have to say Fog Harbor blows them out of the water.   You have a beautiful scenic view, there are large windows showing the skyline and water of San Francisco. They validate and you have many other attractions on the Pier 39 wharf. Do yourself a favor and use yelp to reserve a reservation. It was a God-send for me and my party.

Nfw6KZys6dVXnB5oiuZPdg.review_text: WAAAAAAY better than Crab House!  From when we first arrived, seating, service, food and when we left, friendly and on point.  We didn't have anything other than the crab, so I can't recommend anything but this city's specialty.  Would def come back here with guests in town visiting SF!

UKSweOQ9zoPy4-9Ge0Ay1w.review_text: Of our 8-day vacation, my husband said our visit here was the low point.  Our waiter did not speak English, and so he did not know how to answer our questions.  For example, when my husband asked "What are your three most popular entrees?"  he responded "All of our seafood is fresh."  When I asked what was the least fishy-tasting fish, he told me the Salmon was great.  (We got a sampler, and although the salmon was fine, it was certainly not the least fishy - just the most expensive!)  I decided to place my drink order at the bar rather than try to communicate it to him.    The clam chowder was really good, but the rest of the food was not that great.  It was very expensive.  There has got to be better options in San Francisco.

LJJ2Rxr-EtUvzvLWqbUDig.review_text: Best clam chowder sourdough bread bowl ever--flaky and crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. And the baked oysters--the best my oyster-aficionado boyfriend and I have ever had. Reasonably priced considering how delicious the food was, and service was good--very friendly.

EYOU4LJadl0cR1Adl75CPA.review_text: We were on a company event and it was my first time to visit this place. Never been to a true sea food place, but this was a good start. The food here was AWESOME and I had Clam Chowder for the first time and it was really good. I would go back to this place with no issues. So I recommend this place and of course the food as well.

783dRt1rHss5gIORRgTwow.review_text: First a hint. A AAA card gets you 20% off the food bill.  I was leaning towards four stars until the tiramisu arrived. It was not terrible just not very good. Too much lady fingers and not enough of what makes tiramisu tiramisu.   OK, lets start at the beginning. With me, three stars is not bad, it means just what I expected, nothing more, nothing less. In this case expectations had to be pretty high, given the prices. My cioppino was excellent and did not skimp on ingredients. Judit chose fried shrimp and fries and it is hard to mess that up. The service was spot on, the ambiance excellent. And we did not feel touristy. Then the tiramisu arrived.

mpm9olv35gqQePUdQvK62g.review_text: Came here last week for dinner while entertaining an out of town visitor. Venue is nice - big and touristy. We started with the crab and risotto fritters. These were slightly disappointing, was hoping for crispy hot fritters and received this lukewarm, kind of soggy conglomeration of crab and risotto. Also got a moscow mule and bowl of cioppino - the moscow mule was standard (a little weak), and this was my first venture into ordering cioppino, after tasting others' at different restaurants and really liking it. This one was very solid in quantity of seafood, with lots of crab, scallops, shrimp, clams and mussels, which made it a delight to eat. However, I think the seafood might have been cooking a little too long, because the scallops were near disintegrating and the crab tasted straight up like the broth. So, the seafood was fresh and plentiful, but the seafood all tasted the same, as if it had been boiling in the broth together for a long time. Shrimp and mussels were the highlight, they seemed to be have cooked properly and still had some firmness. The broth was simple and tasted like tomato soup, though some salt and pepper brought out the flavors well. Also, wanted more than a small sliver of garlic bread! Waitstaff was friendly.  Overall, very much enjoyed the meal, but there were a few things that stood out as pieces that could easily be improved upon.

KGkVWWlaS7kETDfW3teAgQ.review_text: Sit in Khaiman's section, he rocks! Best waiter I've had in a while. The food is delicious and reasonably priced.

YkQgfpCGB0lPG3VCgBo-Tw.review_text: The yelpers are right this place is really good both in food and service.   Had the Tuna poke, cup of clam chowder and the freshest salmon ever!  Also tried cable car, gimlet and margarita.  Everything was prepared extremely well and served quickly.   The place is crowded and you should expect a wait, but it is worth it.  Waiter was new, but really hustled.  Will certainly be back.

pdzAXyi5GrseQIyEt1jz4A.review_text: We had reservations and arrived in time.  The hostess was ready to seat us but couldn't until another hostess came to the front so they would have someone there to greet customers. We waited almost five minutes for this other hostess to return so we could be seated. They had a beautiful table reserved for us with a fantastic view!  So I guess it was worth the wait.   My husband had the shellfish plate with crab, mussels, clam and shrimp.  He loved every minute of it and was a buttery mess by the end.  I had the crab cakes which were equally yummy!  It was served with a side of coleslaw that was just meh.  Our waiter was a very friendly, young blond guy who did a terrific job checking in with us without being overbearing.

izVTBQfKSVn0ZCwqpu8K8w.review_text: While the food was good and visually very appealing, we found the actual amount of crab/ lobster you receive very lacking. You definitely had to work for your food with the crab. And the crab stuffed lobster was mostly potatoes and spinach.   The appetizer of mussels was amazing however the crab and shrimp ceviche was mostly avocado.   The sword fish was great.. My 10 year old son cleaned his plate!

Gh6IaRTPttJRLbRzbkjq-A.review_text: Most definitely more than $30 per person. Keep that in mind, since Yelp rates this as two $$.

nImwqf3mKc32xjkAl2CxNQ.review_text: Food is good but the service and host need a new job somewhere were they can be bitter at. So sad for such a beautiful and yummy place the ppl who work there don't give the respect or the service that such place deserves. Will not be coming again

xCliqEMU4NPeq3RrUWxxJw.review_text: You can't go to San Francisco without stopping at Pier 39 to act "touristy".  Fog Harbor has a cozy and classy entrance with a fireplace and nice seating area.  Inside, they had Christmas lights and trees to make the place look festive for the holidays.  I ordered a cup of the clam chowder and the fish and chips.  The soup was good and creamy, but my favorite creamy clam chowder is still the one at Boudin.  The fish and chips were a generous serving, but I wasn't crazy about the cole slaw (needed some sugar) and the tartar sauce.  Sourdough bread was fabulous! Nevertheless, Martin, the server, was outstanding!  You don't find many servers as helpful, friendly, and accommodating as him.  The check had an added fee of 94 cents and when I asked about it, it had something to do with a fee the city supposedly tacks on to provide for uninsured workers or something...Hmm...

yJWdLAiPU47pR41GMIdMoA.review_text: Great service! Put our name on the list, party of 2. 30 min wait. Asked if we can walk around the pier, lady replied check back in 20 min. We checked back in 25min and were seated immediately. Our waiter was VERY nice. We ordered 2 sourdough clam chowder bread bowls, and sliders. The bread and Clam Chowder were wonderful, especially the bread, but the caramelized onions on the sliders were just to die for. It's been over 24 hrs and I can't forget that taste. I loved the whole experience.

6gxvxs3kP4IvbxmImYqzHg.review_text: Great food! Excellent Service.  Great view!  Very good atmosphere, nice bar.  A great place to stop in on vacation, but don't get confused by the place downstairs, I walked in after looking on YELP and almost ate there... but different restarurant... Fog Harbor is much nicer and is on the SECOND STORY.  Little pricey for a lunch ($120), but well worth it.

c3EZVfHXcnhnzfZoKHjN5A.review_text: Much love for Fog Harbor. View was breathtaking and food superb.  We Reserved online using Open Table and they offered a complimentary amuse bouche.  Garlic crab was messy but very tasty. The sourdough loaf addictive. Crab Roll excellent. Fish and chips were a well done version.  Service was also excellent. Worth a trip.

uV34lZrCqCwGjYf-62m3AQ.review_text: I was delighted to be seated right away, but the experience was far from 5 stars. Our waitress brought us dirty plates. I requested new ones and they came back less dirty (probably the same ones wiped down).   We ordered the Cioppino to share and half a dozen oysters. The oysters were fresh and delicious. The Cioppino was average and not loaded with enough seafood. Two shrimps, two scallops...not to mention we ordered the additional pasta ($2) but there was none.   We decided to order a burger because it wasn't enough food. We waited for a while. Our waitress came back to tell us that the kitchen was busy and if we want to cancel our order. We agreed and she apologized about the pasta and the burger. $46 spent and still hungry, it would have been better if we ate somewhere else in Fisherman's Wharf. Despite the awesome romantic view of the ocean and nice ambience of the restaurant, the food and service were not up to par.  Avoid touristy restaurants I guess, unless they are the only available option.

iXKcuqYopkftzxE4cP7etg.review_text: I was visiting the area on business from Atlanta and randomly selected Fog Harbor based in Yelp reviews and location. I had the Pacific Sole and crab cakes. The crab cakes were ok but not the best I've had and same for the Sole. All in all the view is awesome and I'd order the food again so although it wasn't the best I've had, it was good.

Tl-GcEU2Z0vPEw3akWDZbA.review_text: The food and service here is great!  The complementary sourdough bread and butter is a way to start the meal.   -crab and risotto fritters: definitely a must try! I enjoyed every bite. The soft, rich mixture of crab and risotto covered in a crispy layer.   -chicken penne: comes with sundried tomatoes and greens. The sauce is a light oil and was simply delicious.   -creme brûlée: the sugar coat (my favorite part) was on point and the bottom layer was soft and fluffy. One of my favorite ones to come!   -tiramisu: the cake was very tea and mocha flavored. But there wasn't anything out of the ordinary.

c2h5eKhkLUS0sZnImGYs2g.review_text: If you're looking for a McCormicks and Shmicks it's the best of the brand. If you're looking for a out of the ordinary,"made your visit" seafood restaurant, look someplace else.

Px99XhnzvZXFKJC-gWFQIQ.review_text: First time here and really impress me, the foods and drinks are really good, Moscow Mule cocktail please try it guys, I really like it!! But here is the issue, me and my family here for vacation and we order some crab, but for some reason when the crab come out, it looks like the crab swimming on the butter pool?.....whats this? Well I dont know, so we call our server and tell him about the problem, and then he say he will call the manager, so when the manager come we let him know the issue, he was like im so sorry about the problem then give us the new crab for free, so this is really impress me, the manager is really nice and friendly, he didnt say anything just give us new dish~will come back again next time if I have a chance!!!!

HUS74wDi6wf7St1NNr2zuw.review_text: I expected a lot more from this place. We got there at 5:30 seated right away despite looking as if every table was full; big place. Service started out good then turned into the run of the mill like you were at McDonalds. Ordered calamari, shrimp cocktail, chowder in a bread bowl. The food was okay. Nothing that blew my mind away. The views however are great. Right on the water. But I wouldn't go here again.

HAhxEpkvRRw4exPjPY-BNQ.review_text: Service was great, large portions and quick service. We were impressed since the restaurant was huge.

fmsbWi05oigvux5SsoZ9gA.review_text: My wife and I had dinner here the other night because we had a coupon for a free appetizer. It turned out to be serendipitous.  We live in the North Bay and come to the City often. When it comes to restaurants, we are nothing but a bit jaded. That said, we had a splendid meal at Fog Harbor. Instead of a main course, we ordered several items listed as starters because that gives exposure to more dishes especially when there are only the two of us dining.  We started with the fried calamari which was served with a lemon aioli for dipping. The dish was all rings, no tentacles. The batter was light, something like you would expect to find in a very good tempura bar. We also had the sliders, the crab cakes and the red curry mussels.  The sliders were great. Cooked perfectly (medium rare) and smothered in caramelized onions. My wife loves crab cakes and pronounced them as good as any she has ever had. I'm not much of a crab cake lover, but I thought they were good. I will never love crab cakes, so don't take my word as gospel.  Then I had the red curry steamed mussels. I am a mussel fanatic. I've eaten them over half the world, particularly in Belgium (where mussels is the national dish), and I can honestly say that these are the most delicious steamed mussels I have ever had. These are not the red curry mussels you will find in Thai restaurants. You are going to have to try them to see what I mean. By the way, although listed as a starter, there were enough for a main dish, especially when accompanied by Fog Harbor's terrific sourdough bread which is made on site.  I asked the restaurant manager for the mussels recipe, but he couldn't comply. I then emailed the company and was sent the recipe by one of the senior execs. That is service above and beyond.  By the way, we were there during happy hour, and were able to enjoy a very good house Pinot Grigio for $5/glass - an added bonus.  Fog Harbor is located at Pier 39, a venue most locals associate with tourists and would not normally think of as a place to go for fine dining. Wrong.  Fog Harbor is considerably better than most of the famous places in the Fisherman's wharf vicinity. To make matters even better, with the appropriate coupon (available everywhere in the City) you can park free, a huge benefit in San Francisco where parking fees are equivalent to winnings in the Powerball lottery.

QwMbQmeywX9cAb60T9TG5w.review_text: Came here for a late lunch today with my mom. The weather was spectacular so we thoroughly enjoyed our window seat which faced the harbor and Fisherman's Wharf.   We were seated promptly and offered waters right away. Our server (totally bummed that I can't remember his name) was great. He was polite, prompt, helpful and courteous. We ordered:  2 cups of chowder - chowder was just okay. Not to thick, not to thin, just lacked flavor.  We also had the special appetizer, crab & risotto balls. These were tasty, soft on the inside and crispy on the outside. Our server suggested these over the crab cake.    Lastly we split a crab salad sandwich with sweet potato fries. This was nice but not out of this world great.   Overall the restaurant is lovely with gorgeous views especially on a clear beautiful day. Service was top notch. The missing star is for the food. Although good, I think it could be a bit more flavorful.   4 stars along for the fact that they validate for the garage across the street. Saved me over $20!  I love the City and this is a nice place among the touristy trap terrible restaurants on Pier 39.  It's worth a try just for the validation!

1ykk0w-LqSAcMWJXvnTpPg.review_text: Lived in Bay Area for years. This place exceeded our expectations great service,wonderfull fresh seafood .Ask for Alma she will recomend great food.

dn8aieYVEnvRjey4yj1UNQ.review_text: Okay, so this place is not cheap but you WILL NOT REGRET IT.  We had dinner here, I got the King Salmon and my husband got the swordfish.  We LOVED IT!!  You must try these dishes, so much flavor and the fish is local so it just looks and tastes so fresh.  I highly suggest you try this place, the staff is so friendly and it's a large restaurant, don't let the entrance fool you it curves around the back of the pier.  Very clean and we didn't wait long at all for our food (maybe 15 minutes).  ENJOY!  Wish we had something like this back home.

FlXBpK_YZxLo27jcMdII1w.review_text: Oh my god.  Best calamari ever. I make that statement knowing full well the gravitas it holds.   But seriously, Fog Harbor is a must when visiting the Bay Area.  I know that some people may consider it touristy, but whatever. It's delicious. The bread provided on the table is delicious sourdough...in other words, don't pay extra for a sourdough bread bowl.   I came here for lunch and enjoyed a crab melt, as did everyone else at my table.  Everyone thought it to be very delicious and a great lunch experience.  Our waiter was so adorable, I wanted to put him on my shelf.

5E6MWtGC4t2ctSthymtBuQ.review_text: We had lunch here via a reservation on Yelp.  They got us in early with a fantastic view of the pier.  The service was solid and atmosphere calming.  The food is what really stood out.  All options on the menu are sustainably chosen and extremely fresh.  I had the seared Ahi Tuna and it was to die for.  My parents each loved their dishes as well.  Come here, stay away from the chain restaurants, and you will not be disappointed!

JAiiwAqOXrCy8O4RkcJyLA.review_text: A bit disappointed with the overall experience dining here for dinner. The overall atmosphere in the restaurant is pleasant and the view is amazing. For a party of three on a Sunday, the wait was minimal which was a plus.   For the food, my table ordered the seafood cioppino, seafood penne, fried calamari appetizer and the Moscow mule. Seafood cioppino was above average. More of a soupy tomato cioppino vs a stew like many places. Generous helpings of properly cooked mussels, clams, crab, scallops, shrimp and fish. Just wish the flavor was a bit stronger instead of resembling a tomato based seafood linguine. I'd say sotto mare was better. The seafood penne was very well done. Fish was perfectly cooked and the sauce was perfect, paired extremely well with the sourdough bread which was some of the best I've ever had. Soft center and flaky crust with chew. The calamari was well fried and flavorful, but the lemon aioli was very plain. The Moscow mule was watered down like crazy and might as well have been ginger ale mixed with water.   The service for this restaurant was disappointing considering its a tourist trap. My server failed to give me plate/silverware, bread and water refills requires multiple requests and drink came 15 minutes late. Expected a lot more and there wasn't even an apology for lack of plate and utensils.   I would probably not return based on the overall dining experience but the food was definitely some of the best of pier 39.

GQzhcVbZ8808SlUrz4TwBQ.review_text: Shocked to find such a pleasant surprise on Fisherman's Wharf.  Great vibe, great food, warm personable service. . . Shocked.  Among dishes our party of seven tried were Grilled Shrimp, Lobster Squash Ravioli, Chowder in Sourdough and Seafood Penne.   All judged entrees as solid.  Great respite among the chaos.

hgUWJKal08b_Rbm9qQb9AQ.review_text: Good eats, not touristy eats...  Delicious sourdough bread as a starter, ceviche was good, the clam chowder was delicious! The mixed grill was amazing the salmon and swordfish was the best I have ever had. I never order salmon because it usually is not the fish that I like but I found myself really enjoying the salmon here. I enjoyed the food so much that I found myself craving  the swordfish and clam chowder the next day, so I came back. To some that may seem UN original but eating at a few places that were horrible, I wanted a sure win! I was not disappointed.  We had Madison as our server and she was friendly attentive and did not make us feel rushed even though she was closing her shift. She always was smiling, which made our experience even more memorable. It seems that servers have forgotten the art of smiling. NOT Madison she was great.

rBoCb2dI49YHvCfyzhg9FA.review_text: The best clam chowder I've ever had. I'm not a connoisseur of clam chowder, but I've had my faaaair share. The day we went here, I intended to go to many other restaurants as part of my chowder day-- but I just couldn't because I knew that nothing would beat it!   An added plus-- great views, and fair prices. My new fav spot in Fisherman's Wharf!

e4CCD4D7iA4SCxryHNtzUQ.review_text: Came here with the fiance and mother after taking a walk along the Pier. We wanted to escape the cold and have some cocktails with a view. We were promptly seated by the window and the view was beautiful. We got there just in time to see the sunset. We each had a couple cocktails. All were delicious including their Moscow Mule which was served in a copper mug.  We shared the calamari which was decent. Not as crispy as I would've liked it but not bad. Overall, we had a nice experience. We didn't try their dinner but ambiance is candlelight with white table cloth, classy! Service was impeccable and we definitely would come back to try it again.

LSWOhXA2ak412Z8OAiMBfw.review_text: Somewhat disappointing. The view makes up for the diner-style food/presentation. Was expecting better. Service is okay...not 4 or 5 stars as rated. One person's opinion.

9-FL-x5YQXziSuCbwpSs9w.review_text: Great food and service. We have their ahi tuna and halibut special. Def. would recommend for some fresh sea food and good wine list

7yBulXymGkdZhEXXhWZtnQ.review_text: When we got there a waiter guided us to a booth and brought my brother and I kids menus. I got the fish and chips and the fish were big! They even came with lemons to squeeze. First we got some yummy blue cheese garlic bread. My mom and dad got the oysters while my sister got a salmon BLT.   The waiters were nice to us.We got a good view of Alcatraz and the top of the golden gate bridge while every once and a while the fog would roll in then pull back. I did not feel rushed and we could relax and enjoy the view.

4AYgSgKxNxw7K-TdEpufsw.review_text: I loved this place. Nice view of the pier, delicious food and fresh sourdough bread. I had the linguini with clams and it was delicious. The server suggested Kendall-Jackson, "Grand Reserve", Chardonnay. It paired well with the clam linguini. My Aussie friend had the fog harbor burger medium well. He said that it has been one of the best burgers so far.

E5qxWbvEYwtzvGhpE68z0Q.review_text: Delicious Blue Cheese bread!  Tried the Cioppino with pasta and was very good!

Eq4z0BzNPB_BvE1UP74ALw.review_text: Pass. This is a hard review to write after just one visit, but as it is located at Pier 39/fisherman's wharf, most folks will have a very similar experience. Lots of tourist crass, as expected in the general area, we chose this restaurant because it had the best yelp rating. As walk-ups on a slowish Tuesday night we were seated way in the back far from the scenic window view. Ok, fair enough. We liked but didn't love the lobster Mac and cheese. We liked the creamy clam chowder. The broth for the steamed clams was dull, and the panko encrusted scallops served with jalapeño aioli were a deep fried mess. The cocktails, @$13 per were tasty and along with the fresh sourdough bread were the highlights of the meal. Not likely to recommend this place to foodie tourist.

iIdPmqstqmw06kdIK12I2g.review_text: Tried 3 different flavors of dungess crab, first started with garlic, then Cajun and finally red chilly.  They were so full of flavors and just the perfect texture on each and every bite.  Cajun was my favorite.  The bit of a complaint is they wouldn't take reservation, so you'll have to come and wait.  There was a line but with a fireplace outside, the wait was not that bad.  Service was great, I canceled my entree while going thru my appetizers so I could order more crab :) and the waiter was happy to make it happen.  Strongly recommend!

QJn3LmmFbHQO3QcFFDe86g.review_text: Excellent shrimp, specially the chili shrimp. The bread was fresh and well cooked. The mixed fish grill was very flavorful, especially the salmon. I recommend it for everyone, specially people who like light seafood.

XLmCXdAuKhm105fOIc71hw.review_text: Great clam chowder, cocktails and view. ( as well as the bread and butter)  The calamari was too fishy, which makes me believe it wasn't fresh.  We ordered the half order roasted dungeness crab...very upsetting. It lacked flavor, and it was actually quarter of a crab!  What a rip off.  There are too many restaurants that serve the same kind of food so I'll be checking out the others next time.

SvhGUNhpFp6yMAwmjhQ90A.review_text: Best meal I've had in years. Seafood cioppino was amazing. The spicy tomato stew complimented the fresh scallops, shrimp, fish, mussels, and clams perfectly. Bread was great. Ordered a half Dungeness crab with red chili and garlic. Crab meat Melted in my mouth, fantastic . Bloody Mary's we're outstanding. Our server accidentally spilt some water on my friend and the manager gave us all free desserts. Chocolate banana bread pudding was out of this world. Great management and great food. Highly recommend this place.    Ps- check in on yelp for free blue cheese garlic bread !

hhvkQEAUxO-lSLeJo2nUSA.review_text: Clam chowder was delish and ciopinno was full of seafood and amazing. Would recommend this if you are looking for seafood in Fisherman's Wharf

qRfRNC7N0-pmtb9ycdczPw.review_text: Food was great! Pretty fast service, but maybe because they were almost closing. I had a complimentary dessert which was awesome. Unfortunately, the waitress who served us was pretty rude to my friend just because she couldn't understand her. From the start, it was all downhill from there. The waitress name is Katie. We would have given her a tip, but we believe she didnt deserve it. So we only paid for the food and left. When we left, she she followed us out and sarcastically waved at us and practically were saying dont ever come back here. I dont want to use profanities. Also, it was my birthday and she pretty much kind of ruined it for me. I understand that it was late and she is tired but she didnt have to be so rude and give us those fake smiles. She was trying to be sarcastic with the tone of her voice. Never ever coming back here.

oyQ8Pn6qxchUUcUiEIHQ0A.review_text: My husband and I went here for our 1 year wedding anniversary.  The restaurant looks great.  It is in a very crowded area of the wharf.  We were able to watch seals lounge on the docks during our meal.  We were really hoping for fresh local seafood but instead the menu s filled with alaskan fish or maine lobster.  The only local catch is the crab.  I had the halibut and it was dry and sitting on a bed of undressed arugala.  My husband's seafood platter looked great and tasted alright but was swimming in garlic butter.  We ordered an appetizer of baked oysters that did not come out for about 45 minutes but the waiter was great and gave us complementary small bowls of clam chowder to tide us over.  The service staff is very friendly and they have a good wine/champagne selection.  All in all I am glad we went there but I don;t feel the need to go there again.

ADsdlWWdAXXg9mSRuBC0Pw.review_text: Fog Harbor was a lovely stop on our spring trip to SF. We were seated right away(arrived around 6 on a Friday evening) and had a wonderful view of the harbor, sea lions, and sunset. The view is undeniably spectacular.   I would have given Fog House five stars if our waiter had been a bit better, but I realize everyone has off days. Our service was less than prompt and our waiter seemed like he didn't have too much interest on our table. He seemed annoyed that we only ordered appetizer portions of whole crab.   It was a shame our waiter was such a goof because the food was delicious and simple (how I feel seafood is best).  We started with the steamed clams, I would bathe in the broth if I could. The crab was delicious and fun to crack open and eat, bib and all.  And no review of the Fog Harbor would be complete with out mentioning the clam chowder: it really was the best I've eaten here. Not too thick, clams so tender I almost couldn't believe they were clams.   All together, a great stop. For a bottle of Chardonnay, clam appetizer, three appetizer clams and three cups of clam chowder our bill was around $200, as a heads up.

QetiS_XoopVLQo__r2CB6A.review_text: Came here for the first time after a tour of Alcatraz. Our waitress, Madison, politely informed us that she was new and a little rusty, but did a superb job! She was extremely friendly, but also very professional and efficient. The dining experience was above par. They serve you San Francisco's popular sourdough bread to start, which is a big plus. Additionally, we ordered calamari to start, which was served with a really excellent lemon sauce. Although it was very busy while we were there, we were served our entrees promptly. I ordered salmon, which was served on a bed of peppers, leafy greens, and fingerling potatoes. It was priced at $32 that day, but well worth the cost! Didn't end up ordering dessert, but everything looked excellent. Great if you're looking for something a little more special but nothing too fancy! Definitely would recommend this restaurant.

RyMRdIjTGSPwyVQweMGDRA.review_text: I spent a good part of my life in San Francisco, and I have never had a positive food experience at Pier 39. ...until now!  This place is great for groups!  The seafood is fresh, the view is amazing, and the service is en pointe.    My friend just graduated from medical school. To celebrate, she and her husband planned a lunch at Fog Harbor for their family and about 20 of their closest friends. I was really impressed by the way For Harbor was able to accommodate such a large group with such ease.  We were each allowed to order from the regular menu; no pre-fixe menu needed.  Huge plus!  All of the food came out at the same time and nobody's order was incorrect.  On top of that, the food was definitely delicious. Don't miss the calamari, clam chowder, and crab roll!  I'll be coming back to eat those dishes again. As for the prices, they do run a little on the steep side, but it's not totally unreasonable for a seafood restaurant in one of San Francisco's busiest tourist spots. If you have kids, there is a pretty good kids menu, high chairs, and they give crayons and stuff to color on.    Quick note, they validate parking for the Pier 39 Parking Garage. One hour free with validation.

R2247iVcSL6CBUItgheD3w.review_text: Bff and I got very greedy coming here. We were one of the few patrons, as it was 11am on a Thursday morning. I started off with a refreshing blueberry press and we shared a daily special ceviche. Not the best ceviche, but it was decent. Then to add on top of that, I ordered the steamed clams and my friend went with the cioppino. Thank goodness for the "appetizer" size of my clams. Still waaaay too much food, but so delicious. Service was excellent. Prices are on the higher end, so expect to shell out some moola. And don't forget to get your parking validated.

6Bkvmbq6HY28lC-44h05XQ.review_text: I'm giving this place 5 stars for service but 2 stars for food.  I guess that's why it comes out a 3.  Super smiling faces and genuinely nice people that work here but unfortunately have to serve mediocre food.  And for these prices I do expect more flavors.  Their Dungeness crab cakes were hugely disappointing with much more filler taste than crab.  I don't know if they make their crab cakes fresh but if they did they still taste like pre-processed ones with lots of bread crumbs and salt added.  Even the remoulade sauce tasted processed also.  I really wanted to like this place because the bartenders and drinks and hostess were excellent, but the food fell short.

H3dv79xef-wVEEtC8GptYw.review_text: Disappointed experience!   Our dinner. arrive before the waitress brought the complimentary bread. Glass of water never arrived.  My salad was OK but right at the last bite there was a piece of plastic within the veggies.   I would not come back! We got better service at Bubba Gump, just walk a little bit more and you will have a better experience (and view)

JieuBguggKpA_9EDCj-k3A.review_text: Brought out of town visitors here and everyone left happy.  My wife and I shared the garlic crab and really enjoyed it.  Most in the party had chowder and they loved it.  We had a large party with prepaid tip and was surprised to still get excellent service.  This review is specifically for someone wanting a touristy thing on the pier.

JCtU28FH-YySgZd4HxHwDw.review_text: I'm a East Bay Native and have been to the city for many a tour guide trip for guests from out of town and this was my first time eating at Fog Harbor. We had a party of 13, half of which were from various parts of the country and not local to the Bay Area. The experience was hands down one of the best dining experiences I've ever had at a restaurant.  The service was impeccable and the food was to die for. We had a wonderful gentleman named David G as our server. He was attentive and charming and just did an awesome job tending to our large party and his other tables. Will be coming back here again with more friends! Thank you David and Fog Harbor for giving us such a wonderful dining experience! (David deserves a raise or a paid vacation, or both! You are blessed to have such a wonderful server on staff!)  Ordered  Wedge Salad with ranch instead of bleu cheese: it was a half a head of lettuce! huge and good :) Blackberry non alcoholic drink: tasty & refreshing Burger: super yum, caramelized onions were super tasty on this Chocolate Banana Bread Pudding: to.die.for! also tasted the chocolate ooey gooey goodness (mix between a chocolate flourless cake & a molten lava cake) it's like having brownie batter that is half cooked...in my book, super yum! The FRESH baked sourdough bread was AH-MAZING!!!!!! crunchy on the outside and super soft on the inside, I would taken home whole loaves of that had I had a ziploc in my purse :)

zQxDUhxKOHdZygnNRZ-4ng.review_text: Really good food for a touristy place! Had the crab and really enjoyed it.  The drinks where great too!

sPqHcRC--tRanPC-g4pNwQ.review_text: Dine About Town 2014 Review! Before anything, Jennifer A.'s tip caught my eye: "First, go to the visitor's center also on the upper level and get a 15% off coupon for this place." Despite its touristy location, Fog Harbor delivered a DAT meal that was surprisingly delicious and affordable. I would definitely recommend making a reservation through OpenTable because it was packed on a Saturday evening. Our table was started off with complimentary sourdough bread and butter, which is always appreciated. For the appetizer, I opted for the AHI TUNA POKE, which is marinated raw tuna, avocado, mango, and a sesame-soy sauce and wasabi aioli (yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-…). It's normally $16 for their full serving, though we only got a poke pile rather than the poke slices shown in other pictures. The tuna is decently fresh, the mango is refreshing (though not very ripe), the avocado is smooth (also not very ripe), and the aioli ties it all together. My friend chose the BAKED OYSTERS as her appetizer, which came with 4 fresh shucked oysters topped with spinach, bacon and a creamy parmesan sauce (yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-…). Each oyster is normally $2.50, and she enjoyed the rich flavor of each one. For entrees, one friend decided on the SEAFOOD CIOPPINO, which is crab, fresh fish, shrimp, clams, scallops and mussels stewed in a tomato herb broth served with pasta (yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-…). It's a hefty portion normally priced at $30! She said that her favorite part of the dish was the crab. Her boyfriend ordered the CREEKSTONE NY STEAK, a 10 oz steak grilled and topped with whisky peppercorn sauce, served with garlic mashed potatoes and sautéed vegetables (yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-…). It was also a generous portion, normally priced at $27. I chose the GRILLED SALMON, a fillet served on a bed of roasted corn, arugula, red peppers, fingerling potatoes, and tarragon with a citrus beurre blanc (yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-…). Normally $28, the salmon dish is worth it. I have to admit that I was pleasantly surprised by how juicy and moist the salmon meat was, especially given how often I've been underwhelmed by salmon dishes. But, goshdangit, Fog Harbor did it right. *snaps* As our desserts, we each ordered something different: The VANILLA BEAN CRÈME BRULEE, a smooth, creamy custard with caramelized sugar top and a Biscoff cookie, normally $8.50 (yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-…). My favorite, hands down. I tend to avoid crème brulees because past ones I've tried have had sugar tops that were way too thick and overpoweringly sweet and sticky. But the sugar coating is delicate, allowing the custard to really shine through. If you're a fan of egg custard, especially subtly sweet custard, you'll be a fan of their crème brulee. The MOLTEN CHOCOLATE CAKE with a rich creamy chocolate center, served warm with vanilla ice cream and whipped cream, normally $8.50 (yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-…). Many reviewers have complained that this isn't a true molten cake because the inside doesn't ooze melted chocolate, and I would have to agree--it's just a warm, gooey chocolate center. The vanilla bean ice cream is tasty, and I liked that the chocolate cake wasn't overly rich since it paired well with light, fluffy whipped cream. The CHOCOLATE BANANA BREAD PUDDING, a huge square of Fresh Boudin's sourdough bread baked with chocolate pudding, served warm with crème anglaise and vanilla ice cream (most similar to the pumpkin bread pudding, normally $8.50) (yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-…). I asked for the crème on the side because I didn't want it to soak the bread (not a huge fan of soggy bread). The crème itself is very light and was fun to dip, and the banana and sourdough undertones make for an intriguing combination. However, the chocolate is so rich that it overwhelmed even my sweet tooth...ridic. All in all, I would recommend the GRILLED SALMON entree and the VANILLA BEAN CRÈME BRULEE dessert. Don't forget the 15% coupon!

hzKQOJI8-7TM-BstJpSVCA.review_text: Located in the heart of pier 39 you can expected this place to be packed. During lunch time on a Sunday we were told it would be about a 30 minute wait. We decided to sit at the bar instead of waiting for a table. Our bartender/server was very rude. I am not sure if she was having a bad day or what but working with the public she needs to work on her people skills.   We put in our food orders and beer. After we got our beers we were delivered fresh warm sourdough bread. The bread was what dreams are made out of. I knew this place had promise.  Our food came out in a decent amount of time. Meaning I still had one slice of bread let to enjoy with my meal. The greedy monster didn't completely come out. I ordered the salmon club salad and it was good. I was surprised not to be asked how I wanted my salmon cooked as I normally order it rare. It was tasty but not worth the cost.  My husband ordered the fried combo that included fried fish, calamari and shrimp. I had a taste of the fish and calamari which was decent. However my husband wouldn't part with the shrimp because they only gave him two. Wtf??? The two sides were the traditional fries and coleslaw.   Overall the food was decent but seemed overprice. I guess not overpriced per the location but I would considered a bread bowl at boudin or a food truck next time.

DNGlXtmmTK5xcUu4X2AVAg.review_text: Definitely worth the price. The clam chowder was delicious as was the sourdough bread. The crab salad was amazing as well. Plus the views of the pier are hard to beat

wrwdR7aEzx4cu-5uArKsPQ.review_text: Yummy food and a beautiful view. Started off with a cucumber gimlet that was very refreshing. We enjoyed a couple oysters on the half shell which were delish. For my entree I had the Ahi Tuna which I asked for extra rare, it came out perfectly cooked. Or should I say hardly cooked. It was just the way I like it. It was topped with a wasabi aioli and fresh ginger. They complimented each other really well. Noir server Dirk was friendly and very attentive for us being a group of 11. It was nice that he didn't have a problem splitting our check. My husband and I will definitely be back. Looking forward to trying more yummy seafood dishes! :D

2I3OFA1b91p1KXOCCyJdPQ.review_text: I was looking forward to this as reviews were good, and it was the first day of the dungeness crab season.  The service was friendly, but incredibly slow.  It took about 15 minutes to get my one glass of champagne, and I could literally see it sitting at the bar for 5 minutes.  It was a busy Saturday night, but the service was just so slow it was painful.  When my steamed crab finally arrived, it was mediocre quality and it took another 5 minutes for them to check in so that I could tell them that they didn't give me crab crackers.  Despite request, I never got a small fork to actually get the crab out.   I would not recommend it.  I'm sure there are other nice places to try.  The view was however nice and the waiting area with the fireplace was very nice.

0pvY8CHNZzY-0v1AVBO2eQ.review_text: Excellent clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl and the cioppino was delicious as well. I highly recommend either of these dishes.

QMc22rUpBPcRpeoih8Jg_A.review_text: Ordered a whole crab. Pricey at $38 but it was pretty good with the butter. The bread was delicious. From where we sat we could see alcatraz,  part of the bridge and the sea lions on the docks.

le3wfpC1_P2B1jeeOv99FA.review_text: I had my family visiting from Michigan, and what better place to take them then fishermans wharf for sightseeing and lunch? Well, we stumbled across fog harbor and when I told the hostess, Denise, how many people were in our party (4) she said the wait was 10 minutes. Then I said "oh! We also have a baby but she doesn't need a highchair (baby's 6 months and was in her stroller). Denise then proceeds to tell me "oh, well it's a longer wait then...it's kind of an inconvenience to be honest for us to have highchairs and strollers in here." At that point, my father heard Denise, and said "umm..okay, we won't eat here then." Without apologizing or ANYTHING, she just didn't say anything and started talking to her coworker next to her. She was so rude and disrespectful I couldn't believe. I then asked to speak with a manager who didn't know her left from right. We ended up leaving and going to crab house on the wharf where all staff were sooooo nice and friendly and were sweet to my niece. Word of caution...don't eat here, check out crab house right next store for sure!

WhZ9ZgxxZntR7GVkUbOwBQ.review_text: With a delicious sea food menu, Fog harbor fish house puts the perfect twist on fish. Swordfish, clams, octopus and more are presented in the fish market at the entrance of the restaurant. You simply pick your fish or shellfish at the door, tell them how you'd like it prepared (the huge menu on the wall helps you decide the perfect seasonings) and wait at the table for the waiter to serve you drinks. It's always full of people, business men and women, families, tourists, and young people. There is a piece of fish for everyone

5NOHIhem2KGI-wlHi63p9Q.review_text: Had fish & chips.  It was delicious!  The blue cheese garlic bread was yummy.  Would order it especially if you like blue cheese!  We also had the apple cranberry crisp.  That was the best!!

QFJWmKBjJeswP3xFik6GeA.review_text: My first visit in San Francisco and found this restaurant on Yelp.  Since it had good reviews I figured lets check it out. Had the clams, dungeness crab, mussels, in an awesome tomato based sauce, it was delicious! Also loved our waiter David.. He was extremely knowledgeable and was very personable.. Would definitely recommend this place..

vW5WLgkKIntl1IGck0boXA.review_text: The service was pretty disappointing. The food tasted delicious, however you could observe the economic discrimination. The tables that ordered a lot of food were given a significant amount of service to. At one point I believe the manager was walking around my table's area and asked everyone how their meal was except for my table. We did not receive bread or any refills for water while the other tables around us did. I am extremely disappointed because I was expecting to have a great experience here due to the large amount of reviews and high ratings on Yelp, however this place simply failed my expectations.

ExzqN9SYMfMtpfHZfRNWxw.review_text: Place is in a good location. Customer service is great! We requested a table for 9 with a view since we have some visitors from EU and we were accommodated. Wait time is not bad. We made a reservation but we were seated after everybody in the party are present which is ok.  For the food, we order different kind of appetizers, main course and dessert. Overall it was good but the garlic butter is a bit too much butter and the spicy garlic is not what I expected. I would say overall it's not bad. The price is on the higher side. For first-timers I think it would be ok. Are we going to come back? Hmmm, maybe we'll try other seafood restaurant in the area first.

t4o8mWvFo5Q7vwT94h1zaw.review_text: This place actually surprised me. I'm a city native who doesn't expect much from restaurant around Pier 39, but this place was solid and reasonably priced. I had a friend visiting from out of town who wanted oysters, so we came to Fog Harbor. The oysters on the half shell were good, as were the baked oysters. The pleasant surprise was the generous serving of clam chowder in a bread bowl that surpassed my expectations.  Oh, and our server was AMAZING. I feel awful for forgetting his name, but he was attentive at the right times without being intrusive.

LlpymMSmyuxcX6xg9AlyvA.user_location: Salt Lake City, Salt Lake City, UT
LlpymMSmyuxcX6xg9AlyvA.review_text: Pier 39 was the most touristy pier along the road and it was pretty easy to find parking. Once we got there we asked what the best thing was, she's pointed at the clam chowder. That was $10. I got the seafood penne. It was delicious. My friends like the bread bowl the chowder came in.  The only complaint is the amount of time it took after the meal--to get our check split,   We got a cool window seat. There was one tv I saw, there could have been one more but I doubt it. As you walked further inside it's pretty boosie (is that the correct spelling?) so more tvs would make it feel like a buffalo wings or Applebee's.

SfN7jh5KW2WhmNnQtUMlFQ.review_text: Great Place the Food was good. The service was good. and I check the restrooms which was clean. The place was very busy but it was quick service once we was seated.  Try the Clam Chowder Bowl in the Sourdough Bread... Very Good.

nPgBqPJBhQHAp0B_endxmg.review_text: We were in the area and wanted a good seafood meal since we were at the wharf. This place was rated high but we still did not have high expectations... However we were quickly surprised!! The atmosphere is wonderful and the food was delicious! The clam chowder is a must try too!   The portions were pretty good sized! We split a meal and then shared a appetizer and cup of chowder and had left overs!! Will come back next time in area!

SPLrEnub7BR8bVgG_wH1NA.review_text: Great place to celebrate holiday, fresh seafood and well services, their house chardonnay was worth to try btw.

-pJinZaemBvTUyuaL-EvEQ.review_text: I appreciate the follow up from the management as a result of my review. I'd recommend reevaluating the branding and menu to make them more special and less generic. This feels and tastes very much like every other restaurant ever, which can be good but is most often boring.

8LitC9OoezsHsHm_It0QzQ.review_text: Had a great time at Fog harbor house on Saturday night. Our server Brenda was amazing she went out of her way to give us tips on places to watch the football gamer he next day and her recommendations were spot on. Food was sooooo good. Had the whole crab with a bowl of clam chowder plus the view is great. Would recommend to friends/family.

addFMW60hnUvayu7ynh_xg.review_text: On this rainy night at Pier39, I had a great Ciopino and a couple of Anchor Steam, both among the finest of San Francisco.  Funny that the waiter offer to "clean the crab" for $4, essentially to save me the mess of picking the flesh from the shell.  That was the fun part, why would I pay other people to do it for me.  The soup was intense  but the fish was a bit too dry.

5ECtmLzrurE0RcNpmTwXaA.review_text: I am always concerned about places in a very tourist heavy area. For while they might have nice presentation they have nothing forcing them to make an exceptional product.   After waiting 30 minutes we were brought to a very nice dinning room area that overlooked the water. Ordering the calamari to start with a coupon that is provided by the visitors center and to eat my son got the Mac and cheese, my wife got a custom designed linguine with garlic crab dish and I ordered the crab ceviche (avocado, mango and fresh pulled crab meat).  The calamari came and I was worried about the other items we ordered. It was not awful, but tasted like any other frozen squid with breading and very little seasoning which was a little over fried. I even sampled the "aioli" which is really become just a new way for a restaurant to put mayo in a ramekin and call it something cooler. That being said it did not help much and I was not looking forward to the meal.  Then the waitress came with a basket filled with sourdough bread and it was exceptional. Did not ask for it, but the timing was perfect and just as we enjoyed our first piece the good bread... The food arrived-  My ceviche was amazing! The quality of the seafood is evident on the first bite and I felt like the combination of flavors that was more than I expected. The avocado was very flavorful and the mango was such a mild taste that all together it was a perfect mix. I cannot say anything bad about this dish except it was an appetizer and wish I ordered two.  The linguine was cooked with garlic, sun dried tomatoes, spinach and garlic crab meat. It was actually from the chicken penne pasta sub crab and linguine. This was a great way to try some fresh crab meat and the way it was pulled and placed on top of the pasta you could have some crab in every bite. The sun dried tomatoes played a great supporting role of adding color and a great finish to every few bites that were lucky enough to have some in it.  Lastly was my sons Mac and cheese. I never find it worthy of saying much about kid items, but this macaroni and cheese was gourmet and the steamed broccoli about as fresh tasting as can be.  This was a great final bite on our visit to San Fran! We will be back!!!

oZ4zwTAR2C9kGUL2aCGccQ.review_text: Fog Harbor was the choice for a holiday party with my friends from various Banks. About twenty people.  Tip: to get to Pier 39 from Caltrain, just walk to the BART track, pay $2.00 and ride it to Embarcadero. Then get off and walk to the F Street car, pay $2.00. Your other option is to cab there for $12.50 each way.  On to Fog Harbor Fish House:  Good value for large parties.  We did the prix fixe,  for starters every four people were served a platter of yummy calamari perfectly deep fried, cheese toast with fine blue cheese and a small plate of prawns sauteed in a spicy hot marinara (V. good). Next, you get a salad of a few leaves of high quality romaine lettuce with creamy blue cheese or, you can have a white clam chowder. The main entree is either salmon, new york steak, or braised chicken, comes with sauteed zucchini's and pearl onion. Mashed potato's and a dessert of lava cake or tiramisu. $38.00  I had the NY steak, cooked medium, it was tastey, if a bit skinny at 1/2 inch thick cooked.  The excellent romaine salad comes with four pieces of lettuce with a creamy blue cheese dressing; it was perfection. The mashed potatoes and sauteed zucchini were ok.    For dessert, I chose their lava cake: it was very chocolately,& moist n' sweet on the inside; it was served with a side of vanilla ice cream drizzled with more chocolate. A sprig of mint leaf added to the sensation.  My friend had the salmon and it looked phat, well over an inch, about 6 inches by 6 inches. She said it was delicious.  Their coffee was very good: black and delicious.   Decent appetizers, entrees and desserts. I just figure you are paying a very reasonable $33.00 for the food and $5.00 for an excellent water front view, fine linen and silverware. I had to ask for my coffee to get refilled. Ditto for water.  Bathrooms: clean and modern.  Customer service: a bit slow.  Ambience: very nice, trad. American.  Tip: from the BART at Embarcadero, walk upstairs and look for the train tracks and hop on the F Street Car, to Pier 39. Just $2.00  Tip: due to the deluge, we cabbed from Pier 39 to CalTrain at King/4th, it was $12.50 without tip.

8OzzJJBiTCMhLTPd8FC7Cg.review_text: GOD DAMNED DELICIOUS!!!   We had the soup (clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl..obviously) with mixed field greens, the salmon entree, and the pumpkin bread pudding. Service was fast but unobtrusive, great tasting food, and an amazing view.   This will be our new SF tradition!!

W7aNFKA1z_ziofKUaLvgWA.review_text: Everything was absolutely amazing! I took my parents here for dinner and the service was fantastic. Food was even better.

Jk3-Z6Kjb0wUUnXxOI2iNw.review_text: Really enjoyed the Ahi Tuna - rich and light and oh so tender. Get the Crab ceviche, not too much citrus and very full of flavor.  Service is friendly and knowledgeable. Classy atmosphere and a great view of the bay at sunset.

aSRomjeCrjBr1C19o7A_9w.review_text: We are locals and just went here because of good yelp reviews for father's day. Service was good and our waitress was sweet. Except she didn't tell me that there is $4 fee for them to remove the crab meat out of the shell for my ciopinno. We had to send sliders back because they were fishy tasting. They did comp up for those,  but still...gross! My dad actually spit his out. The food was mediocre tourist trap at best. But I guess what can you expect in the heart of pier 39.

Z6Uqx8VsvxhNwgUbr10Rmg.review_text: Just had a fantastic and *fresh* meal with a special friend. I have to say that Khaiman took expert care of us the entire time and also paid close attention to my food allergen issues (gluten intolerance) and recommended substitutes and alternates. What a nice touch. Overall the ambience was superb, the views gorgeous and again, the seafood superb. Lovely night, nice memories.

jghrw3cCQzmmSU4trcspVw.review_text: Great food, great atmosphere.  I had the mixed grill seafood plate and my husband had the fish and chips.  Both were delicious.      We got free blue cheese garlic bread when we checked in thru YELP.  The garlic mashed potatoes were good too.  The service was a little disorganized - food that wasn't ours was brought to our table, I got rice instead of the mashed potatoes I ordered, and we were asked twice if we wanted dessert instead of bringing us the bill which we asked for.  But all in all, a great experience.

t_-o4zeLjbfIT9cydXTeBA.review_text: I typically don't eat along Pier 39 and Fisherman's Wharf as it gets to be too touristy and crowded. The food isn't always the best here, but there are a few exceptions. Fog Harbor is one of them. The view from the window seat is great and romantic in the evening. I ordered the shellfish platter to share and it was pretty big with lots of crab, mussels, clams, shrimp, etc. The price actually wasn't too bad given that the location has tourists galore. Would come back some time if the occasion calls for it.

4yJ0P2JWuvBRpEXPwrAxJQ.review_text: Delicious food, fresh and full of flavor! Our waiter, Oliver, was brilliant and very amiable- he also remembered us from our previous visit which made me and my group feel immediately welcomed. I highly recommend this place for a taste of good seafood and a great seaside view!

p9OUxMKlyRkOueYAeHuXig.review_text: hubs and I decided to start a holiday tradition of spending one day before christmas in the wharf area to relax and spend some qt.  when we got hungry, we checked out a few of the restaurants and for some reason decided to go here. Since it was a late afternoon meal, we were seated right away. the view from the restaurant was pretty awesome. the tables weren't cramped up and restrooms were clean.  I ordered a nojito (since I cant drink) while hubs ordered their cucumber gimlet drink.  they were both really good.  for apps we shared crab cake--crab cake was good but the salad that came with it was warm and soggy. for entree hubs ordered a filet mignon (med well) with mixed veggies while I ordered their seafood plate.  filet mignon was too rare for my husband so although he ate it, he didn't enjoy it.  the squash with his veggie mix weren't that great either.  my seafood plate on the other hand was good... not too much seasoning and the seafood weren't overcooked. for dessert, we ordered the molten chocolate cake with vanilla ice cream.  it was a bit disappointing.  the cake needed to have melted chocolate and the vanilla ice cream tasted weird...more like imitation vanilla with some alcohol. I also thought the fake dessert sample plate that they show you instead of the dessert menu was a bit tacky for a pricier restaurant.  the service was good... food was hit or miss.

4r0-Q5eu4FyGQwYwEcxC3A.review_text: This place is a bit touristy. The bread was good but our service was horrible. The friend that I went there with and I are still trying to figure stuff out with her bank because she double charged her and then charged me for my half as well. She also NEVER refilled my drinks and I always had to ask for more water from someone that seemed like the manager.  I got the fish and chips and she got the half garlic crab. It was good, but there was hardly any meat in the crab for the price. I guess it is expected for a touristy place.  Probably wouldn't go here again. THere are amazing places to eat in the city and I would just avoid this place for another down the street or a uber ride away!

H60aHCCtSMmY8j4NfDl0Ew.review_text: My husband and I had dinner at Fog Harbor Fish House our first night in San Francisco. We had made our reservations on Yelp and they were ready for us when we arrived. The service was excellent as was the food!   Tip: when you make your reservation, request a table by the window with a view of the bay. It's beautiful and very romantic. I look forward to coming back again!

LPLzukJcwi6HgtgpR_MTvA.review_text: Family had a great dinner! We started with the calamari because it was free with a coupon from the Savings Fun Pack (from Visitor's Center). The calamari was very good with a lemon aioli. The complimentary warm sourdough with butter is delicious. This restaurant is kid friendly with an extensive kid's menu. Hubby had the mixed grill and loved it. I had the crab cake entree but substituted the sides to be veggies and wild rice. The banana chocolate bread pudding was amazing. A great place with excellent attentive service. Definitely will come here again.

AgQv3bU6y_XOWo2bVaouFw.review_text: Delicious!  The salmon was the freshest I have ever tasted.  Madison was the best waitress ever!  Over the top service!

z2gPCQfW2Nv6FKyIFtiUug.review_text: We had a great lunch and our server, Madison, made the experience special.  She was attentive and gave excellent service.  The clam chowder was very good and the meal was good.  We'll be back!

IKdLCnD2eFdwDv0OmCfAVA.review_text: Nothing special about the food, which isn't a bad thing in this case.  Its good fresh seafood that isn't heavily seasoned.  I had the mix grill and it was just what I was looking for, quality, well cooked, fresh fish.  The one special thing is they had the best sourdough of my vacation!

om5ZiponkpRqUNa3pVPiRg.review_text: I have a feeling my local friends would cringe that I ate at this tourist destination, but tourists need good food too. I have to admit that my meal at Fog Harbor Fish House was just as tasty as some of the local hotspots i"ve tried. And the view of the pier was also quite lovely.  Our waiter was eager to please and when he thought he had mixed up my wine with a colleague's wine I thought he was going to have a slight heart attack. He apologized about 80 times and bought us some delish chocolate banana bread pudding (yuummm) for dessert.  We didn't even care about the mixup, but we're never ones to say no to free dessert.  However, before dessert comes apps and entrees. For apps we ordered the crab ceviche and shrimp cocktail. The crab ceviche itself was pretty tasty, but they were pretty skimpy with the chips that came with it. 4 total chips for our group of 5! The shrimp cocktail were a bit wimpy looking, especially for SF where I've had some incredible seafood, but they still tasted good.  My entree was incredible. I ordered off the special menu for the night. Pesto halibut that came with mozzarella cheese, figs and some other delicious goodies on the side.  This was the best fish I remember enjoying in a long time. Hopefully they'll be adding it to their main menu!  I'd definitely go back during my frequent trips to SF and may even drag some local friends with me next time!

XC8wJ5LBdDjosBGddqdRzA.review_text: We had a great meal here. We came with a party of 8 at about 5:30pm on a Thursday and were seated promptly.   The beer selection was nice with plenty of good local favorites.  Fried Calamari: I was disappointed that there were no tentacles. They were cooked properly but the breading was unimaginative. Not bad but not great.  Blue Cheese Bread: very rich and delicious.  Most of us ordered some fried seafood. I had the combo and others had the fish & chips. The fried fish is excellent: beer battered, tender and juicy. I also really enjoyed the fried shrimp. They were butterflied and cooked perfectly with a nice panko coating. The disappointing thing was that I only got one piece of fish and two shrimp and a big pile of calamari. The fries were standard.  My brother ordered the Cioppino. I got to taste it and it was very good. I've had lots of cioppino since moving to the area and I'd say this is one of the best around.  To sum up: I highly recommend this place if you're looking for a good meal on Pier 39. Skip the calamari and the fried seafood combo (because of the calamari) but try the fish & chips, shrimp & chips, or the cioppino which were all excellent.

8UUDaxYgPAbMTzGM4EQmPw.review_text: Amazing view. Incredible food. The clam chowder bread bowl was to die for! Great staff...extra kudos to Leslie, he was so nice and hospitable!

hKirHL9iYVRsFlzipzfMWg.review_text: My wife and I were impressed with the prior reviews so we gave it a try. We were also pleased with prompt attentive service and a very fresh lunch. She had the crab avocado Caesar salad and I had the crab roll. Both were very good lunch sized portions. We had the ginger lemonade as well.   The total bill was $55 (after we added tip) which was a little pricey for lunch but we enjoyed the view and in a touristy area we sort of expected it.   Definitely recommended.

bunWqtzZdNai863K4LSILg.review_text: We were celebrating my wife's birthday.  The food was tasty.   My wife had the crab cakes, she liked them, but she felt more crab could of been added .  I had the pan fried sole on white beans with  spinach; enjoyed it very much.  Good choice.

GV0ZLqZ6Jmo8Z5diY5EbRA.review_text: Absolutely loved this place! Place was great with an amazing view. Excellent service and fantabulous food: fresh, fast, classy.  Highly recommend to those who love SeaFood!  Great atmosphere and very busy place

3KK7L2Q6NMfJA1Ky4Ntmdg.review_text: My friend was determined to find the best tasting clam chowder in San Francisco, so while we were at Fisherman's Wharf, he found Fog Harbor Fish House on Yelp. Located at Pier 39, the restaurant is surprisingly fancy schmancy with a very weekend-at-the-Hamptons vibe; it was lunch time and every table had wine glasses. We were seated at a U-shaped booth with a nice view and the ambiance made us feel as though we could've been anywhere -- Newport Beach, Maine, 1990s SF.  I was in the mood for something sweet so my girlfriend and I asked for a dessert menu while my friend ordered the clam chowder bowl ($8) he wanted. Our server came back with a tray filled with all the various desserts they offer. Impressive and such a cool way to show what's on the menu! My friend's clam chowder was fresh, tasty, and filled with clams. The bread bowl it was served in was just as tasty as the chowder. My Blondie with vanilla ice cream was a large enough dessert for two, but I managed to finish it myself. It was that good.  Fog Harbor is a classy place I wouldn't mind visiting again for a nice lunch, snack, or dessert with family or friends.

IjfRUwsQ1ECzI-5Y3ARDPA.review_text: This place has a beautiful view. The food is also very good. Service was excellent. We had the free appetizer with yelp check in and it was ok. The shellfish platter for 2 at $55 was very good. Fresh seafood a must while in S.F. The dessert creme brulee was just ok.  Would come here again for the view and seafood.

PXsth8wwIh8YS9pRloLbZg.review_text: I just went here last night. The service was great. The food was delicious. The view was even better. I ordered lobster with mash potatoes and veggies. So good $39. My boyfriend ordered a crab sandwich -and fries 19$. He said it was okay. The waiter made sure we were attended to and had all our needs through out the dinner. I would recommend this place to anyone asking. Perfect for dates.

glF-xIF7W6TefGlJa0_66w.review_text: Wow, wow and wow! Top notch! Really like this place. The food and bonus views are excellent! The food quality is really there! The clam chowder is excellent; tasty served perfectly temperatured, the fish and chips delicious with just the right amount of crisp to the batter and French fries. Pan seared chicken breast with mashed potatoes is tasty and delightful. On top of the tasty food you will enjoy the views of water. Love it! You won't be disappointed with food and views!

iBcJm4Pch5Q6dIisAn9HJQ.review_text: Clam chowder was fantastic and jumbo shrimp cocktail was very fresh but sorely disappointed at our server Amy. She just handed us the 2 menus, didn't inform us of the specials. We had to hear it from the other table's server. She also didn't check back with us while eating. It took her a long time to process our payment. Great views and food , bad service .

CLFknBpbWbvvfaZ00Be7uw.review_text: We had a last minute urge for some seafood and considering it was Labor Day Monday, our options were pretty limited. Our usual spots were all closed, I saw the strong rating on Yelp so i figured, what the hell--give the tourist trap a try. Turns out we both really liked the meal. We had a Caesar salad and cioppino.   Don't come here expecting mission-hipster. It is pretty touristy so the service is actually quite respectable. Forgot to mention, they do have great views!!

_Wqqw3rApGoF7A7z_GAnrQ.review_text: The food, service and overall atmosphere were INCREDIBLE.  Chef Adolfo is a master at his craft, knows about every single item on the menu and can read his customers' perfectly well.    What a great experience! I will come back here when I'm back in SF and will never forget the wonderful service we received at the Fog Harbour :)

HfsP4edajwdVVnBPZRGt6Q.review_text: The view is to die for and the atmosphere very nice. Staff is friendly.   I think the food was over priced and could have been better.  We enjoyed some yummy drinks but left a little disappointed with the bland flavors.    Nothing's to write home about unless you want to sit with a great view and a delicious drink.

jqWHYNghfGm4JL06FuaHng.review_text: I came for lunch because I was sightseeing on the Wharf. I was seated right away but I felt a little awkward. I was by myself and they stuck me in a booth instead of giving me a twoseater.   I ordered their organic agave margarita which was wow! Very tangy and boozy! I couldn't drink too much before my food arrived else I would have been stumbling out of there. They also did not give me any water until I asked for some. They brought out the fresh sourdough bread which was nice but they gave me a full basket, it was a bit of a waste. One person would never eat six pieces of bread.  I ordered the crab roll with sweet potato fries. It came out lightning fast and it was pretty good. The sweet potato fries were nothing special but the crab roll was pretty darn delicious.

xiOT2NSYHRZJrZwW-dXPtQ.review_text: Every now and then you have a dinner so memorable that just thinking about it makes you want to turn back time and enjoy it again.   This was that dinner. The service - outstanding! Thank you to Khaiman who waited on us. We never wanted for anything, and all of your recommendations were wonderfully spot on!    This was our second visit, we look forward to returning soon, and bringing along a few friends to share the joy.

MZyMY-nW2ChwIs7ZhELOTQ.review_text: Stopped in for a late lunch on Saturday afternoon around 2pm with my gf. We were both pretty hungry so just opted to sit at the bar, where the service was prompt, attentive and overall very good.   We decided to split the baked oysters, a house salad w/chicken and the sliders. Overall was very pleased, especially with the oysters and the sliders. The hot and fresh sourdough bread was also nice and came out early on.   Only mild complaint was the food took a bit longer than expected considering what we ordered but to be fair the place was packed the entire time we were there.   If you can get, or are willing to wait for, a seat closer to the window you've got quite the view of the sea lions, definitely a nice touch. As much a tourist trap as I expected this to be it really wasn't and I was pleased w/my visit.

PyTg7Np9pZZsaNdRqdiYIw.review_text: Despite of a good friend's suggestion to go to Franciscan Restaurant, I went here instead and never looked back.  Came here on a Sunday during lunch hours and it was packed. We (a party of 5) had to wait for about 30 minutes but it was definitely worthwhile. I definitely loved the view that we had from our window-side table. Anyhow, I ordered their crab cake platter and it was really gratifying. To me that's usually a sign that they only use quality ingredients :)  Expect the service to be a little bit slow, though. It is just a really busy place, but nevertheless, it is an enjoyable venue to have good food and good conversation.

aWNlKh6COj4BcwaDn0c5Sg.review_text: This was the best seafood experience we had in San Francisco. The sourdough clam chowder bowl was most delicious and I would recommend that to anyone who loves clam chowder. My husband had ahi tuna for his main app and he couldn't get enough of it. He said the next time he is working in San Francisco he will order this and have it delivered to his hotel!! I had the lobster Mac and cheese for the main app and it was pretty dang good. Surprised at how much lobster was actually in the Mac and cheese. The server was very attentive even though this place was packed and they were so busy. I was happy with the food and the service.

N8wsEh3_NTUwm4kNp1pLHA.review_text: I have been coming here for over 9 years, since I was a freshman in college and just wanted some good clam chowder. Well this place had it, and even when they changed owners their clam chowder didn't.  This time I came and Brenda, our server, was awesome. She brought us plenty of crackers and plenty of bread. Super thoughtful, even though we weren't buying their expensive dishes. #soupischeap  Helpful hint: don't get their breadbowl. Get the clam chowder and eat their free sour dough bread.  #beatthesystem

SfdhgaDL5ck7BI9hrH9tiA.review_text: So delicious! Everything was perfectly cooked and tender- nothing dry or rubbery. The shellfish platter is a must! We got it with Cajun spice added in, which I highly recommend.  The blond bartender was amazing,  and made sure we were taking care of all night. Any rum drinkers need to try the escape from Alcatraz.  To finish off, we had the apple crisp, which was perfect. Warm and cinnamony :)  At the end of the meal, the manager came by the table to check in on us.  All around it was great service and even better food.

_V1v1Ez_b1L6oBglnEyKEQ.review_text: Ate a late lunch here on Sunday 2/17/13 after a great tour of Alcatraz.  I loved the hot from the oven sour dough bread.    The food came out quick- I ordered the beet salad w/ grilled chicken and blue cheese dressing.  Fog Harbor has the best blue cheese I've tasted in a long time- I was bummed to hear that they don't make it but nonetheless, it was good.  The salad itself was light on beets which was a bummer and my only complaint is that it could have been a larger portion esp. when I ordered it as an entree.  My boyfriend ordered the fried combo and said it was good.  His portion was huge!  Our server Martin was attentive and although he was busy, he didn't leave us wondering where he was as he checked in often.  The restaurant is nice- unfortunately, we weren't seated w/ a view of the water but at that point it was fine- all we wanted was food.      I would recommend Fog Harbor

vfINAq_bjbZrJheUp0Dc8w.review_text: Our server Madison was adorable! She shared the history behind the restaurant which is fascinating, gave great meal suggestions, and was fast and accurate with our order. On her recommendation, we will be back for the fresh crab and AMAZING desserts!! Loved it!

P_eWth28VhlYmCRVi8qaEw.review_text: I want to love this place, I really do, but the service totally blew it for me.  We made a reservation a day in advance and for a later time in the evening. Like everywhere else I ate in my San Fran trip, we read reviews and wanted to go to the best places. The interesting thing was that we had a reservation but other people got seated before us. We were right on time and the other people were walk ins. We also went to grab a drink at the bar while we waited and a tiny drink had a hefty price tag of $15. Not to mention it took the entire 15 minutes while we waited to get the drink.  We finally got to our table and sat there for 10 minutes before we got menus, water, or any kind of service or attention. Finally a gentlemen came up and greeted us and asked us what we wanted. By that time we were ready to just order anything and get out of there. We got the blue cheese bread that was available for free if you checked in on yelp. I ordered the crab cakes and my boyfriend ordered the Surf and Turf.   A couple minutes later we were greeted by our actual server, and you could tell he was a bit flustered. He apologized and definitely made up for the horrible experience that we had had up until that point. He was really relaxed and gave us great recommendations on local spots to check out and go out and have late night drinks at.
