I wish this place was the 4-5 star rating experience that I see most people have, but maybe we just got "lucky" and it was an off night for the crew.

LecyBjohZL6LW-pXt5PTeg.review_text: My eyes were bigger than my stomach here.   Had the (free) bleu cheese garlic bread with the starter Dungeness crab cakes and house salad with balsamic vinaigrette dressing. It all tasted fine, but pricy for the portions that you're served. Unable to stop myself, I also got the apple crisp for dessert and it was very good. My server was prompt, attentive, and friendly which made for a nice dining experience. Also had an excellent view of the water.   A nice place to eat on Pier 39, but pricier. Definitely not some place I'd come to regularly, but a good place to eat if you're already down by the wharf.

ybXYA7WyOkEHikcp5A-aUw.review_text: The fish and vegetables are cooked perfectly!  I had the mixed grill & I recommend that if you can't make up your mind what kind of fish to have.  Very friendly & professional staff.  The sourdough bread is fresh and warm.

LPS3YJZik6UURsnTTYkhXw.review_text: View was great. Clam chowder was good, oyster (raw) was fresh, crab linguini and cioppino was good. The problem were that I got a shrimp shell in my chowder and I got food poison afterward :(

Ld0HLICQ0GisBQ-P7YO0lw.review_text: For Pier 39, this is about as good as it gets. Most of the food at Pier 39 is greasy tourist crap, but this place is actually pretty good. Overall the seafood is fresh and tasty. I wouldn't go so far to say that this is the best seafood I've ever had but it's been my go to place for seafood in SF. You want to make sure to book a reservation a day or two in advance unless you're ok with having dinner at 4:00. The reason I took off a star is that although the staff is friendly they're pretty inexperienced. They're going to forget to bring you water. And bread. And that extra lemon you asked for 15 minutes ago. It's a fact. No matter which server you get. But if you're patient and persistent enough you will eventually get those things and your order. Last time we were there I told them on the reservation that it was our anniversary so they decorated the table with flowers, a candle, and they wrote happy anniversary on the paper table cloth. It was really sweet and I enjoyed that extra care.

K_YEosF3GuyhlSYb6-OklQ.review_text: CLAM CHOWDER SOOOO GOOD Pros - very generous with the seafood, not too many potatoes Cons - sourdough bread too hard to eat - salad is literally 4 pieces of giant lettuce, looks like it took 3 minutes to make

Ri_MoRabNS4dR4V0g7xcYA.review_text: I had the mixed grill, it was salmon, swordfish, and shrimp. It was probably my favorite meal of the entire trip to San Francisco. Waitress was very nice. Prices were a little bit on the expensive side.

r9oueOmGTqRlg-ah6XnFsA.review_text: This place was great!  Great views of the craziness on the streets, the bay, and it was clear enough for us to see Alcatraz from the bar.  My friends and I were hanging out at the bar, and our bartender Brittany made it even better.  She took care of us, attentive, made great drinks, and was just really cool to talk to - kind of like we were hanging out with her too.

cZB0SRmu34stmSKNQdp2nw.review_text: We flew into SF from NJ for an overnight, on our way to Hawaii. We chose Fog Harbor House because of excellent reviews, their sustainable fish program, amazing views and their Ciopinno sounded amazing! The Ciopinno, Ahi & Calamari lived up to all the reviews! The Red Chili Paste Garlic Shrimp was the best shrimp appetizer I ever had! Other members in our party highly recommend the Clam Chowder as well. Desserts were equally as good!  Our waiter was excellent: attentive, courteous, funny and enjoyable. Fog Harbor House is clearly "The Gem of the Wharf"!

QD1GBVubTtYoYFpq4SjylQ.review_text: The food was good, the service was great, and the view was fantastic!

N0SJIKDLyo4005hgXeOT6g.review_text: I really don't like comparing restaurants BUT since I had the opportunity to eat at Fog Harbor and Crab house, which both are seafood restaurants and at pier 39, why not?  Fog Harbor takes the cake between the two in my opinion.    First off, the complimentary bread was fresh out of the oven and heated!  I swear the bread was like crack!  I just couldn't stop eating it.  Despite being on a mission to lose weight and 'low carb' it, I couldn't help myself.  The bread served deserved 5 stars on its own!  The salad was refreshing and tasty!  They use mixed greens, unlike the other competitor with their iceberg.    The clam chowder was outstanding!  It had a real good amount of clams in it.  It was very hearty and filled me up.  Mama dukes had it in a bread bowl and I ordered the regular bowl, which was fine because they serve more than enough complimentary sourdough bread.  The crab & shrimp sandwich was a little too bland for my taste though.  I think it needed a little more flavor to it.  Perhaps salt?    Our server was a sweetheart.  Kept checking up on us and he looked like Liam Hemsworth.  A total plus!  The end to our meal is even sweeter with our Biscoff cookie.  Can't get any better than that!  If I had to choose between which seafood restaurant I'd like to eat at, it would be Fog Harbor!

yyFhjaliPS5kDVIFkAbj8Q.review_text: I found this so disappointing. We were seated and a waiter came to talk to us and during that time the hostess moved us to another table without explanation. The new server did not come for a while. Service was terrible... Maybe because we were two women taking about space.   The food was terrible the clam chowder was thick and was like wallpaper paste. Too much flour.  The lobster tasted frozen  wet and mealy. The crab stuffing was more of  a bad crab salad with mayo.  The food came wrong. Need I go on??? They did take one entree off but the experience was so bad.

_4x70B1gvBmqqa9TzUamYA.review_text: Okay, yes, my opinion of this delightful establishment is *slightly* biased because it was a corporate dinner so I REALLY enjoyed it.  But overall, the food is fantastic, the service was SO awesome (the waiter swept away the table crumbs between courses) and to entice you to get dessert, servers bring a tray of ready-prepared desserts to your table for you to peruse (and then bring you a new one so it doesn't have everyone else's breath and germs from being carted around).  I will totally look forward to returning to this restaurant!

dmyZ4TDN18z1-mRRdzY_8A.review_text: Excellent experience! Our server recommended the special, which was a fresh wild salmon atop an arugula salad with cranberries and couscous. It was incredible.  The views of the bay were also fantastic, especially watching the sunset.  I highly recommend this place.

B_LJAvIKcSbV3RzeyxWyVQ.review_text: Staff members were friendly and attentive, great views (they were even kind enough to make a space for us by the window), and yummy food! Would highly recommend during your trip to San Fran!

UQJgg09mdsSzqO8kf1xoCA.review_text: The food was great, but the service was very disappointing. The salad arrived well before drinks and bread, water wasn't refilled, and the waiter was completely inattentive.

586YRBE4LOjVbibCfcrWSw.review_text: restaurant is beautiful, so is the view, and the service was great.  but the  cracked crab was really small. not worth the effort to get it out of the shell, or the money.

w7rb4WRsCH7xieeYEdvfcg.review_text: This place is pretty good.   First off, free bleu cheese bread with Yelp check-in. (Win) Why is this not a more popular thing?? Totally delish.   The whole garlic roasted crab with corn on the cob and garlic potatoes was incredible. The server tied on my bib and there I was, a respectable adult, viciously ripping open the exoskeleton of an enormous crustacean, devouring it with my fingers, making an enormous mess, drinking wine and expecting to still be taken seriously.    Note: Whatever you do, don't order the shrimp. Unless of course you'd like to pay $22 for eight small, slightly overdone shrimp on two skewers over a bed of raw baby spinach that tastes as if it has been drenched in dirty fish juice, with a few cubes of tasteless butternut squash.

yy4nxTyau9ntkDASY4mDWg.review_text: Food was good and service was ok. Nothing outstanding. Our waitress, although nice was not on top of drinks.

zhD0kT_BL9qrTY87Ki4H-g.review_text: I had some friends visiting and they wanted two things: a restaurant near the water and seafood. I ended up picking this place, I was a little worried it was going to be ultra touristy, since it's at Pier 39. I was pleasantly surprised the restaurant is really nice! And definitely not overly gimmicky or anything.             The food: I did the classic, clam chowder bread bowl, it was good! And I ordered a side of fries, which wasn't on the menu, but they were accommodating. One friend got a side of oysters and the clam chowder bread bowl, they enjoyed it. And one got the crab roll, also good. And another got the crab cakes, and had this mixed cider drink that was really good. All in all everyone enjoyed their meal!

ICPxGwIrC6sR-5ZJKYBkmQ.review_text: I ate here about two weeks ago so this review is well overdue. I explained to the waiter that I don't use yelp and my experience that night inspired me to join and write a review. I want to start off with the service.  My girlfriend and I had Khaiman which was one of the best servers I have had. Next was the food.  The food was great and it was a fair price for good quality.  We also had a view of the bay which my girlfriend loved...I give it 5 stars because I was inspired here to spread the word about this place.

HSNtfiDUYQ6ZCNHxKQM_ZA.review_text: Fog Harbor was an amazing dinner! I had the swordfish and my girlfriend had the NY steak - both of which could be described as mouth watering because of the way each melted. We also had the 1/2 lb garlic crab for a starter and this was by far the best crab I have ever eaten!   Easily, The flavor and freshness of our entire meal was way beyond what I would have ever expected! Our waitress Jac was great too, making sure we loved our different 'vegie cocktails' and that our dinner was enjoyable.   Highly recommend!!

fCiuhL226aZKTZenZ5s6ew.review_text: Great food.  The king salmon was awesome and amazing jumbo shrimp cocktail.  They even gave us tape to fix a shoe.

6yhihIpGwOpGKfvkKPP5KQ.review_text: Amazing food and a beautiful atmosphere. Outstanding service; our waiter, Khaiman, was fun, helpful, fast, and just on it. He really made this place standout in my mind.   I won't lie - it's a bit expensive and probably more deserving of a $$$ rating, but it was definitely worth it. The food was absolutely delicious (get the clam chowder no matter what) and super filling, and the service is top notch.

mMtbc6HKpoeu1YoKmErlQw.review_text: Just Delightful!  I was in San Francisco for a conference and had an early dinner at the Fish House. We had an amazing view and the food was fresh and flavorful!  I strongly encourage anyone who is going to be in the area to try this restaurant, even the prices were reasonable. A 5* all around!

9lvNde59u8sLxBQx2lih2g.review_text: Had a wonderful experience here. Our waitress Meron was absolutely amazing. The food was delicious & I would definitely recommend this place to anyone visiting the area. The clam chowder is a must!

A0WOv3yex9LvvnEJPnyA6Q.review_text: Went for dinner with a fairly sizable group of friends, had no trouble with seating because we'd made a reservation ~6 hours in advance.  Everything was fine, though there was some miscommunication about what we'd ordered the staff was in general perfectly friendly.  I ordered bleu cheese garlic bread (this was really good, actually) and the ahi dish as my main. The ahi was underwhelming: quite bland, in part I'm sure because it was overcooked. To be fair, the presentation of the fish was pretty well done (heh). It was dressed with what I'm assuming was supposed to be a wasabi paste which, though already weak, was completely overpowered by the pickled ginger  scattered liberally over the fish.  If I were to come here again, I'd give their "higher end" dishes a pass, I think, and go straight for the fish 'n chips, which looked much more promising once I'd seen it.  If you're a one-plate kind of eater, this can be a $$ restaurant; if you tend to get a starter *and* a main, like I generally do, you'll quickly find yourself in the $$$ range, especially when you add a few drinks to the equation.

iWbiZ6PshZ0XqVJpF55ciw.review_text: Ordered salmon BLT, chicken sandwich, garlic cheese bread, clam chowder, chicken penne, and crimbolee for party of 4. The food was fresh and hot. The clam chowder was really good wished I ordered a bigger portion.   The salmon BLT was average the fish was too rare and bland. The penne was ok with good quality cheese. The crimbolee was bomb.   The place had great views of Alcatraz and SFO bay as it is located in Pier 39. Therefore the location and view comes for a price.   Since the dessert and chowder was awesome I would give this place 3 stars. Next time I may try the street vendors nearby as that may hurt the wallet less.

dEfQpRMik90owekQQhxLrw.review_text: Madison the waitress was awesome and this was the best salmon I've ever had. With all seriousness

DPBXrJey1x2SvpRIgmEhZA.review_text: This restaurant has the best view of Pier 39 and Alcatraz Island.  They also validate parking for 1 hr (at the parking structure across the street)  The restaurant had an excellent ambiance. The bowl of Clam chowder was good ($10) and the Mixed seafood grill was excellent (salmon, swordfish, shrimp with broccoli and 1/2 rice and 1/2 mashed potatoes - $26)  I'll be back next time :)

Uuz994E5Pa3R8jljncsgPA.review_text: Five star baby! No doubt.   If you know me I'm a big BIG seafood lover! My daughter and I were in search of clam chowder at the pier and we found this place on yelp so we decided to have brunch here :) so glad we came because everything we ordered was SOOOO PERFECT! Even the customer service was great! I'm sorry I do not remember her name :(   As you can see my pictures, we ordered mimosa, sour dough bread bowl clam chowder, fish n chips for my daughter and seafood cioppino for myself. Our dessert was chocolate soufflé. My daughter picked it. Good choice :)   Definitely coming back to have more clam chowder in bread bowl! Next time, we're gonna get our own. Yes, that's how yummy it is!

SgtdcFkrkMsEhfd9aDWNbA.review_text: Great Food!  Had the Clam Chowder and the Surf and Turf.  Excellent service and food!

OR593sPhK-32kift_bUrTg.review_text: I came here for my birthday recently, and I must say, not too shabby.  I generally stroll down Pier 39 just because I love the pier/ocean view, and I've always see this restaurant.  Truth be told, I thought it was one of those upscale, dress up like a douche type restaurants.  I was wrong.  I was coming from San Jose, and was planning on having dinner before I go back home.  I was craving for sea food.  You come to San Francisco, you gotta have some sea food if not steak.  Anyways, I was looking for seafood, and found some reviews that shows this place was pretty good.  I didn't know how reservations were, so I had made reservations via Yelp.  When I did it on Yelp, my reservation became at 9:30PM. Meh, lame.   So we came to Pier 39 walked around a bit, and said screw it.  Let's just ask them how long the wait is.  If it's longer than expected, we've already made reservations anyways.  So we walk up to the restaurant and their layout is quite cozy and warm for those who have to wait.  They have a nice little fireplace that will keep you warm because everyone knows Frisco can get quite cold.  So anyways, I ask the young woman at the podium about the wait time, and suggested I would like a window view.  I didn't expect it to be available considering it's around 6-7ish.  She took me by surprise and said, we are currently cleaning the table right now, and it's window view.  We sat down for like literally 2-3 minutes boom, here comes our waiter--let's go!  Omg, the view was amazing, I mean of course, I'm a sucker for scenery, but damn.  We sat towards the back, window view of the hills and the bridge, to the left was Alcatraz.  Perfect.   Our waiter was Shawn, absolutely amazing.  Very fast pace, generous, and helpful on the suggestions.  My brother thought differently, felt although he could have been more helpful.  So.. Maybe I was more excited on eating than service. Who knows!  OK, food:  Quite expensive if you ask me, but was it worth it? Yes and no.  Some of the items, you can go out to the fish market and get it for cheaper.  But how it was cooked, well.. Stay tuned.  1/2 Oysters:  Mini oysters was what it was really.  The sauce they had made was delicious, I don't remember what it was, but I have pictures. Haha! Foodie!  It was placed over some ice to keep it cool, which everyone should place raw fish over ice, if you don't... Ugh...  Crab Cakes:  Oh my, these were so good.  They were going for $16, only two pieces, which I felt kind of ripped off.  I cannot deny it, they were bomb!  Once in a while, yes worth the $16. Lol, I'm all for cheap eats.  Bread Bowl:  Personally, I feel although they were better than Boudins.  I had Boudins down the street where you had to get it via cafeteria style and I am not a fan. This bread bowl was much smaller though, but you could taste the clam chowder better.  Not too much breading either, just enough to distribute.  Fog Harbor Burger:  Made was Angus Chuck Patty was quite amazing.  Definitely cooked to perfection without asking.  Medium rare, but not too rare that it made you feel weirded out to eat it.  They got it down as far as burger goes.  Fog Harbor 1/2 Lobster/Crab Meat:  Ok... This was quite disappointing.  This was their current specialty on the menu, and I honestly felt like I should have just gotten a full damn lobster tail.  The crab meat was just baked crab.  Nothing special about it.  They charged me a little more than just the lobster tail.  I prefer the lobster tail so much more than to order this again.  Fish and Chips:  Fried to a golden texture, very delish.  On point  Not much I can really say, I didn't really eat it.  My boyfriend ordered it. :P Sorry guys  Overall my experience was great.  The best part was that I got to see the sunset, and oh yea, even if you're not facing the window, there are mirrors so you can reflect the image.  I sat right in front which had the perfect view.  I loved it.

reLK-ESxajUVe-h2x3QsQQ.review_text: $16 mango crab/lobster? (don't remember if it was crab or lobster) ceviche with chips appetizer   $10 Clam chowder in a fresh baked sourdough bread bowl   $26 Mixed Grill -Grilled Salmon, Swordfish and Shrimp substituted with chimichuri sauce, sauteed vegetables, and substituted with potatoes.   $19 Crab Roll- Crab, celery, shallot aioli, substituted with French roll   Free sourdough bread with butter  Long wait (~1 hour.  ~40 minutes outside to be seated, ~20 minutes to be served) was well worth the food.    Waitress was nice to let me substitute my foods and also giving options.  First time having swordfish.  It was an interesting taste and texture. It tasted like some kind of cheese but my significant other said it tasted like chicken.     We got free sweet potato fries because the Crab Roll came with regular fries instead of sweet potato.  So we got a plate of our fries and we got to keep the sweet potato fries for free!

p_Sm9dip5o8lWBDDrNBI3w.review_text: Out of all the restaurants on the pier this one might be the best. Great location overlooking the San Francisco harbor, and the menu makes you hungry after going over each item. The service was good, our waiter suggested a few places to see as well as other restaurants to try while staying in the city. Cioppino was excellent, hearty, rich broth and plenty of seafood to satisfy any appetite. Can't go wrong with this house.

-eLhFfFNPT5fOD3jQxknvQ.review_text: Surprised to find this hidden gem in tourist central. Lots of different fresh seafood selections instead of the usual fish and chips. Quick and attentive service! They have Robledo on the wine list!

TPBi02MkG1hJ2KulG7eKrA.review_text: Went for lunch the day after our anniversary and we were under dressed. This is really a beautiful  restaurant with a magnificent view. Ok now your asking why only 4 stars? Simply the food was great the service superb and the view as mentioned simply the best, It unfortunately is a simple victim of its own position., on the pier which makes it way to touristy for my taste. Very very nice but just too much geared for the tourist crowd. Not bad but not 5 stars.

An0B-f1WzBr8QFZKzzYs0Q.review_text: DELICIOUS!   This food here was absolutely amazing, and I wish I could eat here everyday. The employees were extremely friendly, and we had awesome waiter. We made a last minute reservation on yelp, showed up, and we were seated right on time and at a table with a view of the water!   We ordered calamari with a lemon aioli sauce- best calamari I've ever eaten and with a unique sauce. I ordered lobster tail and filet mignon. My filet mignon was a bit overdone for medium, but it was still extremely tasty and the lobster was cooked to perfection. My date ordered the live lobster and he said it was also extremely good.   I can't wait to go back here again next time I head up to the city!

DxeNa6k3TEekeiF4wM-C9w.review_text: Great views of the harbor hence the name fog harbor fish house. I had the Crab sandwich which was loaded with crab meat and served in deliciously toasted bread. The oysters were also great along with the crab dip. If you like seafood this is a great place to stop in. We ate at the bar so we didn't have to wait for a table and had great service from the bartender.

6m3zubQEz3739awQb2F8CQ.review_text: The clam chowder was good. They did not take the time to de-vein the shrimp, yet they cut the backs as if the purpose was just to slice it and not remove the fecal matter. If you are in the area, go somewhere else.

_tqkd2SxrtGaOZXxxyi4Gg.review_text: We have a large party of 9 for Mother's day dinner.  1. Reservation, with open table was easy. However, I am very disappointed at their services. First off, I have requested 4 times (4x) to sit by the window and they said no problem four time.. ended up sitting by the bathroom!  2. if you don't ask, they won't give you. I have to ask for bread and water. LOL.. seriously needed to ask them to fill our water, but there were 6 cups only 2 were filled up.. and the empty one is right next to the full one!! WTF.. what kind of service was that.  3. no surprise with food, nothing really worth raving about.   I don't think i would consider there again, especially with large group. BTW, they do charge a standard 18% surcharge for large groups..

T6fk18hJADtrVTRoqBKd1Q.review_text: Being in such a touristy place, we had to wait about 45 minutes until they called us, but we went back in about 30 and were seated fairly quickly.   We went for dinner so it was packed but we had a view of the harbor during sunset and it was ABSOLUTELY GORGEOUS. We could see Alcatraz Island too and the ambiance of the restaurant was really fancy (at least to my poor ass) for somewhere meant for tourists.   For our drinks we ordered the non-alcoholic Blackberry Press and Strawberry Basil Nojito and both drinks were super super sour and I will probably stick to just water next time.   The bread was really fresh, warm and fluffy and tasted great with the butter. We ordered a second helping.   My friends ordered the chicken penne (it was pretty good) and the sole (really soft and flavorful) and I split the whole dungeness crab.   I am going to say right now I am not a fan of crab due to my past experiences with suffering cracking it open and how bland and dry the innards usually were, BUT THIS WAS NOT THE CASE. It was super moist and had a strong distinct crabby flavor. There was lots of meat available, thus making the tedious process of cracking it open totally worth it. Easily the best crab I've had in my life. The potatoes that came with the dish were kind of greasy and mediocre at best.   The meal ended with a free Biscotti cookie which I thought was neat.   Definitely worth it for the crab and bread, but next time I'll skip out on the drinks and pray for a shorter wait time.

UHwEPdl6YZwEQ31xu3jfHw.review_text: It's a touristy kinda day for us today so we went to Fisherman's Wharf...  :) Great food, ambiance, and view! The food are great.  We had the special crab/risotto for appetizer; entree: fried combo (fish/calamari/shrimp), and crab roll. All the seafood are fresh and delicious! They also provide you a warm sourdough bread that is so yummy...seated by the window overlooking the boat cruise on the bay...it's nice for people watch   :) Our waiter is very professional and friendly. Will definitely come back to try other food.

epkRB3J_oBEiyiwahvdmGg.review_text: Based on experience, a fancy-schmancy restaurant located in a touristy spot with great waterfront views is typically all hype. In my case at Fog Harbor Fish House, it actually wasn't all bad.   Even on a warm San Francisco day, a sourdough bread bowl of hot clam chowder was one of the tastiest things I ate during my trip. For $10 you can have your fill of a comforting bowl of creamy chowder with real chunks of clams and slices of celery. Unfortunately I also gave the salmon flat bread a try, which was disappointing because of its strong fishy flavor.  Although the place was packed for lunch, the service was decent.   The clam chowder is certainly Fog Harbor's forte. If I were to return here on another visit, I'd to mix it up by trying either their plate of fish & chips or calamari and chips.

4dtsi_z9Un97D0ezkLYJTQ.review_text: This place is probably the nicest restaurant at pier 39 and it's barely more pricey than the other places.  The seafood we had was cooked perfectly and everything was packed with flavor.  For a nice sit down, this was a great spot.  Crab risotto fritters were super creamy, rich and delicious.  Clam chowder was legit and the grilled seafood was perfect.  Our waiter Rudy did a great job, was very attentive, and made some great recommendations.

_zRlnzrLPnlxbJ6uwsVS3A.review_text: Our waiter was great but hostess wasn't very nice or welcoming and that's always my first impression.  The food was pretty good but some dishes lacked seasoning.  Great view of the pier.

C4UWtvXXW2KumYFxnY3zAQ.review_text: I would like to Thank the Fog Harbor  Manager for making my daughter and her Prom party a success. With the phenomenal customer service and great food we as parents couldn't have picked a better restaurant. I would also like to take some time to Thank the couple who paid the bill as a good gesture. Once again THANK YOU to the couple who sat next to my daughter and her prom party for paying the bill.

XJYFjbH-oTmu2dATTqyauQ.review_text: After walking around Pier 39 for a few hours, my husband and I were hungry for lunch. We stopped at Fog Harbor since our Aquarium of the Bay ticket allowed us to get 15% off the bill. Additionally, since it was on the second level, the view of the bay was fantastic. The inside was very nicely decorated and had plenty of seating.   We were seated right away and our waitress was quick to greet us and answer any of our questions. We had a tough time deciding what we wanted to eat, but our waitress had some good advice and offered her favorite dishes. For drinks, we both ordered the Alcatraz Escape. This drink was super tasty and my husband is still raving about how delicious it was. The drink was very tropical with orange and pineapple juices with grenadine, coconut rum, and a float of dark rum. I would definitely order it again.   For lunch, my husband ordered the whole dungeness crab with garlic. This thing was huge! It was really tasty, but honestly, it was a mess. I watched my husband crack open the entire thing and this literally consumed all of his time. By the time he was done cracking, I was almost done eating my meal of seafood cioppino. This came with crab, fish, scallops, clams and mussels in a tomato herb broth. It was delicious and hit the spot. I eyed the dessert tray, which looked delicious, but we were both stuffed from our meal.   Overall, I would recommend this place for a seafood fix. It was a little on the pricey side, but I felt it was justified with how delicious everything was, the great service, and the great view. Next time we visit Pier 39, I would definitely come back here and try the other items on the menu.

tvG5Fb4aSG4YvwYQVSiR7g.review_text: So we took a Trip to San Francisco and of course you have to go to Fisherman's Wharf and we came here.  My husband and I do not eat shellfish so after trying Crab Shack, which we did not like we came here.  They are almost next door to each other on the 2nd floor.  We walked in and it was such a nice restaurant and great service.  The place did not spell fishy like next door, and they had sourdough bread, yum.  I ordered and loved the Fish and Chips the Cod tasted like it was just caught and cooked just for me.  My husband loved the trout and we will come again when we visit San Francisco.

CBv2eqUdZYsENjHT7EDz8A.review_text: I had the clam chowder and the crab cakes. The crab cakes were disappointing and the clam chowder was good. Not amazing but decent.  The service was okay. I was put off a bit by our waitress. We were still buttering our bread when she took the butter basket away. I had taken all the butter I wanted but how did she know I was done? What if I had wanted more? She didn't know.  Anyway, it wasn't bad. it wasn't amazing. I probably won't come back if I'm in teh area though.

WU3XkIdG8qZwFW2wAFxsCw.review_text: Came into Fog Harbor after walking out of the Crab House cause we sat for 15 minutes and still no waiter in sight.  So glad we did!  The service and food were excellent!  My son loved the kids Mac n Cheese.  It was homemade and extremely cheesy.  My husband and my 12 yr old son shared the crab and couldn't finish the whole thing, it was so big.  I had the fillet minion which was tender and delicious.  I can't imagine anything not being good in this place.  The prices were good for the location and quality of food.  At $33 the fillet was cheaper than other nearby restaurants.

gD_1ARJw94DAlXQ9J78wRA.review_text: Wow what a chow, chow, chowder!!!! Came with a mound of fresh crab meat really good. Also had the crab cake for my meal. They were also really good. Thumbs up for the FOG!!!!

Q4ksGMVKcTzNi5CDpoAE4Q.review_text: Every table here has a view of the SF bay. Our waiter Bernie was personable, professional and constantly checked on us. Kudos Bernie! Next time we come back, we will ask for you.  The food was absolutely delicious. Every dish in our party was excellent. The assortment of appetizers we had: calamari, clam chowder and crab cakes were outstanding. Must save room for their desserts which were of course worth burning off the next day.

7hUznGCjAomfNVnR7HEgSA.review_text: The dungeness crab was great, but my husband got the crab cakes which were small and tasted like frozen crab cakes not fresh.   The views were great, but the food was definitely overpriced.

OHtgI80fhoIxoon-LlKVrw.review_text: What a lovely restaurant! I really enjoyed the intimate/romantic atmosphere. Get a table further inside if you can; you'll have a nice view next to the water.  My family and I came here for dinner and we had a good time. We started off with complimentary sourdough bread and a calamari appetizer as well as clam chowder. A trip to SF isn't complete without some clam chowder! The bread had a wonderful crunchy texture and the clam chowder was delicious without being too heavy.  For entrees, I ordered swordfish while the rest of my family ordered ahi tuna and the seafood spaghetti. While the food was a little on the salty side, it was pretty good. I actually liked the swordfish the least out of all the entrees because it was rather dry. The tuna was surprisingly generous in portion and I liked this entree the most. The seafood spaghetti was pretty good too, and that's coming from someone who typically doesn't like seafood. I tried their rose wine soda, which was non-alcoholic. It was yummy! It just tastes like a light fizzy soda, haha. They should just call it grape soda, but I guess they just want to make it sound fancy.  All in all, I'd recommend this place if you're in the area and looking for a nice sit-down restaurant.

btY6sVjwj8tLNR3j5J5zzA.review_text: Had a very good experience.  A group had a heavy lunch with a variety of different items.  Very good on the prep and presentation along with great service.

XTaxfLaLuexMe4j_ThxGOQ.review_text: From start to finish the food was simply delicious at a great price Service impeccable and portions generous  You cannot beat this place. It rivals others at comparable prices Great scenery Would definitely come again and again

6tUrIa9TcEupnRduLbvrFQ.review_text: Shellfish platter and crab cakes are SUPER DELICIOUS ... The waiter Khaiman provides us with a very good service!!! It is obvious that he likes his job and he is professional at this... I would like to come to this restaurant every time I come to San Francisco!!!

dODtK_sdIwjAocN5oQI2ew.review_text: Good food for reasonable pricing in a very tourist hotspot. Was surprised about the excellent quality served here. Surely exceeded my expectation. crab cakes were good, steak was awesome and also the tuna steak well prepared (although cooked a little too far). Will surely come back here.

hyF_RxY2mC8JYqF3sbja5Q.review_text: Excellent food and excellent customer service. Our server was incredibly helpful and punctual. I typically avoid "touristy" areas but do recommend.

0KueQxXgax9GlbZ0UNaGlg.review_text: Good but not entirely worth the price.   Shared a bottle of sparkling wine with two friends and split some seafood appetizers. The oysters were a little sad, not plump and delicious. The tuna poke was kinda standard and the Dungeonous crab cakes were good.   For this tasting, we paid $118.  Eh. I've had money better spent.

A563dpyiH4qgXjOSnd-C-A.review_text: Slightly better than your average tourist place around here. Great view and nice decor. Food was pretty good but not fantastic by any stretch. Nice selection of seafood on the menu with some good choices for landlovers as well. Prices are definitely inflated by about 20% over what they should be, but what do you expect for Pier 39 right? Didn't need a reservation for weekday lunch. Make sure to check in on Yelp for free appetizer.

t_Q3ZBRE7s_dSgYg6Z4aOw.review_text: Well with the wait and the beautiful seating outside I guess I was expecting too much from this place. We were startled to see several waitresses and waiters with white uniform button up shirts but no undershirts beneath!! I could see the women's bras and one mans nipples clear as day!!! For a place like this I would have expected management to have that under control at least!  We were seated in the far back of the restaraunt where a party of about 15 teenage girls of 15 years old were seated with no adult supervision and were so loud throughout our whole meal that I could barely make out anything my friend was saying to me. And I really feel bad for the people who were sitting next to them as we were half way across the room! When I said something to our waiter he stated "yeah, they are pretty annoying" but never attempted to rectify the situation.   It took about 15 minutes for someone to come get our drink orders and I ordered a margarita and was able to hardly drink it because it was about 70% syrup and way too sweet. We ordered the ahi tuna poke which I really enjoyed and my friend had the crab dip which absolutely loved and devoured. When the main meals arrived my friend had the chowder and said it wasn't really all that special and was just ok. I ordered a plate of clams, mussels, shrimp, crab and corn. The dish was absolutely COVERED in Garlic....there so much garlic everywhere and I had a hard time scraping it off. The clams were ok and there wasn't too much to the mussels. The corn was ridiculous as you couldn't really bite into it but if you scraped it with your teeth you might actually get a little bit. The whole dish was hard to eat because of the ridiculous amount of garlic. It was like someone took about 6-8 whole garlic, minced it and to threw it in. With what we paid, we were severely disappointed....this restaurant needs someone competent enough to actually make this place worth the price...

0-qbolTkCyWcA8xaAOu3YQ.review_text: Had a great King Salmon dinner! Even at the pinnacle of fleet week the service was prompt and the staff was very attentive. Dinner was prepared well with great flavor and the place was packed!! We will definitely come back!

WXD8bD9LVMgEFqcs5CpQ-g.review_text: We ordered clam chowder, cod and risotto fritter. The calm chowder was good. The other two dishes are mediocre. The view and service was good :)

hQBfcQhtu-eAZCJVg17iVA.review_text: Had Madison as our waitress. Very polite and very attentive. If she wasn't working we would ask her to join us for lunch. Great food, great service!  Complimentary bread is baked into the price in the menu therefore being perceived as free, at least that's what I theoretically think.   Hopefully will get a chance to try the creme brulee someday ;)

cpL3IAvNtxMlK-cQ6ns9Wg.review_text: If you're visiting pier 39 this is definitely the place to go. I've read all the positive reviews on yelp before deciding to go and was definitely not disappointed.   We've ordered seafood cioppino and it was a home run.  Fresh tomato sauce based broth, mussels, shrimp, scallops,and crab legs perfectly blended together. The dish was large enough for 2 people to start with but added pasta to our order and it was a perfect compliment to the seafood. Order a bottle of wine to go along with the food and you have a complete meal.   There is a little bit of a wait line when you get to restaurant. Make sure you tell the hostess that you want a table with a view on the bay. There is a different waiting time on these tables but the view makes up for it.

DjiWvNLBbrOI5qKOyYGtCA.review_text: Wow, this establishment gets my four stars for location, atmosphere, service and food! I was on a hunt for the best clam chowder and I think I found it! We also got window seating which had the perfect view of the pier from our table! :) The restaurant is super cute and fancy. Between my boyfriend and I, we shared the sourdough clam chowder bread bowl, the red curry mussels and a beer. Both dishes we're amazingggg. The clam chowder- super creamy and filling that pair perfectly well with their warm sourdough bread. Red curry mussels- I'm not a huge seafood gal, but as one bite, yum! They paired it with what seems like toasted garlic bread (they need to include more pieces!). I'll be back!

zT-5xnkEwhyCmWi2lUorrg.review_text: Sure, this is along the touristy Wharf, but when it's 9:00p on a Friday night and you haven't eaten since late morning (plus crackers and sh*t in between to tie you over), you'd be desperate to go anywhere, right?  Well, it's good to know that this place was rated pretty good, and I can't say I went to SF without eating some kind of seafood so here I was with 4 others (note: "cooked" seafood...I don't like anything raw).  My friend actually called them around 8:15ish to see if we can make a reservation, but at that time, they were booked and walk-in would be about a 30-minute wait.  By the time we got there around 9:00, the restaurant was maybe a 1/3 empty so we were able to sit down right away (thank goodness, I would've had to chew my arm off).  Although we got hot sourdough bread with butter, we ordered the blue cheese garlic bread ($8) and crispy lemon calamari ($12) on top of that and pretty much scarfed it down.  The calamari was tender with crispy batter...so good.  The blue cheese garlic bread was good too, but the blue cheese was rich so if I wasn't overly hungry, I wouldn't be able to eat 3 slices.  But I did.  For main, I ordered the Pacific Sole ($20), but by then, I was already getting stuffed...(didn't help that I had a virgin Pina Colada with the appetizers).  I still ate some of it.  The pacific sole was fresh not fishy and went well with the spinach, peppers, and tarragon cooked in a caper sauce (buerre blanc).  The others ordered coffee and dessert after that, but I had to pass.  Sooo sooo sooo (did I say "sooo"?) saaaaad to miss out on dessert!!!

UbWUr96T7yOp9w4lrKyf5Q.review_text: Great seafood restaurant in the middle of the touristy Pier 39.   We started with the bleu cheese garlic bread (free with yelp check in) and as a non-bleu cheese fan, the bread was surprisingly tasty. The bleu cheese was very mild and broiled crisp on top.   The clam chowder was thick, creamy with large chunks of clam-just the way a good chowder should be. The oysters on the half shell were fresh. The steamed crab legs were delicious although a little drier than I'd like. Drenching them in garlic butter definitely helped:)  I washed down all this garlicky seafood goodness with a Skinny Ginger Lemonade. Advertised as only 14 calories and made with Splenda, it was light and refreshing with fresh ginger shavings throughout.

vhEv9j8QbfSlL8oLwej2rQ.review_text: Spent the weekend in SF and had dinner here on an early Saturday evening.  Staff and everyone at the restaurant were extremely polite and accommodating.   Started off with the oysters and both the taste and quality were very good.  We had the linguine with clams and the lobster.  Both dishes were good and the price was within line for the quality.  Good atmosphere and generally a place for all.

Aai51NrR1F5qHaMHZ5inDg.review_text: My family took me here for Father's Day and I had a great experience.    Delicious food, great view, awesome servers.  It was Father's Day and really busy but we had made reservations and was promptly seated at a table nest to the window.  Ordered the Tuna Poke and fried scallops.  They were delicious.  My sons asked me to get a second order of the Poke.  I ordered the Seared Ahi Tuna and it was done perfectly.  My son ordered the Salmon BLT and cleaned his plate.

nAuv2sB7bYUjx4KmBp7diQ.review_text: We visited for lunch the day after Christmas.  We ordered the clam chowder in a bread bowl and the red curry mussels.  Both were excellent and our waitress, Madison, was efficient and very friendly.  I highly recommend anyone visiting San Francisco to take time to seek this place out.  We'll go back next time we visit!

lo7AI1id6F34nAnfmi94vg.review_text: An hour wait for a party of 7.  The food isn't amazing and the wait wasn't worth it. It's pretty pricey. The seafood penne is $19 but didn't fill me up. Mussels and clams' meat are tiny. The swordfish is really good! Super fresh but such small proportion for $26 :((  The portions of the clam chowder and salad is pretty large so that was worth the $14. But everything else I ordered wasn't worth it Unfortunately..  Overall this place is nice. Our waiter, Brett, was lovely! He was tentative and funny as well. Wouldn't come back again since it's just too pricey and the food isn't amazing as I thought it would be. But really great service  --my cousin ordered the New York steak and loved it! He recommends that! :)    Total: $130.24

NEOSYsubf7SVeVm8RytxYA.review_text: Pretty good restaurant considering how centrally located it is in a tourist destination.  Brought my visiting family here to visit Pier 39 and enjoy some fresh seafood.  The dining experience is absolutely superb.  Not to mention the wonderful views with their huge windows looking out to the San Francisco water front.    My family was so happy with the food and the ambiance.

TZ5Xc4cQ_IBNXgZJ06xWpw.review_text: Your basic toursist trap, fried food and watered down cocktaiks. Much better places to eat in SF if you dont mind looking. Good came very quickly at the expense of being barely cooked.

munMp0AaoyO9v6nSPZJqIA.review_text: The clam chowder in a bread bowl was excellent! The calamari was also outstanding! Next time I visit San Francisco I plan to dine here again & I will definitely order calamari as a starter! Delicious!  Our waiter was great too!

qG90YZd9ezxIdlMM0ceY-w.review_text: Being a lover of seafood this place is a must. Fantastic picturesque location with great service and food. I had clam chowder for the first time ever and it was amazing.  Also had the panko crumbed scallops and was amazed by the serving size and quality.  Had the mixed grill for mains and again, it was flawless.  Wish seafood was this price in Australia!

XGioINwLD01pnf4XbSOJtg.review_text: I have eaten here twice and both times were outstanding! I had the new York steak and to was cooked perfectly and had wonderful flavor!  My sister had the crab last time and oysters tis time both were excellent! I have also had the molten cake both times and it is sooooooo good! The Blondie is also great!  I will be back!

7VE9IHnRMokkuPic6OMThA.review_text: Wonderful meal with a wonderful view.  Don't let the touristy area fool you.  This is a top notch seafood restaurant.  Fresh fish, great service, and the people are much nicer than over at Scoma's!

Dp6OQOY3XBgkGM4rgtZvYQ.review_text: After a quick four and half hour bus tour of San Francisco we had a couple of hours left before having to leave port for another destination on a cruise. After doing some research I came across Fog Harbor Fish House at Pier 39 on a travel website which had a lot of positive reviews.  Upon arrival we waited for about fifteen minutes before being seated (for a group of three) at a corner not far from the Crab House.   We ordered two cups of clam chowder, and one in a sourdough bowl. Apparently the basket of bread was sourdough, so the sourdough bowl wasn't necessary. The chowder was great - as the restaurant claims - "the best in San Francisco. "  We also ordered  Crispy Bay Scallops, Dungeness Crab Cakes, and Fried Combo (breaded fish, calamari, shrimp, french fries and cole slaw). Based on the description lots of calories for sure.  The scallops, calamari and crab cakes were the best of the lot.  It felt like we consumed two meals at once given the portions but it was a great experience. A great way to finish a brief trip to San Francisco.

BighBfV7maUUIgfH4Ew_vA.review_text: Definitely in the tourist area. Tried to make reservations, but they said they were full and to do a walk-in instead. Walked in and was able to sit down right away. The service was alright. Ordered calamari, raw oysters, and clam chowder for appetizers. Calamari was nothing too special, but the clam chowder was delicious. Hands down, the best in town as they mentioned. As for entrées, had ahi tuna and king salmon. The tuna was seared and the salmon was crispy on the outside. Both were good, but will try other places around the area first. Btw, for parking, park in the structure across from Pier 39. They do validations.

BHc7xphU4FkAIfOrrHTPDw.review_text: Their chowder in a bread bowl is pretty good.  The kids' fish and chips were excellent for their value.  Will return.

HWERuacNmBjeB4bszrLm6g.review_text: My boyfriend took me here for my birthday celebration!!! Service was friendly, food was great and looking forward to go again!

Lf3-2bcjW34iJQN0Hz3Mdw.review_text: Found the food very good and there is a great view of the Golden Gate bridge if you make it before sunset.

J2752iXa_1ZPQtiQl5yZ0A.review_text: First, go to the visitor's center also on the upper level and get a 15% off coupon for this place. Then, make a reservation on OpenTable so you get seated near the window.   This is a nice little spot with a beautiful view of the Bay. The food quality is decent but nothing amazing and the mixed drinks are a little diluted. I would know as I get tipsy easily since I hardly drink which wasn't the case after a mojito here.  I had a 1/2 crab (eh, ok, but way overpriced due to supply/demand) which was plenty with a beat salad (very good) and shared a bowl of the Clam Chowder (delicious) with my boyfriend who has some fish in a wasabi sauce that didn't taste that excellent.   So this isn't a cheap place, but it's not a bad restaurant to check out and the service is very good.   3 stars for food. 2.5 stars for mixed drinks 4 stars for service 4 stars for atmosphere

L5Jg5f_cFs6SWllVsFZ1FA.review_text: Great view, friendly staff, and the food was good, but it wasn't really anything special. I'm not sure if it was worth the price.

g1UVkG0JstuRb56aUiOb0Q.review_text: Went here with a group of 8 friends for our last night in San Fran. Our apps were awesome! We had the baked oysters and red chile shrimp. The clam chowder was good, but not the best ever. Everyone really enjoyed their entrees; I had the crab cakes, and they were awesome! Sevice was ok.

JsD6EVMJNi157zTu5Gilqw.review_text: I was looking for a restaurant that served good quality fish dishes. I was also looking for the fish dishes to be not deep fried. I found it. This place was amazing. When my family go out for our Christmas meal we all have to get something different, then we all try everyone's plate. Everything was so good. I will be back. Only mistake on my part, making the reservation this close to Christmas. It was packed. But the waitress handled it. I will be returning. Merry Christmas to all!

dmIi-DqwydCEtEYNI-WK8w.review_text: I stumbled upon this restaurant after searching high and low to find a place that serves a whole lobster. Came here on Friday night to celebrate a special person birthday whom requested lobster for his birthday meal so I was determined to find a place that served a whole lobster. This place definitely did not this disappoint as the birthday celebrant was able to order surf and turf. He was certainly a happy camper which made me happy because I wanted everything to be perfect.   The service was exceptional as our server was constantly checking up on us and even went as far as to make our dessert special by adding a candle so the birthday celebrant could blow out a candle and make a wish. It  was simple yet just perfect because the birthday celebrant prefer to have a low key celebration. ( I was taken by the gesture of our server and wished I gotten his name so I could give him the shout out that he deserved.)  Lastly, everything was amazing that night and thank you for following my request of having a nice view of the water. We had a blast!!!

TbhyP24zYZqZ2VJZgu1wrg.review_text: This place is just okay. People raving about the food are slightly deluded - it's good but it's also very touristy, you know the drill.  The interior is enormous, it takes several hundred yards to get from the entrance to your table if you know what I mean.   We came here for crab. I had a crab ceviche appetizer which was super delicious, made with fresh crab, mango and avocado. My entree was pretty bad. I ordered a rare seared tuna steak with asian vegetables. The tuna was coated with sickeningly sweet sauce that ruined the fish. Vegetables were way too sweet as well. Disappointing.   Our server was absolutely delightful though, really helpful and didn't mind separating the bill three ways.

gkJJAzDD_lInmgq-7imxWg.review_text: This place is not too bad if you're not looking for something mind blowing. Don't get me wrong, I believe the food here is great and the quality is phenomenon. But the food just doesn't make you crave to remember. The place has a nice view, it's located on the pier, and the decor is very lovely.   I had the oysters and I believe they were from fanny bay if I could remember. Only 1 selection. The condiments given could have been better. They are a seafood restaurant so I expected to have a larger oyster selection. The ceviche with crab was very delicious, but I felt the chips that were given to compliment it were just thrown on there. It felt a little stale to me. The ceviche could have been a bit more sour as well. I split the cioppino with a friend and because I'm a girl it was an okay amount. I didn't leave feeling full. The seafood in the cioppino tasted a bit dry and the mussels I had did not taste so fresh. I've had better cioppino with much more seafood in it before. We had the Alcatraz escape and the drinks were well made. It tasted great and it wasn't too weak. Instead of giving mints they gave a biscoff cookie, which I thought was weird. Overall, its's an okay place. Not great but definitely not something you must try. I tried to like the place, but I can't still. 3 stars because it's not a bad place.  My friend had the lobster stuffed crab. He enjoyed it. Still he agreed that it's not a memorable place.   The server was nice though. He helped us quite a bit.

JXc1HVswXh_OkHL7COn47A.review_text: Went there around 4pm on a Friday since we had tickets for a nearby attraction at 6pm. The place wasn't that busy and we were seated right away. We had a very nice server for a few minutes until he came over to tell us he was leaving and Clementi (sp?) took over for him. (At least, that's what my husband saw on her name tag. She never introduced herself). She took our orders and left. A few minutes after that, a runner brought us an appetizer that wasn't ours. We told him and he left. A few minutes later, a different runner and another wrong appetizer. We told him it wasn't ours and and he also left. Clementi sees this from across the room and comes running over and wants to know what is going on. Not as in, "Oh, is there a problem that I can solve for you?". She wanted to know why we were talking to the other employees. She seemed very accusatory, like she thought we were complaining or something.   So we finally get our correct appetizer and then our main courses. THE FOOD WAS EXCELLENT. The only  thing that really ruined our experience was our server's attitude and lack of attentiveness. At the very end, she comes over with the check and says "I have some treats for  you" and literally throws a tiny cookie onto the table in the general direction of each of us, like we were dogs. It was just so ridiculous. The restaurant seemed like it could be very nice and I think, with the right service, it would have been a great experience. I am giving 3 stars because the food was very good, the service we received was definitely only worth 1 star.

4lXMpwp-Ynmvhbhe9Ivghw.review_text: We went as part of a fairly good-sized group (8) and they were able to seat us at a table right away in the bar area without a reservation at 5:45 on a Saturday evening.  I was shocked considering how busy the wharf area was Independence Day weekend.  Had the clam chowder (very good), calamari (very good) and crab cocktail (OK).  The place did proceed to get very packed very quickly so it would seem we got lucky with the seating.  Luck or not, I'm giving this place extra points just for the fact that they could accommodate us.

XEiR8wnL5lqnj4G6uoaf-g.review_text: I love eating on the Pier!  We decided to try Fog House, which has a great view of the bay.  We went around lunch and had a short wait of 10 minutes.  We sat at the bar and I tried their pumpkin pie martini..yum!  It was very rich and true to taste!  A bit decadent for the beginning of my meal but good, none-the-less.  We were seated and asked our server for recommendations.  We ended up with:   - Goat cheese garlic bread: very rich in flavor (goat cheese mostly) but crispy and warm.   - Crab cocktail: it's crab season so the crab tasted extra fresh.  Perfectly chilled and served with traditional cocktail sauce.   - Menu special, Scallops: this was okay.  It was served with a quinoa salad but there was a bit too much balsamic vinegar to appreciate the taste of the scallop.   - Seafood platter for 1: served with crab, shrimp, mussels, and clams in a butter herb sauce.  We were disappointed with this.  The food was lukewarm, at best, and there was so much butter it drowned the taste of the seafood.  Since we came here with high seafood expectations, this is the reason for my mid-scoring review.  All in all the experience was just okay; nothing spectacular or fancy.  Our server gave us this card to text in a review of the restaurant, with a promise of a complimentary dessert at the end of the meal.  Well, I took the survey.  But I guess they have no way to monitor who takes the survey from each table?  I didn't bring it to her attention, as I wasn't really in the mood for dessert, but for a promotion that's supposed to gauge a customer's experience with a promise of a small reward at completion, I would think they could track better.  But again, this wasn't a make or break for my opinion.

dsB0n6qTBLAxY4CaismRBw.review_text: This place is superb! Went here the dat after vday .. It was def packed and a long wait buuuut luckily i made reservations 2 weeks prior lol the food was awesome, the customer service was awesome. Everything was great. We had great seats by the water with an amazing view. Ordered a bottle of champagne ($34) dollars and made it a super classy meal. The CRAB CAKES ARE TO KILL FOR. So most and full of crab. Seriously delicious. The hype about this place was their clam chowder bowl which i thought was ok. I wasnt blown away by it but literally everything was great. Highly recommended place for an anniversary, birthday, or proposal dinner!

0x4DpVC6xTYZAnPMD1U9qQ.review_text: Came here with my friend to celebrate my birthday two nights ago. I'd been craving clam chowder for over a week and I wanted to see if this place really had the "best clam chowder in SF".  I booked a reservation for 6:15 and called to change it to 6:45 and the lady on the phone was fairly accommodating and friendly. When we arrived, we were immediately seated at a table by the window (probably because I had mentioned that we were celebrating a birthday on our reservation) with a spectacular view of Alcatraz and the seals! Our amazing waiter, David, came by and introduced us to some special dishes on the menu. He also knew it was my birthday and told me they would prepare a chocolate dessert for us. When he came back with our drinks, we just ordered two bread bowls (we weren't crazy hungry because had sundaes two hours earlier). I knew about the Yelp check-in offer for the free appetizer but didn't now it only came with an order of an entree, but David was so kind and said he would bring us one out because it was my birthday.   The bread bowls were fairly large and definitely met our expectations. It was presented nicely (it wasn't messy like most bread bowls we order from other places) and not too salty or bland. Perfectly creamy. Had a lot of clams and potatoes too. Clam chowder is my favorite soup (and arguably one of my favorite foods in general) and I'd have to say this was the best I've ever had. Our only complaint would be there wasn't enough soup. The actual bread the soup came in was HUGE, but I'd say there was only about two cups of soup in the actual bread bowl. I was alright though (my friend was still a bit hungry but luckily we had our free appetizer!) because I was stuffed when I finished. I couldn't even finish the bread!   Our waiter came by many times to ask us how our dishes were and how we were doing and even sang me happy birthday when he brought us our free chocolate dessert! The chocolate cake was a bit too sweet but it was extremely rich and went well with the scoop of vanilla ice cream next to it.   Our bill only came to about $24 only because we had ordered two bread bowls, but it was amazing considering the fact that we got a free appetizer and dessert.  OVERALL: Clam chowder bread bowls - Best I've ever had and I'm a local! Not too salty and not too bland either. Only wish there was more soup and it was less pricey.  Blue cheese bread appetizer - I love garlic bread and I love cheesy bread but this wasn't that good. I've never really liked the taste of blue cheese so this definitely wasn't my favorite. But it won't hurt to get it for free if you check in on yelp!  Service - absolutely amazing. The waiters were all extremely nice, especially David.   Ambiance/View - has one of the best views of Pier 39. If you happen to get a seat on the left of the restaurant by the Bay, you'll be able to see Alcatraz and the area where the seals are. I specifically chose a reservation right before sunset and the view of the water was breathtaking. If it's too sunny they have blinds they'll be happy to pull down (or up) for you. Restaurant wasn't too loud and the restaurant was pretty busy (esp. for a Wednesday night).   **they'll also validate your parking ticket for up to 4 hours if you came by car  I'll definitely be coming back again!

AtNMwewC4drPH3Lgki9JBQ.review_text: Really good! Had the crab fritters, clam chowder, poke, and blue cheese bread. We are from the area and felt like being tourists. I think if we have people come visit and want to go to the wharf we will take them here.

Of-ycF_3l1HwqCZ63SFxxQ.review_text: Beautiful view of Alcatraz from our table. Ask for it.

HCn_c4OhIREcNNBi-5MD2w.review_text: If you're looking for a nice sit down seafood restaurant at Pier 39, the Fog Harbor Fish House is a great restaurant! We came here in the afternoon and enjoyed sitting by the fireplace outside and listening to the waterfall while we waited for our table. The restaurant has beautiful bay windows with panoramic views of the wharf. It's worth asking for a table next to the window where you can actually see the seals below!   Being in SF I really wanted fresh baked bread so I was delighted when a bread basket of warm, freshly baked sourdough bread arrived. To kick things off, we enjoyed the Crispy Lemon Calamari ($12), which was delicious! The calamari was seasoned with lemon zest and delicious on it's own even without the lemon aioli. For lunch, one of us enjoyed the award winning Clam Chowder in a Bread Bowl ($9) and the other had the Soup and Salad Combo ($14) with a Caesar side salad. The soup was served in a fresh baked sourdough bread bowl. We enjoyed the complimentary Biscoff cookie that arrived at the end of the meal.  Visit Fog Harbor Fish House, you won't be disappointed!

-ekA5WrEKGPp3BSLT391qA.review_text: After doing some exploring in San Francisco for the day my boyfriend and I decided to eat lunch at the Fog Harbor Fish House. We were advised to not eat at Pier 39 since it's a tourist trap, low quality food with a hefty price tag. Even though we were advised not to eat at Pier 39, my boyfriend and I decided to give it a try anyways. We turned to yelp and saw that Fog Harbor had very good ratings based on their 1,000+ reviews.  For lunch on a Saturday, expect to wait. The wait wasn't too long considering how busy they were, we were seated within 20-30 minutes. Since my boyfriend and I love seafood we decided to order the Shellfish Platter for two. The platter comes with corns, shrimps, clams, mussels, and 1/2 a crab. While waiting for our order the waitress brought out fresh sourdough bread for us to enjoy and it was delicious.    When I placed the Shellfish platter order I was excited for my seafood lunch, but when the plate came out I was hugely disappointed. The amount of seafood that was provided did not seem like it was meant for two people. The mussels were very tiny, so tiny that when I ate them I couldn't really taste mussels. My boyfriend and I established that they could've been cove mussels since they were so small. Some of the clams were missing the actual clams, we were served with just their outer shells. The crab was very delicious, I wish we had more! Butter is used as the sauce for the platter, but we opted out of it and the platter tasted fine. Just drizzle some lemons (which were provided) and you are set, a much healthier and tastier alternative.   I also ordered a cup of the clam chowder. I am a fan of clam chowder and I had to try their "award winning house clam chowder". The chowder was good, but compared to other clam chowders I had, it was a little bit saltier than I preferred. It was still good since I ended up finishing the cup!   Overall, for the price you are paying the quality and quantity of food was not worth it.

o5kJhu3vCkz2-A5_RUhVfA.review_text: Terrible service! Do not trust you when you say that you need the table for 4 people when you are 2, and just wait for the rest if the company! Shirt policy !

Dui-ZVYgNzXEWdn2jgECNQ.review_text: Ate here a couple of weeks ago on our final night of our trip.  Very much enjoyed it.  Great service and I finished with the Apple Crumble Dessert which was amazing!!!  I don't eat seafood - so you don't need to like it to eat here....still lots of delicious options!

MpJfcgUY6gz7TY1yK5u7Qw.review_text: There was one thing I was determined to do while in San Francisco, and that was to find a good seafood place in Fisherman's Wharf where we could enjoy fresh fish and a nice view of the harbor. So I went to Yelp, because I did not want to chance ending up somewhere not so good on my SF Fisherman's Wharf seafood adventure!  I was looking for a nicer dinner place, not just a clam chowder hut, so Fog Harbor caught my eye and with good reviews, we decided to give it a try. I am *so* happy we did .... best meal on our entire vacation!  We had problems figuring out where to enter the place! lol. I saw the Fog Harbor sign on the wall, but finally after walking around some, we realized we had to walk up the stairs and enter from above! :) It is a very touristy area, but we didn't have to wait to get seated. It's a good-sized restaurant, also with options for eating at the bar, so the capacity for customers is quite good.   They escorted us to a nice table where we could oversee the ocean, Alcatraz and the Pier 39 traffic below while we ate. Loved it.  We started off with some clam chowder.  While waiting for soup, we were served nice fresh sourdough bread, it was so delicious! Nice and smooth and not "too sour", it was perfect.  The clam chowder was wonderful.  Full of clams!! (As a clam chowder should be, but you'd be surprised at how often you can count the clams in a chowder on one hand ....).  We mopped up every single drop with the remains of our sourdough bread, that bowl was clean and ready for service again by the time we were done with it.  For dinner, I had selected the swordfish. It was served atop ratatouille and fingerling potatoes and was accompanied by pesto sauce and chimichurri. The flavors were amazing, I loved the combination of all these vegetables and sauces along with the swordfish, it really brought the fish "to life". I love swordfish, but it can be a little bland if served with the wrong sides.   This vegetable/ratatouille blend along with the sauces really did the fish justice, I loved every bite!  My husband decided on the crab cake dinner.  Now, I'm very picky when it comes to crab cakes.  I'm picky on seafood overall actually, but especially food involving crab.  If it is fishy tasting at all, I won't have it, so most crab cakes never pass "the test" ;-)   I'm very happy to say, the Fog Harbor crab cakes DID pass the "Laila" test with flying colors!! They were so smooth and delicious, I even reached over for a couple of extra bites and luckily my husband is good at sharing ;-)   At the end of the night, when our bill came, we actually did feel we got our moneys worth ... between the food, the service and the beautiful view, it was totally worth it and it was exactly the San Francisco Fisherman's Wharf seafood experience that I had dreamed about!! :-)

d4eYokLq5v_0solWv6Ocog.review_text: This is my fault. Really, it is.   We picked a spot right on Pier 39 full of tourists on a Sunday afternoon. Guh. Why did I do that?   All right, the oysters were delicious and fresh. I'll give them that! No horseradish though. The crab sandwich was okay - the bread that it was served in was very good, but the crab itself was a little bland and just too cold. Needed a little sauce or something to flavor it better.   Anyway, our server was just flat, lusterless and almost angry at times. The place was overly busy, but she could have at least tried to appear happy.   I shan't be back.  EDIT: I'm editing this to a 3 star. The food was 3-4 stars but the service was 2-3 stars. The manager seems extremely conscientious and has contacted me with questions on how they can improve - I appreciate this chance for personal feedback!

IVbHAvQCMfgyG4Kqqg9TLg.review_text: I brought my family from Australia for an afternoon snack here while touring the fisherman's wharf. Seriously I did not expect this restaurant be so great both in quality of food as well as service.   1. There is a very nice area for waiting, with nice couch and chairs. 2. The hostess is very friendly and attentive (given that we are actually Asian looking Asian). 3. The Clam Chawder with bread bowl is delicious and of high quality, the waitress actually told us it is pretty big portion, so we decided to share, which worked out great. 4. The deserts, especially the Tiramisu is phenomenal, even in my opinion ( I almost never order desert and liked desert voluntarily) 4.5 The price is very reasonable -- not outrageously high because of being part of the touristic area. 5. The view is great if you could get the window seat (we did not, but we can still see because of the large windows the restaurant has).  All in all, I will come back here to try more food, and I recommend you as well even if you are not a tourist :)

4cGYSDQcWaC8ZArnAjlt4A.review_text: Don't let the location fool you, it's quality food. I have to say that I was bit worried about the food not being great with the restaurant located in such a touristy area. My whole family was VERY happy with everything about this restaurant.  After our tiring tour of Alcatraz, we were hungry and ready for diner. While our reservation wasn't for another 1/2 hour, they were happy to seat us when we arrived.  The ambiance, food, and service was superb. I'd be happy to bring any of my friends, including the pickiest foodies I know, to this restaurant and know they'd be happy.

1HwFUhq-7hhao7io_F6zZQ.review_text: Food was average, not worth what we paid. Our waitress was really good and took care of our needs just wish I could say said the food was great! My lobster Mac and cheese was okay, the noodles were too over cooked and my husbands seafood cioppino didn't have enough seafood in it.

uRPrG5Y74o9-YuMLU60i6Q.review_text: Food was delicious, pricey but not too much! Definitely going back soon. The atmosphere was great considering how busy it is at Pier 39, the waiters/waitresses were very nice and we had a great view! Planning my next visit for my husband's birthday.

-bobL18AC3QdzPTkaCFe2w.review_text: We had the best lunch. The crab salad was full of flavor and no skimping on the crab. Lol.  The chicken sandwich was awesome. Not a bad price either!

6Y8wWRHkG0hs0EcO6YDiVw.review_text: If your feeling a little fancy and have a little extra money to spare... Treat yourself to a wonderful lunch or dinner here! The restaurant is beautiful and the view looking out to the ocean is amazing! The food was fabulous and our waiter was very pleasant.

J56rIb3SXeHdPAt0dWuE-A.review_text: Came here for dinner after graduation with no reservations so I was pleased that we were able to be seated within 15 minutes. It's true, the views are beautiful and the food is even better. We started off with the mouthwatering clam chowder. It was honestly amazing and then I had the mixed grill which was also great, along with a wonderful glass of sparking Pinot Noir. The service was great and I had an overall wonderful experience!

66RFFjfiOgachspRdKPr1w.review_text: I was here when I came to san francisco for vacation with my bf. We love seafood. We made reservations the night before but the reservation was not booked when we got here. But since we were here when they opened at 11 there was lots of tables available. No problem. This place has a gorgeous view and the ambience is very nice. The service was okay, our server must have been having a bad day because our order came out late. We ordered the crab roll with sweet potatoes fries, dozen oysters, and the famous clam chowder. On the crab roll the bread was crispy and soft. The oysters was amazingly delicious. And the clam chowder is one of the best. The meat was not chewy in the clam chowder. It's truly perfect. Everything was fresh and delicious. I recommend here if you like seafood!

U2xsIRAZzMGuFYQgqihCSA.review_text: Service: It's appropriate. The staff is courteous and polite. But I don't find anyone going out of their way to make the experience a memorable one.  Food: Just what the menu explains, simple, and scrumptious. The seafood here is one of the BEST in SF. I have to add though, not having a desert menu, but rather displaying their selection is very naughty. I don't think I've ever walked out without ordering a desert here for that very reason.  View: If you happen to get a window seat, you'll catch yourself gazing out into the ocean... Very relaxing

2caNOaOLWoCL-nLzap-D0Q.review_text: After a trip to the Golden Gate Bridge and then an unexpected rdse to San Rafael transit station to retrieve my GoPro I left on the bus (dummy me) we decided to eat an early dinner. We ventured upon the Fog Harbor Fish House. From the moment we walked in and were seated at a window table with a beautiful view of Alcatraz, I knew we were in for a delightful time. Our server, Niessa, was so friendly and prompt with everything we ordered. From our drinks to appetizers and our main course, it was excellent! We highly recommend the Fog Harbor AND if you can get Neissa as your server, it will be extra special!

uO21Oi5nmXCeEQJOm28lQA.review_text: Probably one of the best seafood dinners I've ever had, plus an amazing view. We got the crab cake appetizer and seafood platter for two. AMAZING. My only complaint is that Yelp gave this place a $$ when it really should be $$$.

mWc9qiV9EAFPuJAi1AGYOg.review_text: Food was okay...service was horrible.  At a tourist place I understand that service isn't going to be spectacular, but when the waiter is gone for long periods of time and you have to go to the bar to pay the bill because he's vanished, that's a bad thing.  Plus, he tried to tack on an extra $8 to the bill and insinuated that my GF's parents didn't understand how tipping worked.   Because of his rudeness and slowness, I left a very small tip and wrote "SLOW SERVICE" next to the small tip just so he knew that his bad tip wasn't because of the foreigners that he was obviously prejudiced against didn't know how to tip.

Lt3yloGFP1vuxyrNdYYG0A.review_text: Clean and nice environment, but I was totally disappointed to the food there. Price is not $$ but $$$$. I am an oyster lover, but the oysters here are too small and shrank, not worth that expensive at all! Anyway, service was good.

gPlJ1ukVVi0Ahex2SzjZug.review_text: Clam chowder - delicious! Ahi tune Poke - not so much. I literally had 2 bites and couldn't force myself to eat it. The waiter was super nice, when he asked me how I like it I was honest and said I didn't care for it. He saw that I barely even touched it and didn't end up charging me for it - that is some good customer service skills! I would go back to try other food on the menu.

dZLPQUDQQ5AjhPHx6nWP-A.review_text: Seafood is excellent, staff is very nice and polite. A bit too expensive, visit "Welcome California Center" to get a discount card.

xon12FQ3dQY_xM6NK_2fig.review_text: The setting is nice since it's in Pier 39 but I couldn't help but feel that it was simply another typical SF Seafood restaurant. Not going to lie, the clam chowder was pretty bomb and the warm sourdough bread was super yummy but they were disorganized with our table and seating even after we had made reservations.   If you're in the area it's a good place to try but I wouldn't go out of my way to try to eat here.

NpmaZccw7SCCn6KI1nT9aA.review_text: We were at the wharf for the afternoon and decided to grab a late lunch here based on the yelp reviews. I had the Ahi Poke appetizer and the Grilled Shrimp Brochette. Both of them were very good! The service was okay but not overly impressive. The ambiance and views of the water were great, although the windows needed a good cleaning (the amount of bird poop on them was gross). The 4 stars is strictly for the quality of the food.

yBkMMjXlQCEl7hiIGhQYgw.review_text: I've been here before with my brother a couple years ago and was excited to visit again. I enjoyed the ambiance, friendly staff and excellent food. As some of the other reviews I've read, I agree that it does feel a little crowded, but I appreciate that the food makes up for anything I could say.   Our view was fantastic, right near the window. I ordered the Cajun shrimp and ham pasta: excellent! Highly recommend. Overall, a very pleasant evening and dinning experience!

Hw5riZfnB-B7G79vBTOssA.review_text: Came here for dinner on a recent trip to San Fran. What a gorgous view of the ocean! We were seated right next to the window with a great view of the water and Alcatraz.  We ordered to appetizers to start with, the scallops and the squid. Both were breaded but it was the lemon aioli that was the star!   I ordered the cup of clam chowder and half a garlic dungenous crab (as it was in season!). The clam chowder was probably one of the best I have ever had, and I grew up along the coast so I have alot of clam chowders in my life! The crab was also very good. A bit smaller than I was picturing but with the clam chowder, I was full!  Out of all the restaurants along that pier, this one seemed the least touristy and Im glad we stopped in!

5BHovY0BbAJVvb1SSSax_w.review_text: Fantastic food and view!!  Loved the crab mango avocado cerviche, delicious salmon and the fish and chips!  Generous portion of fresh baked bread and beautiful views of the bay and Alcatraz. Our server Niessa was super-fantastic!  The place is to the left just as you enter Pier 31 so great location.

3xRujHoCjgfC8Y8qDo9Juw.review_text: We were visiting San Francisco for our anniversary and wanted to dine on amazing sea food.  We did that at Fog Harbor.  We shared a whole crab and clam chowder.  Not only was the food amazing but the staff was equally as amazing!!!!!  Thank you to our waitress, Shawna, for giving us ideas of other spots to go and making our anniversary dinner special!!!

l0KvprRA3hCe3rYpJierQw.review_text: Half of our party were not seafood lovers but everyone was happy! Steak and chicken were amazing. Sea food was also great according to those who had it. Kids loved their portions. Got a great table with a view of the bay! Ambiance was great, casual but not too casual and fancy but not pretentious. We walked in off the street and were seated in less than 5 minutes. Would

EscG72AIyZjhztifzXUN2Q.review_text: How is this place rated so  highly?   1. Service, not good. Hostess was super snotty because I made the reservation online for the wrong day. I could understand her being upset except that there were tables everywhere. Our  server "Clementine" sucked. Forgot my soup, took forever to get me butter for my crab, took forever to bring us dessert. She was scattered and sloppy and sloooow. I wouldn't have tipped her more than 10% but my friend was paying. Left the check before we were done, tacky.   2. The chowder, umm wth? Voted the best in SF? Not even close. If you look at the reviews everyone who rates it highly is a tourist.   3. The food, the crab was good but my friend's halibut was way over cooked and the pumpkin dessert sucked.  I would never be back especially for the prices.
