wf924SjCjgJQzh0vzTxMNA.review_text: Not a bad seafood restaurant - although way overpriced, the view off of Pier 39 makes up for it. The service is attentive, and the food was pretty decent. I tried the Ahi Tuna Poke, which was fresh but under seasoned. I also tried bites of the calamari and several pasta dishes, which were all very good. It's a good place to go as a tourist.

d5IXMuFIZHBpTe20jmYJmQ.review_text: Awesome Moscow mule served just right in a copper mug.  We did not eat here because it was more touristy then what we were looking for hat night.  Seemed very busy so I assume the food is good.  They had a nice looking menu.

sBJbjgvRSgASUf_jng9DFQ.review_text: My favorite restaurant on pier 39! Located on the second level of pier 39, Fog Harbor Fish House offers great food, decent prices as well as good service. I've eaten here about 5-6 times and I've been impressed each time. The food here is very good. I highly recommend the filet mignon with mashed potatoes and spinach. It is my favorite item on the menu and since I am such a potato lover, they replace my spinach for an extra side of mashed potatoes. I've also had the salmon, steamed clams (an appetizer) calamari, popcorn shrimp and clam chowder, all of which are delicious. The food is fairly priced.   The service is good, the waiters/waitresses are very friendly and attentive. They also seem very knowledgable about the menu and will give recommendations and suggestions. I remember going there one time with my friends, our waiter was so sweet he hooked us up with free dessert and put it on the check as a "free birthday dessert" -- awesome!   Definitely recommend this restaurant! One of my favorites -- I am even planning on going tomorrow night!!   One last side note: while waiting for a table you can sit outside on the couches by the fireplace and order drinks from the bar while you wait.

pQD0yqJFcOkFDCMkPbXARA.review_text: I finally found the Best clam chowder in San Fran for me!! If you don't mind the tourist everywhere then this is your place for good seafood. Service was excellent. I ordered a cup of their clam chowder. Man this was phenomenal. No overpowering thyme taste as I mentioned in my review for Capurro's. Clam chowder done right here. Make sure to have reservation as this place is right on the pier where crowds of people are looking for places to eat so they get packed quickly. I had their Fried Combo platter. I love love loved the flakey white fish perfectly battered. The shrimp however that came in my platter was just "ok" really nothing special about it. The Calamari rings were also good. Did enjoy the coleslaw to cut through the richness of my dish. Wash it all down with their house merlot was a perfect dinner minus the mediocre shrimps.

v6EGTaTjZDYn2kcgV-5MEw.review_text: We had a gorgeous experience at our second visit to the fog harbour. The server was a Hawaiian fellow who was very eager to provide some tourist tips and to have some friendly banter. The clam chowder was sublime, creamy, textural, and seasoned well. A true highlight as the menu suggests. We had the. Ran cakes and crab stuffed lobster for main which both rounded out a great meal. The lobster was cooked perfectly with the welcomed addition of crab to give two distinct flavours. The crab cakes were seasoned well, had a nice crunch to the shell and were a good size for the money. The location is a dream for an Aussie like Myself with Alcatraz and golden gate in the background, providing a postcard like backdrop. In summary a strong performing meal with superb service has given me a second great experience from this restaurant. Food 8/10 9/10 decor 7/10

dV4RJbS5AARppHnAFAHUTA.review_text: My waiter's name is Khaiman and he was very good. The food was very well prepared and he had nice suggestions. Next time I'll try the crab ceviche. The environment is good and the view is fantastic.  BTW: I got a free garlic bread with blue cheese only by checking in here at Yelp!

mrJhMCpyMhtHWTT7C9a3gg.review_text: Went here for dinner on a whim... Ordered the garlic butter crab... AMAZING!! The view and the ambiance really set the tone for my mini getaway with my love. The clam crowder was to die for!! Khaiman was a great waiter attentive and helpful.

GyepZybb28J5unnKjV3a_g.review_text: Nice location and great food. The service was also good. Good choice of wine and great desert. The desert menu is rather limited, but they have really good stuff. We recommend a table next to the window enjoying the sunset ;) Good price/quality ratio

f6UgQ4hByardViAlor6Rsw.review_text: Really nice restaurant on Pier 39 with great views of the harbor. Their "Award Winning Clam Chowder" is just that! Simply Amazing!!!! We also ordered the calamari, which was okay, my fiancé really liked it, but I would rate it a 6.5. I live in the Central Valley and I take weekend trips to San Francisco every so often and this place I will definitely return too ;)

t9I2QZ5Cwkvq_plNIOVCrA.review_text: Nice view/very nice and classy ambiance  Great selections  Friendly and professional staff  Very tasty (Serves daily caught fish less than 3 miles away)   SOURDOUGH BREAD = TO DIE FOR

z_jyjDtboP9uqw8p582hAA.review_text: ...not sure if it was the happy hour food or what, but this place was just ok.  Nothing to brag on that I recall.  We did have the calamari and it was decent, but i've had better.  I've even had better from an asian restaurant.  We also had some shrimp that was like out of the oven or something.  I wasn't impressed.  Next time I think we will eat off the dinner menu.

RASYB8uzgZlIWHzSGrsq2A.review_text: Great food. Better atmosphere . I was dining with the Webdoc. Peter had the Dungeness crab and I blackened swordfish. Portions were good, quality even better. Nice view from the window. Shawn our waiter was on top of it and tended to every detail. Get a window table and enjoy!

TO5UgRsX9tLWdDp6f27w7A.review_text: Love Love Love !!!  Excellent: sourdough bread, blue cheese garlic bread, clam chowder!  Highly recommend!!

IxrkMwtW1emHp7cifyq40A.review_text: I LOVE seafood!!!  Came here with no reservations around 1:00pm and waited just about 10 mins.  Not bad since the place was really crowded!  Got seated and our waiter brought out some fresh sourdough bread with butter! YUM!  Let's cut to the chase.  They are famous for their clam chowder and that was a must have!  We ordered:  Soup and Salad Combo (($14.00) Caesar salad with chicken & clam chowder in a bread bowl.  Probably the best clam chowder I've ever had!  There were lots of clams in it and the soup was not watered down.  I love eating soup that you can actually chew!  Very creamy, buttery, and full of goodness!  Fish & Chips ($16.00)- Hand dipped in "Anchor Steam" beer batter with cole slaw.  The best fish and chips I've had as well! Super crunchy and full of flavors!  Definitely fills you up!  If you get this, maybe order another dish so you won't get sick of it!  Sharing is caring ;)  Mixed Grill ($23.00): Grilled Salmon, Swordfish and Shrimp, citrus buerre blanc, sauteed vegetables, and garlic mashed potatoes.  This was just an okay dish.  I tried to be healthy and order something that was in that range but this dish was just kinda blah.  The swordfish and salmon were kind of dried but the shrimp and mashed potatoes were phenomenal! Buttery!  This is a very busy restaurant so make sure that when you get your bill, check it!  Our waiter actually gave us the wrong bill so good thing I checked it!  After the bill comes out, you get some kind of gingerbread cookie!  Very delish!  Overall, this place was good!  Great view as well!  NOTE: -Make reservations -Free Cookies after your meal -Complimentary bread and butter

G5HELqHfNfC02ToA8NVQHg.review_text: The location is nice but the food is way overpriced and not very good. We had 2 cocktails, 2 sodas, order of oysters, filet, lobster tail and swordfish. The bill was $200.00 (not including tip). The oysters were the only decent item on the list. The lobster was chewy and lacked flavor, the steak was bland and the swordfish was drowned in sauce. All of the veggies/potatoes that came with the meals were overcooked. The service was good but not great. I wouldn't go back again.

qE6ESN3gF_ax_4ZtaR-giw.review_text: Fog Harbor Fish House- you were great. I wanted to celebrate my actual birthday dinner by the water to get a nice view of the sunset but unfortunately mother nature wasn't on board with my plans. Either way the hostess was friendly and sat us by a window. The restaurant does cater to the tourist who are wandering around Pier 39. It has a romantic-feel to it--too bad I was with my best friend!   Our  waiter was super friendly and attentive throughout the entire night. We checked in and got free garlic bread to start off with. We ordered our glasses of wine and I already knew what i wanted since I Yelped their menu. I had the mixed grill which comes with salmon, swordfish, and shrimp-mashed potatoes and broccoli. The salmon wasn't great-it was a bit overcooked but the rest of the dish was super filling. The waiter came over and told us to text a number regarding the service and we would get  a free dessert--uh no problem! It was delicious and left me incapable of moving. They really take pride in their service which left me feeling happy!

9gDhzWjsloW5AZck_uSwQg.review_text: Tourist trap. Nothing special if you live in SF. Dollar sign should actually be 3 $$$ for this restaurant. Service was great.

cRACPOyTRYkbjvv5PMQuKQ.review_text: My gf and I were in SF for the Daniel Tosh tour and asked our friend for dinner suggestions.  First on her list was Fog Harbor, so we decided to give it a try.   I saw a long wait list and wasn't too thrilled about that.  To our surprise it was just a 15 minute wait on a Saturday evening. We were seated and perused the menu to see what I would like to feast upon for dinner.  Our server Khaiman took our drink and appetizer orders.   When he came back I asked him what was the popular item on the menu.  He immediately said the shellfish platter is a popular item as well as their mixed grill and a couple other items.  I ordered the shellfish platter and my gf the mixed grilled.  Khaiman recommended she get it Cajun flavored for the fish and he was right, but more on that later.  We were given some fresh sourdough bread with our appetizers and it was amazing. We had the Dungeness crab, mango and avocado ceviche and while good, it wasn't amazing or to die for.   We also decided to each get a cup of their clam chowder.  This is a definite must have and something I would get again. Nice flavor with a good amount of clams.  It's not overloaded with fillers like potatoes that other restaurants utilize. Now for the main course.  The Shellfish platter came with 1/2 a Dungeness crab, mussels, clams, shrimp, and corn.  All of those was drenched in a garlic and herb oil that put this dish over the top.  I love garlic so it was like this dish was made for me.  Everything was fresh and cooked just right.  Price was fair considering what was included.   The mixed grill my gf had was amazing.  The Cajun flavoring wasn't spicy or over powering. It complimented the salmon, swordfish, and shrimp well.  Something I'd recommend to order if you prefer fish over shellfish.  We opted out of dessert cause we were quite stuffed and couldn't possibly eat another bite.   When Khaiman brought out our bill he included some biscoff cookies to enjoy at the show.   I should mention I ordered a Moscow Mule to sip on during dinner.  I'm picky since I make my own mules often and they did it right.  Perfect balance of ginger beer and vodka which made it a refreshing beverage. Of course it was served in a copper mug which every mule should be.  We have a wonderful experience at Fog Harbor and will be back once we visit Frisco again.  If you have a chance stop by and you won't be disappointed.  Oh and if you can get Khaiman as your server. He won't steer you wrong and will make sure your glass is always full.

bozrqlaG3x1CfJ5vOI2AhQ.review_text: We were visiting pier 39 and quickly yelped for a good seafood place. The girlfriend wanted to try the crab shack, but I liked the vibe of this one. I'm glad we went here: the view was incredible, and the food was generally fantastic!   We went with  the "famous" clam chowder (in a bowl) - good but I don't see what the fuss is about  The seafood cioppino - this knocked the ball out the park, the fresh tomato sauce based broth, mussels, shrimp, scallops were all made just perfectly. You can't go wrong with this one.   Lemon fried calamari - Tip, if you have a city pass or one of those flyers at the sf visitor center, be sure to exchange for a welcoming booklet at pier 39, you get the calamari free with two entrees.  This was better than we expected, with the calamari fried to just the right amount of crispness and the lemon sauce providing a bit of zest.   A dozen oysters - the girlfriend was aching for oysters, I was lucky enough to sample a few and they were just fantastic.   If you're visiting pier 39, this place is a must.

EeNxafbMAJg7m4mIe1h95A.review_text: We were in the San Francisco area and decided to try out the Fog House. We ordered two bowls of clam chowder, the crab cakes, and the poke. We requested that the clam chowder came out first and I tried with all my might to stop eating it to leave room for the other stuff, but it was too yummy. Although it wasn't quite as rich as chowder usually is. The crab cakes were also good. The poke had a unique mango flavor and paired well with the filling chowder. Overall the food was really good. We will definitely be going back if we find ourselves in the area. I would say that the one thing everyone going here has to order is that clam chowder.

wHip-tIYauP94YcJOfSiwA.review_text: Your in SF and you want seafood and a water view right?!! You'll get all of these here..but  I'd say all in all, we were a bit underwhelmed for the price point.. Did we clean our plates? Of course!  Shared, jumbo shrimp cocktail and Ahi and Crab Cakes.. I think I expected the Ahi to blow me away and whileit was  good- it didn't blow me away.. crab cakes had lots of nice crab and the shrimp were just fine though.  Our waiter was nice enough. However, he did reach across our table from the opposite side and pick up empty glasses by the rims. I notice these things because I used to be in service and these are just simple things that clearly the mgmt doesn't watch for.  Otherwise,  their staff wouldn't be dong these things.. we had a very nice evening and enjoyed the views and the food but we'd probably try some other places next time.

BDlZK7jcR0NZF9PjB2Yxcg.review_text: Food and service was ok. I feel that you are paying more for the location.  Wasn't a terrible experience, but it wasn't a great experience. I'm on the fence about this place.  My friends said they enjoyed it though..so maybe it was just me.

CNlud2-t1JN2ADjiMliV5Q.review_text: This place was awesome! The clam chowder in the bread bowl was delicious and we topped it off with some hot chocolate cake, perfect ending to a perfect meal. Our server was Meron and she was really nice and had great suggestions. I'd definitely recommend coming here, even if only for the views of Alcatraz or the bridge!

FCT2AcooXjMtoHTsEUTDrA.review_text: Horrible place and awful service. My wife and I and another couple had a bottle of wine at the bar while we waited for our table and the bartender was very rude and unpleasant. Then we were seated and given menus and not 5 minutes later the manager came over and said they would not serve us any more drinks. At no point were we rude or obnoxious. I guess the bartender was having a bad day and needed to take it out on someone. Overall the service and atmosphere was severely lacking.

VXRhvAIuj5kdIJ_eJX6Q_g.review_text: Food was great. Started off with blue cheese baked garlic bread on sourdough and bowl if clam chowder. For the main course, we ordered the porterhouse steak special and subbed it with the whiskey peppercorn sauce....amazing and steak was tender and juicy! Also got the fried combo....calamari, fried shrimp with a medley of bomb aiolis! Khaiman, our server was awesome.

wlZDmZvRFXSSSuMlKzLXng.review_text: Very upscale restaurant!  More so than I was expecting.  We tried the Dungeness Crab Cocktail for an appetizer - very fresh!  The clam chowder soup was outstanding.  So creamy and delicious.  I had the special lobster roll for my main dish and it was great.  Good pieces of lobster.  Stuffed when we left!  Service was only ok, but food was great!  312/365

GCuDiPUKYxhgFHP5LqJa2Q.review_text: 3.5 stars  We went to Pier 39 for the live music - specifically for Tainted Love.  Got there early and thought some oysters would be nice.  Fog Harbor is one of the nicer place on the Pier.  The front open space is spacious, modern and the fireplace is a nice touch.  We had no idea the restaurant is huge - there are a lot of tables in the back.  We grabbed the first booth seat in the front and settled in.  Our waiter, Khaiman? was very friendly and great at selling.  What we had:  Anchor Steam - $6.23 glass of Prosecco - $8.5 1/2 dozen oyster (2x) - $13 - from Prince Edwards Island.  These were very good, plump, sweet, creamy and fresh.  I can probably eat a couple dozens easily. curry mussels - $12 - pretty good, nice curry flavor with plenty garlic clam chowder - ordered a bowl mainly because of the Yelp reviews but what a disappointment.  It was chalky and not very flavorful.  Since we didn't eat it, they took it off our bill.  The dessert tray looked very tempting - the bread pudding with Ghiradelli chocolate chips looked quite good.

JeEhTF0opUP1z7J9R0PC9g.review_text: Great food!  After a long day of tourist attractions we referred to yelp and thought we would give this place a chance based on the reviews.  Great ambiance and waterfront!  Reasonably priced for waterfront restaurant.  We got the Blue Cheese Garlic Bread.  Tasted awesome!  Also ordered the crab cake entree and ahi tuna entree.  Very good!  Would recommend.

GcUCFPT68HWi6LyEx1hWdA.review_text: I am a local, born and raised in SF, and this was the first time I have gone here. It was definitely worth fending off all the tourists and crappy parking to go here. The oysters were phenomenal and the crab ceviche was very fresh. I had the seafood cioppino which was very good and my boyfriend had the king salmon which he said was great as well. The drinks are overpriced but the food more than made up for it. The service was great as well. We had a very attentive waitress who checked on us multiple times. I will definitely be back again!

NRZYuHMukj-pWsdLWayt4Q.review_text: This is a lovely restaurant, the food was great with very decent sized servings. The service was wonderful, Neissa was looking after us and she was cheerful, friendly and did a great job!

i6RoTLHeg75swW_BCJSxGg.review_text: Amazing experience here on a beautiful Sunday afternoon. Waited about 15 minutes and had a couple drinks at the bar. Once we were seated we were greeted by a sweet girl who had told us it was actually her first week. We ordered a bottle of wine and the shellfish for two! The shellfish for two was more than enough for both of us. If you love delicious flavorful shrimp and buttery garlic flavored crab legs this is the dish for you. I loved the atmosphere, the food, the wine and the service was top notch! I'm so glad I came here instead of The Crab House.

eab8pI_gcctp3U3_NgYamg.review_text: We like trying different restaurants during our yearly visits to San Francisco and decided to give Fog Harbor Fish House a try. We arrived after the lunch crowd but before the dinner crowd so the restaurant wasn't very busy. We were seated right away at the back with a nice view of Coit Tower to the left and the bay to the right.   We were given fresh sourdough bread and butter. What I ordered was simple, fried shrimp with fries and coleslaw and hubby had Seafood Penne with fresh fish, clams and mussels in a tomato cream sauce. The food was fresh and hot, good but nothing special. The shrimp was medium in size and fried to a nice golden crisp but unremarkable in taste as was the fries and coleslaw. Per my husband although the seafood was fresh the seafood penne was bland. The service was average, our waiter was more interested in the 3 girls that was seated at the table next to us and totally abandoned our table.  Even when he was at the other table we couldn't get his attention and he pretty much ignored us, we had to flag down another waiter to get our check because our waiter disappeared.   The food was fresh and the views were really nice, definitely worth a 2nd visit but would order something totally different.

1kNsEAhGU8d8xugMuXJGFA.review_text: 3.5/5, +.5 for service  Well, Fog Harbor was my first dinner stop in my 11-day trip down the west coast. Our theme was seafood for our San Francisco stops, since I personally have never been to the Pacific coast and really wanted to test out what's so great about their seafood.  We reserved via OpenTable and had to wait about 15-20 minutes for a window seat, but we did get a seat eventually and were promptly served.  Our dinner included the "award winning" clam chowder, dungeness crab cakes, garlic roasted crab, wild salmon, lobster tail, and the lobster mac and cheese. Well, the first thing we realized was we ordered way too much. I understood America and their big portions, but the portions were not just big, they were huge. The garlic roasted crab had to have been at least 5 pounds, and I was actually completely shocked my mom managed to finish the whole crab (although she didn't even touch the corn cob and potatoes). The lobster tail also tasted very good, and that we were actually able to complete. The award winning clam chowder definitely lived up to its name: Creamy (but not too creamy) soup with plentiful clam chunks and easy on the potatoes. The wild salmon was also good, however once again it was so large on portions we couldn't finish it. The lobster mac and cheese was baked and was probably the disappointment of the meal as it really didn't taste anything special, especially when comparing the other orders.  Service started brilliantly, and quite frankly I don't really blame the waitress that much for the slightly worse service we got as we were finishing our meal, since the restaurant closed at 10 and we were still eating at 10:45 (I did say the portions were huge!!!). We finally left around 11 and were the last customers departing the restaurant, having finally experienced seafood in the west coast...miles better than the east coast.

cl2r-UJA7wrgEgr0fgP25A.review_text: Food and service are good. Location is great, very convenient.

zejTWFNKTAEk4G8a6GAw8Q.review_text: I would have licked the plate if I weren't in public! I ate at Fog Harbor Fish House last night, for the first time, and it was absolutely amazing! A super chill blonde lady, who was very personable, waited on us and was VERY attentive. My party of four was seated immediately. Waiters and waitresses all smiled, and said hello as they walked by - even commented on our food and if we were enjoying it! Everything was flavorful... but goodness.... the Lobster Mac & Cheese deserves a ribbon of excellence, or something! I happily give this place 5 stars... and you should to!

pWLv2TEEIceumZ_wcaUvuA.review_text: You're paying for the view but the food's pretty good. Clam chowder is as good as anywhere else on the wharf. The crab very good.

Rt-XJ5yInDRiFsgQ0Uam-A.review_text: Loved this restaurant!  It's right at Pier 39 - so the location can't be beat.  We got the crab, and it was totally amazing!  The garlic butter is to die for.  You gotta go for it!  Also ordered the fish - it was only so-so.  My big piece of advice is don't do fish - just get double the crab!

u_5944V9AIr1xv8xwqdKyg.review_text: I'm giving a 5 star because I can't think of anything that I didn't like. Maybe just the wait? but good places always have to wait.   I ordered the fish & chips, the fish is really good, big chucks of meat, very light batter great fresh taste. Fried calamari was very good as well, very fresh and chewy. Clam chowder has lots of clams.   Been to a few places at pier 39 and this time was my best experience. Nice view, nice staffs, would go back.

K-3AlC2oipTkxuQCvKV-5w.review_text: AMAZING! First of all, great location right on the pier, beautiful views. I ordered a cup of clam chowder which was hot and delicious, served with fresh sourdough bread. For my entree I ordered the crab and avocado salad - sooo good! Can't beat that fresh crab. Our waiter was super friendly and attentive. I would recommend this place to anyone visiting the SF area looking for some good seafood with great views.

QzcZmCVwkfqoxTUakrOWCQ.review_text: Very friendly staff at the bar, delicious food. I highly recommended. I wanted to try the lobster Mac and cheese because I saw it on a yelp post but they weren't offering at the current time. They were nice enough to accommodate my request and make it for me. It was awesome! The clam chowder in a bread was delicious too. Very nice food. My review is for dinner time.

IGiRyV2t6p1HT3_Rk-JWpg.review_text: Absolutely my favorite restaurant at pier39. Any item i've ordered wether it be crabcakes,steak or lobstser..heck, even the bread they bring out nice &warm & fluffy w/butter. Highly recommend this spot, its worth your buck.

jhEc1YShRsXStqMk7KV9wg.review_text: Pier 39 is usually for the tourists and a area where most locals avoid at all costs. It's not exactly a reflection of San Francisco and is filled with over priced,  bland food. It can be easy to get lost and settle for something that burns through your wallet and leaves you reaching for the tabasco.   Well, if you do find your self stuck in this area, and hungry, Fog Harbor is a great spot to fill your craving. The food isn't cheap, but you're going to shell out the same amount of money at most spots in the area.   PRO TIP: If you happen to park in the Pier 39 parking lot... get validated here and spend money on the chowder and calamari instead of parking!

lP-CJ4okAuLhQX8-QOUTVw.review_text: Came here for an anniversary dinner, and was thoroughly impressed.   Our waitress was personable and had great customer service. We ordered the seafood penne and linguine with clams. Both were perfect, and not over-saturated with flavors as many pasta dishes come. The salmon in the seafood penne was freshly caught that morning and you could tell, it melted in my mouth and I'm drooling thinking about it.   We watched the sunset over the marina and it was absolutely gorgeous.  I can understand how other reviewers feel about the crowds because of tourists, but it's because this restaurant has it all. Even with the many customers, the staff was not overwhelmed - it didn't disturb us.   Anyway, if you are a tourist looking at reviews to pick an excellent seafood restaurant with a great view, I highly recommend Fog Harbor!

CTR-ZWVHbqmcJEwx_rOXKA.review_text: We found the Fog Harbor Fish House on Yelp.... and we're happy we did.  We had an excellent evening starting with super drinks and ending with one of their yummy desserts.  Service was excellent.  Dinner was fantastic... seafood of course... with a large selection.  Recommend it highly.    We hadn't been in San Francisco in many years.  Dinner at Fog Harbor was a highlight of a super two night stay.  We'll be back.

ncDvsOBA1BobJbfvbOcTcg.review_text: Must order the Dungeness crab cioppino, so deliciously flavorful since the seafood is very fresh. The portion is very generous so there will definitely be left overs, which it taste even better the next day! It's also nice that they provide the option to de-shell the crab for you.

iH-UGq7G1UqvsSFfSO2E3w.review_text: I chose this restaurant based on yelp and not only was the food and view amazing but our waitress Madison really made the experience great. I highly recommend!

39bkrrnFA5T5Evl6M_ASzA.review_text: The food was amazing, I had the crab linguine alfredo.   I also had the Syrah and the wine was equally as good.   It sits right on the water in Fisherman Wharf so there were great waterviews.   Overall, I really enjoyed the food, service, and atmosphere of Fog Harbor and will definitely go back the next time I am in the San Francisco area.

3FMK2LpNHcUyuY09_4bGFw.review_text: Fog Harbor Fish House is the cliche Pier 39 restaurant, average food quality, but rather expensive. The clam chowder was wonderful and those sitting next to me enjoyed their lobster mac and cheese. On the other hand, for me, the crab roll was mediocre.    It felt little different than as if it were out of a can, but the Texas Toast made it work a little. The prices were also fairly high, but the server was attentive despite the difficulties of working at a crowded Pier 39 restaurant.   The moral of the story is not to be some dimwit who eats at Pier 39. Pier 39 is the land of the $5 corn dog and $4 soda. It's a tourist trap of worldwide proportions, filled with every museum or giant machine that wants to grab your money in existence.   Sure, Pier 39 has great attractions like Rocket Boat, Musee Mecanique and so on. But for god's sake - save the eating for the Mission or somewhere else you can get to on the streetcar. Anywhere but in Pier 39.  Fog Harbor Fish House is best avoided. If you go out to San Francisco's many neighborhoods, you'll have better food, even regarding fish and seafood. Fisherman's Wharf also has some wonderful seafood in stands and restaurants which is a lot better than the more touristy Pier 39. And it's only about two blocks away.

czrjqJBZ_pp2ZBzPdHOgbg.review_text: Found ourselves on Pier 39 looking for something small to eat (already had a bread bowl with clam chowder while walking around).  Saw the yelp offer of a free appetizer for this place so figured what the heck.  Turned out fantastic.  Had a beautiful seat with a view, a fee appetizer and our Liquini with clam sauce was amazing.

qphl-0CNgmkXhzxehajoxw.review_text: Wonderful atmosphere overlooking the bay. Our server was excellent and our food was delicious. I liked that they offered "skinny" drink options. It was our anniversary and our server bought us dessert, which was a delicious apple crisp with vanilla ice cream. I would definitely go back!

gmM7maEZA7FrV9XbGsThrQ.review_text: Here for some seafood chowdown and wasn't disappointed. Drinks weak so make sure to ask for strong stuff or you'll be disappointed.    CLAM CHOWDER was too watery and lack filling.  I think a Boudin can would taste better. oh now really did I just say that?!  JUMBO COCKTAIL $13 for 4 shrimps. 1/2 OYSTERS in a nicely presented plate in center of table. Fresh!!! $13.00 1 WHOLE Garlic CRAB $39.  Great great with butter sauce on side. Well, it was with lobster but oh well, let's dip away.  COCKTAILS: Lemon Drop (strong), Long Beach (whole crab strong!), Blackberry Martini (juice was this??! disappointed), and Alcatraz (oh ok..) if you like rum.  Total for 3 adults $180with tax about $190+($60 + a person). Would that be $$$$?  Would be back here if I were not so allergic to seafood and had to just watch as my favorite other two people chow down while I feed the little babes.  Agh, the life.  Friendly upbeat service in a nicely decorated place with great view and really a great place for family (Stroller parking outside is safe).   It's on 2nd floor so find elevator by NFL store across the way. Check receipt for coupon deals. Don't toss..i know u might be buzzed...but really, check first.

3RIUIlmcId_8ddv4hTd47A.review_text: Great calamari with a cold beer was a great choice just wish they were better in their service

lY8iSm6_WQkd9M3tfJAEew.review_text: My husband and I were vacationing in San Francisco and we decided to visit this restaurant based on the Yelp reviews, and I really had a taste for seafood. It was a Sunday and based on recommendation of Yelp reviews, we made a reservation on OpenTable. The only one they had available was for 5:30pm. But when we got there, there were plenty of table available so...I don't know.  They sat us at a table with a view of the water and setting sun. Beautiful. Our waiter was...a rock star. I asked for a virgin strawberry daiquiri but they brought it with whip cream which I can't have. My husband took it and our waiter brought another one on the house. We ordered one of their appetizer specials, risotto and crab fritters. We didn't like it but didn't complain. Our waiter asked how we liked it and we were honest. So he said we could order something else on the house. Who does that!? Plus he didn't hover and wasn't distant. We gave him 20% tip.  We ordered the following:  Clam chowder - delicious! Crab mango ceviche - yum Crab risotto balls fritters - okay Lobster tail - yum Seafood Cioppino with pasta - yum  I would have ordered dessert if they had cheesecake.  I wouldn't mind coming back. Good for groups, dates. There is validated parking in the garage, just remember to give your waiter the ticket. The Pier also has other cool places the check out.

RJKcI5Qq5NtIdZbmHTwXzg.review_text: I came here with my boyfriend on our first trip to SF. My boyfriend is a big fan of seafood so we decided to try this place. The ambiance here is nice, classy yet casual. Makes it more comfortable without it being too dim. We ordered a dozen oysters, crab rolls, lobster mac n cheese, and the alcatraz drink. EVERYTHING WAS GREAT!  Although I did not eat the oyster, my boyfriend said it was really good - very fresh. The crab rolls were good, but nothing super special. However, the lobster mac n cheese was super BOMB! I've never tasted anything like it - it was beyond delicious! The lobster chunks were huge and the pasta was cooked to perfection. I am not a big fan of alcohol and hate the taste of alcohol, but the Alcatraz was delicious! It was fruity and slushy like, but the hint of alcohol was very little. 100% going back to this place again!

X5VL_N2qt1NDxYpcB_EmBg.review_text: Growing hungry for something a little bit more substantial though, we paid a visit to Fog Harbor Fish House, a family-owned seafood restaurant well known at the Pier for great crab and great views.  Great views, check! Located right at the pier's edge and where a lot of the Blue and Gold Fleet cruises dock.  Crab? Check! A whole menu entirely dedicated to the local Dungeness crab. Fresh and a multitude of preparations, making it very hard for us to choose a single dish.  Joe and I were in the noshing mood, planning to go to Fisherman's Wharf for dinner (post to come!). We shared the 1/2 lb crab, stir fried with onions, peppers, in a spicy red chili garlic sauce. NOM! Turned out a lot better than I thought it would be. The shell was super soft, making it pretty easy to crack even without the crab cracker, and the garlic sauce was nice and spicy! The highlight of the dish: the fresh crab meat waiting inside the shell. Sweet and juicy. Should have ordered a second crab dish in my opinion!  Our other dish: an ahi tuna poke. After having amazing poke in LA, we've been looking around for a good poke. A trip to Hawaii next perhaps? Anyways, the dish was beautifully presented with crispy wonton chips with white and black sesame seeds, a wasabi aioli, an unidentified hot sauce, seaweed, and the ahi tuna marinated in a sesame soy sauce with avocados and mango. Yum! The mango made the dish it's own and added to the refreshing taste. Still not up to our standard from Venice Beach, but satisfying enough.  Great eats, but you definitely pay the price for the location and the view. If you want straight up fresh seafood, served simple, look forward to my Fisherman's Wharf post coming this week!

kG5dqjJz6rS124qJdrBoYQ.review_text: So a few weeks back, me and Matthew went to San Francisco for the day with my grandparents. While walking the pier, we stopped by this place. Matthew and myself were a little hesitant because we don't eat seafood.   Luckily, they offered more than seafood. So we started out with drinks. I had the Moscow mule and my grandma had the Lombard lemonade. The guys had some straight scotch I believe. The bread was really good too.   Matthew and I got the chicken penne which was delicious. The service was great and the view was even better! Would totally recommend this place! A bit pricey, but worth it.

46g1PTpxcRkT9KFsrXLFhg.review_text: We had a very good experience here.  Every dish and drink that came to the table was enjoyed. We had a table by the window.  This restaurant, to me, is a great place for a special occasion celebration.  Large open space, white table cloths. GOOD FOOD!  If I'm remembering correctly, the CLAM CHOWDER was spot on. The SEAFOOD FRIED COMBO was nicely done.  We had an assortment of dishes on our table, including the Lobster Mac n Cheese, the Ahi Poke and none of them disappointed us.  The Garlic Crab was good, but The Crab House next door has them beat when it comes to this dish.  I love it when Yelpers drop hints like this in their reviews, so here is a good tip for you.  Go to The Crab House literally next door and get the Garlic Crab.  Best I've had.  I like this place a lot.  It's between a 4 and a 5 for me. This is exactly what you would expect from a classy version of a fish house.

aJiPpb2V85K_pdmPMQ3WhQ.review_text: Came here Sunday morning at 11:15 ish with reservations, to be greeted with quick customer service! With my party of 6, we were delighted to get a table with just a breathtaking view. Absolutely gorgeous. With a quick change of waiters, because why not, a new friendly lady (I should get on top of remembering my servers names...) helped up decently well. We all ordered the clam chowder in a bread bowl, a half garlic crab, and some drinks.  The chowder was delicious but pretty much the same thing as everywhere else in the Pier 39 area. I ordered a ginger lemonade, while expensive (like everything at Pier 39), was refreshing! They also had alcohol-free wines which my friend enjoyed. The garlic crab was decent, but I've had better in the area from small restaurants. The check-in for the free blue cheese garlic bread was a nice touch!   Food is high quality, overall good customer service, and an AMAZING view of San Francisco! Excited for the next time around!

ngQLmk_aiYuJhTqsZEhrEg.review_text: Kind of a tourist-trap, but prices and food are more than OK for what it is.  We had the Ahi tuna (very good), and the Fish and Chips (I'd give them 3.5 stars.) The service was nice, with good sights of the pier.

-5hG5GO2tq1gMCL5G2mNyQ.review_text: I have had the opportunity to eat at many, many San Francisco restaurants. In terms of ambiance and quality of food, Fog Harbor ranks at the top of my list.  It's location on the Pier makes for a wonderful backdrop for lunch or dinner. The servers are friendly and have a great understanding of the menu options. Most recently I enjoyed the crab cakes and the Surg & Turf. Delicious!   Sometimes the restaurant gets a little loud, but that's only because so many people are enjoying themselves. I look forward to coming back again soon!

uTsG5j9CTemtQOJfz3F-bA.review_text: We were visiting San Francisco from San Diego just for the weekend for my birthday! We were exploring the pier and found this place via Yelp.  ATMOSPHERE: Nice view of the water. Casual. Crowded on a Saturday at 2pm so we knew it must be good.  A lot of large groups come to this place.  FOOD: We ordered -  1. Complimentary bread  2. Blue cheese bread - yummy. This paired well with the soup broth of the cioppino 3. Swordfish w/ capers, grilled veggies - very, very good! Healthy too. Definitely would order this again.  4. Cioppino - huge portion!  Definitely enough for 2 even without the pasta which is $2 extra. I opted for the crab to be cracked for me for an extra $4. Good but probably would not order again.   5. Tiramisu - delicious! Creamy layers. Definitely recommend. Big enough to share between 2 people and maybe even 3.  6. Moscow mule - served in a copper cup! Very good but not the best one I've had which was in San Diego and I don't think they use bitters.  SERVICE: Excellent! The waitress, Ika who was from Kazakhstan, even sang happy birthday to me all by herself, haha.  TIPS: Check-in on FourSquare, Yelp for a free blue cheese bread appetizer! Also check into the pier for a free coupon book at the visitors center which has a coupon in the book for Fog Harbor for a free blue cheese bread OR calamari appetizer.  If it's your birthday, just say so and they treat you to a complimentary desert! Score! Also reservations can be made on OpenTable.  PRICE: I would say moderate to pricey. Paying full price for a full lunch including appetizer, drink, main dish, dessert expect at least $50 per person.  CONCLUSION: Good food, very big portions, nice view, great service. Solid restaurant! There are so many good restaurants in SF and although this is not a "must do" restaurant, it's a good choice.

H0A2kJ089dOTNgdwZ9GMRQ.review_text: Probably as touristy an area on Fisherman's Wharf as you could find.... But food is good---better than all the others(cept for Hog Island). Good crab rolls, fresh oysters, ok house white & great SF homemade sour dough. Clam chowder excellent. If stuck in area I'd return over all the other spots around it.

mh0LA3jd2sr1xrOutXKmiw.review_text: Wow is all I have to say. Every single thing we ate was out of hand. I suggest skipping out on the appetizers and just saving room for your meals. Lobster mac and cheese, garlic crab everything was out of hand good!

g9YHOduTOL-hxcB-eTPjkA.review_text: Hands down the best calamari I've had, not over-breaded and cooked just enough and not chewy. The blue cheese garlic bread was very rich and flavorful. Fish and chips for the main course - also perfect! Our waitress was super nice and the manager was very friendly and took time to tell us about how they only use sustainable fish suppliers. So, they don't overfish the areas and wipe out populations. They have closely inspected all their suppliers and it shows in the quality of the food. Great experience!

FmY7lphPGQHxkwcUKIx-MA.review_text: Best Clam Chowder! Faycal was a great waiter with a wonderful sense of humor. The outside fireplace makes you hope you have a bit of a wait, while enjoying a few cocktails.

ySAPe_VJPyB_2RiS4t65bg.review_text: A little over priced for the food since there is so much good food in the same area, just as fresh but this place is quiet, clean and the service was good.

e4wvIoyiqFg3ZqfaGQtI5g.review_text: A couple of weeks ago my boyfriend and I came here for dinner on his last night in San Francisco. The atmosphere was great and the food was delicious. Meron was our server and she made us feel right at home. She was able to give great drink recommendations and also went the extra mile to ask for meal substitutions. She has an awesome personality and was a big part of the reason we had such an awesome last dinner.  We ordered clams, calamari, and the fish and chips entree with garlic fries. Everything was perfect. We went on a weekday so although the location is a major tourist area, it wasn't too busy since we weren't having dinner during the weekend. If this is your first time to San Francisco this is a great place to explore and eat great food!

2qKOL7C7WbG_M3EOWvTFxA.review_text: Sure, it's in a touristy part of town, but do I live in SF? Nope...so that would make me a tourist! No?  So we went over for dinner, after a long day of training. The view is really nice, and I recommend a table by the window so you can see the bay, and in some parts even Alcatraz (maybe not romantic, but still a cool sight).   We started off sharing a couple of appetizers: Shrimp cocktail and crab cakes. Both were good!  Entree I had the Mixed Grill which brings Grilled Salmon, Swordfish and Shrimp and a garlic mashed potatoes. Everything was grilled perfectly. My favorite was the swordfish but the other two (and that mash!) were great too.  For dessert we had the chocolate bread pudding. Big enough that three of us shared and it was just the right way to end the meal.  Customer service was great. Our waiter accidentally switched up the wine orders and gave them to the wrong people. He felt so embarrassed he apologized the rest of the night. It really was no biggie, but he wanted to make sure he made it right.

zZxaFnid9SdKy1ToRSHuAQ.review_text: We stopped in on a whim, we liked that they fished 100% sustainably! And the view of the harbor, Golden Gate Bridge, and Alcatraz was great! Wow well we were pleasently surprised! The food was absolutely amazing! We had the crab and risotto fritters and then swordfish and the lobster tail as entrees. Finishing with the apple crumble and tiramisu as desert, the apple crumble was the better of the two though but were great! But really it was our waiter Charlie that made us love it even more. His service was great and he was able to really make recommendations and seemed very knowledgeable about the food and the wines! And the manager on duty was also a pleasure to talk to and was on the floor much of the night so she was easy to grab and talk to! We'll definitely be back and would definitely recommend!

7Hc_iM_xCVJjMfACR8Rcsw.review_text: I know it's a seafood restaurant but I ordered the New York steak and it was very good. My husband ate the crab cakes and clam chowder and said they were better than what he had in Boston. The views of the bay were beautiful too.

buPCp80zdVrYWeWnnvghRg.review_text: My girlfriend recently sampled Seattle's clam chowder and when she returned she craved for more.  Aiming to please her, we went to Fog Harbor Fish House after scouring yelp reviews after review.  All the hard work paid off.  We ordered the free Blue Cheese Garlic Bread which was free with the first Yelp check in.  One clam chowder for both of us and the Mixed grill (Grilled salmon, swordfish, and shrimp w/ vegetables and a carb) to share.  The clam chowder was very good, was abundant with clams, very creamy, was a bit heavy on the salt.  Dishes made a bit too salty is a common complaint of ours.  Our dinner entry came split on separate plates, a very nice touch.  The shrimp was a bit on the salty side, the salmon was very good, and the swordfish was delectable.  A nice ending to a stroll through Fisherman's Wharf while playing tourist.  Will return for more clam chowder and will order just the grilled swordfish.

2t5_cQ2MOECngiMlDh6eaQ.review_text: Excellent service.  Super tasty clam chowder, calamari, and blue cheese garlic bread.  Very reasonable price for Pier 39.  Highly recommended!

fUVlvzKOO-SpvZj3mnuqOg.review_text: I was there for my friend's anniversary and my mother in law's b-day. Both time it was great service, plenty of food, and free blue cheese bread due to check in.  I will be back whenever I have visitors. :)

jvlcoGVo4arj5dtbnsC0Jg.review_text: Seared Ahi tuna was spectacular! The clam chowder was very good. Great sourdough and an excellent wine recommendation. Service was perfect.

pGTP56e_LdLl2HN3iuGofQ.review_text: The best Cioppino ever! Also, great view of the bay.

zoYysMVgd65eYowTrfZQRQ.review_text: Award winning clam chowder was perfect in a sour dough bread bowl. Fresh bread and butter as an appetizer was excellent. Friendly waiters, fast service, and just a great atmosphere! If your around Pier 39 this is a good place for amazing sea food.

gkjkDvLv4fsMP8b6-Z1d1g.review_text: We are SF locals but decided to venture out and be tourists and get dinner at the Pier. This place had great reviews and we were craving seafood.  Came at about 7pm and were told it was an hour wait for 2. We hung out around the pier and came back after 45 minutes and they were ready for us. Got a beautiful table by the window with a great view.  Mila was our fabulous waitress with a great personality, and told us there is a 15% discount for all locals! Yay!  Right away, got the amazing warm and fresh sourdough. Love.  Started with the crab ceviche with pineapple and avocado. The crab was perfect but pineapple made it too sweet. I give it 3 stars.   Then the amazing, hearty bowl of clam chowder. I have had great chowder and this one is definitely on the top of my list.  For entrees we got the surf and turf and the seafood platter. Surf and turf is delicious with a perfectly made 10 oz steak and delicious crab stuffed lobster.  The seafood platter is generous with lots of clams and mussels and shrimp. The half crab was perfect. Corn is buttery and excellent.  Paired everything with Moscow Mules - must get!   No room for dessert but you do get biscoff cookies with your check.  Great food, would deinitely come back.

bQTeiPhTjEtZqglZC-adjQ.review_text: The view was great. The crab cakes were outstanding. My wife got the clam chowder, it was average at best.  I got the special for the night which was crab stuffed lobster and I didn't walk away to impressed. Wine was great.  Service was average to good So my dinner was average but I paid top dollar.

mT6M9KsElw1anibSP0vW_g.review_text: Swordfish was very good. It looks like chicken, has the texture of steak, and the mixed taste of chicken and a mild fish flavor. Some tasty herbs on it too.  Wonderful view of the bay. Lots of unique menu items. A bit pricey, but understandable given the location and quality.  Had to wait probably 40 minutes for them to call me because it was so busy. So I just went and enjoyed the cool souvenir shop downstairs.

TO5G32j_BZ7zRI3CEPyQ6w.review_text: Pretty solid dinner tonight- came with two other couples. Shared the blue cheese garlic bread to start, which was solid. Entrees for dinner were the ahi (which my friends shared and loved apart from too many sesame seeds), a Caesar salad and clam chowder in a bread bowl (another thumbs up), and the Fog Harbor burger (good except the carmelized onions were more pickled than anything else and taken off after one bite.)  The prices were reasonable, the food was fresh, and the restaurant was nice, airy, and classy while not feeling ultra touristy. Will be back to visit again for sure!

RLL1eWVnOC5IXq_X9x0yJA.review_text: We traveled to San Francisco looking forward to all the good food we went to fog Harbor at fisherman's wharf.  It was absolutely atrocious you can get better clam chowder and shrimp cocktail in Salt Lake at Market St. Grill I got the lobster tail and it tasted horrible I had to send it back. I honestly can't recommend this place nobody in my party of four like their meal.

lvSf6Q0XG0JuXkC7W9zC-w.review_text: Beautiful location, very nice server. She was very attentive and gave great customer service. The price was what was expected for eating on the pier. I had the crab it was okay, but beautiful. I wold come here again.

eSvRGvm7ms7mwPgW1Yip3Q.review_text: Excellent food, great service, beautiful restaurant. I had the best Seafood Penne pasta with fish, clams and mussels in to die for tomato cream sauce. Definitely will be back.

68uga8HvM89ptZJFkPTn8Q.review_text: Normally I do not venture down to Pier 39 since I live here but Codmother was closed (A MUST EAT AT) and I had a visitor in town from AZ so I thought, "what the heck."   First and foremost: If you are a local - SKIP AT ALL COSTS.   Pluses:  1. The wait was minimal on a Thursday night in the summer, which was nice.  2. The restaurant seems clean, upscale and has amazing views if you are willing to wait for them.   3. The drinks were amazing. Mixed very well, creatively concocted and delicious.   The minuses: 1.  VERY LOUD AND NOISY. There are way too many tables squeezed in the space available. Normally I wouldn't knock a place for this, but given everything else that was bad, I thought I'd list.  2. The service. It is very apparent that each server has too many tables to handle. Service is extremely slow. We were told 4 times our oysters and crab cakes were on the way however the actual time to receive was approx. 30 minutes. If they sent actually on the way, just don't say it. Again, I wouldn't necessarily knock a place for this however the oysters are raw (easy to plate) and the crab cakes were obviously pre-made and just dropped into a fryer. Also, it would have been nice to get or even be offered bread, when everyone seem to have it. Lastly, when we tried to joke or have any conversation with put waitress at all, she immediately became defensive and didn't get the banter.   3. The food. Crab stuff lobster ... Should include ... Lobster. Additionally the dish should not be sitting on top of boxed (at least that's what they tasted like) mashed potatoes. Or in my opinion not for $36 bucks. The swordfish had a very odd square shape, tasted at one point frozen and was dry.   If you're visiting, hungry and need a place to eat on the pier, choose someplace else. Not at all worth the price.

TYbsgPiTIECsOW2sVrrrwQ.review_text: Ate here with the wife and kids...fantastic.  Wait looked long but we grabbed a high table by the bar with no wait time and no reservation. Ceviche and calamari apps were top notch.  I'm a crab cake nut and loved the Dungeness crab cake dinner.  Even the kids meals and desserts were top quality.  Was worried it would be a tourist only type place but the food really lived up to its hype.

eBu4BJMnzx0wPCVezsSjNA.review_text: If you don't make time to stop here for clam chowder in a sour dough bread bowl you are crazy and missing out on one of the best meals in San Francisco.  Jon was our waiter and was very nice.  We were able to view the sea lions from out the window along with the boats coming and going.  The Fog Harbour Fish House is a must.

sGYrxVCEJGGBArWI1LUgxQ.review_text: My parent's hotel, The Argonaut, recommended them and I'd previously read on SFGate this restaurant is notable.  I have to tell you - and it might be a surprise to you as well since it's at PIER 39 - it is.  From the food to the service and certainly the views, Fog Harbor Fish House is about as perfect as you'll get for a San Francisco seafood restaurant.  Specializing in sustainable seafood and with a luxe, Malibu-style gorgeous outdoor space by the entry complete with roaring fireplace, Fog Harbor Fish House is a perfect choice for out-of-town friends and family you're hosting to a romantic date.   It's such a surprise to find a "view" restaurant not resting on its laurels or looking a little dated and frumpy (you know who you are).  From the overflowing amount of crab in the San Francisco favorite Crab Louie salad, to the crispy and fresh calamari appetizer to truly, one of the best bowls of steamed clams you may ever have, it was a perfect lunch at Fisherman's Wharf.  Sleek, modern yet comfortable, the ambiance strikes the perfect chord as does its food.  It's just a bit pricey (you will, after all, pay for the pluperfect view) however the quality and postcard perfect location equate to Fog Harbor Fish House being well-priced.  I would go there again in a heartbeat, all on my "local own"   -without out-of-town family and friends.  If you're thinking, "Wow, that's pretty high praise"... it is.  And Fog Harbor Fish House surely deserves it.

6IpZCod9jWw7qwBrKFxdtg.review_text: If you want a view of the bay, this place is probably as good as any. The menu has the seafood fare that you'd expect, priced on the high side. The food is safe though not special. The staff is competent and aim to please. You can't go wrong.

RbVB7X6G7MsOTY7Jkd0wiQ.review_text: Upon arriving we were seated fairly quickly.. And were immediately greeted by our waiter David.. The restaraunt had amazing ambiance And the food was off the page delicious...!  We were completely satisfied . The muscle fries were hashtag pow!! David is absolutely and asset to this business..

D-2r1STSvADVC23EuUY9ig.review_text: My girlfriend and i went for dinner last night and ordered a full dozen oysters，they were all fresh but one of them is just as big as my finger nails and the rest were all small ones.And he price is 2.5$ per oyster...gotta post a pic of dat tiny little poor oyster...   Others were all good，good servic，nice view，food tasted fresh（swordfish was good） but just wayyyyy tooo expensive compared to the size（yeah im talking about the oysters.）

p48wOkW2t_IQmAPHRxblPQ.review_text: A really nice sea food restaurant if you're near the pier. The view is great, especially if right before sundown. I also noticed that the restaurant is really well run. Through the open door to their back room I could see their ops schedule - very impressive whiteboard with names and rows. And the service lined up with that. Everything was quick, and no mistakes.   I also noticed that the restaurant was determined to get reviews. Case and point: I got a free appetizer for checking in and a free desert for giving a quick review (note that it was a review on their website. My yelp reviews can't be purchased with a desert or anything else!)   The food was good, hot, and came out quickly. It just wasn't that unique; it didn't have a chef's touch, which is the primary reason for my 4 rating. But I did enjoy the experience and would certainly go back.

I1IaGyY4OqrmcognYXHIJg.review_text: Quite possibly the best crab I have ever had.  The roasted garlic Dungeness crab is to die for.  The soup was awesome and the blue cheese bread was extremely good.  Cocktails were good.  Our late lunch was filling enough to last for dinner.  I would recommend this restaurant to anyone with no hesitations.  And score - the blue cheese garlic bread was free thanks to Yelp for a check in that day!

uDZ2AclY1bnVtxbjbM7jfA.review_text: Such great food and service! Always a treat to come here. Not to mention the hot blonde bartender and the sexy muscled GM!

zr_gsXhtJNxgRYpLl1t2zw.review_text: A bit overpriced but what can you expect from a restaurant located in a tourist trap area? Having said that, the food was excellent and the ambiance was wonderful as we were seated along the window overlooking the bay.   Tip: if you purchase tix to the aquarium of the bay or the San francisco magic show held at the aquarium's theater, there is a 15% discount to this restaurant as well as pier 39 seafood restaurant and the wipeout grill.

T1Hm29LPbtLg8kyASJiOTw.review_text: Excellent!!! Beautiful view. Impeccable service. Delicious five star food. Caitlyn, our server was friendly and courteous. The food came out quickly. Presentation was perfect. I ordered the shrimp plate and it was fresh and tasty. The fries and coleslaw were great. My husband ordered soup and sliders and loved the plates. We came to San Francisco on a cruise and having excellent fresh food was just what we needed! Thank you! We will be coming back here!!

i6w1V5iPWdYKVPnZLOeLkA.review_text: At first I had my doubts.  I mean this restaurant is smack dab in the middle of tourist trap heaven!  But once we were greeted and seated, it felt miles from the madness.  Our window side table was fabulous with a clear shot of Alcatraz right before the fog rolled in.  Our waitress was not only friendly and attentive, but also gorgeous. Our party of 9 + 2 kids was a handful, but she took care of all of us and was prompt and attentive.  I had the filet and a ginger beer cocktail (skinny style) and both were great.  For dessert I ordered the apple crumble and it did not disappoint.  My colleagues all enjoyed their meals -- ranging from kids meals to linguini and clams -- and the ambiance of the place.  It was classic, with soothing music and a nice busy vibe without being overwhelming.  This place is a classic and if you want a nice view and some good food & service, book a table here right away!

4c2RYnS2mdDSMwyY9xWBaQ.review_text: It's nice to be a tourist in your own city every now and then - and when your city happens to be in the top 3 most photographed places in the world (see a study done at Cornell) and just a world class place overall, it's even better.  To be honest I have never eaten at Pier 39 nor have I even set foot here since moving to SF but we went to the Aquarium and figured we could get dinner and get parking validated.  The restaurant itself had an excellent ambiance and the food was fresh. The clam chowder in a bread bowl really was good (not hyped). Other dishes were ordered were the shrimp skewers and trout, both very fresh and tasty. The Dungeness crab fritters with risotto was definitely one to get.  Not sure when I'll be back but it was a nice dinner with excellent service, and a beautiful view.

nsK_Kf_s28rEF_Oyi5mIgA.review_text: Had the shrimp Louie salad and it was huge!  Couldn't even finish it, which means a lot because I have a crazy appetite.  Kinda wish I would of ordered the clam chowder so I could compare it to the fish hopper but oh well there's always next time.  I also tried the crab, shrimp sandwich.  It was eh, alright.  Kinda dry, lacked some flavor.  If you get it I would order a side of tarter sauce.  The bread they give you to start with is amaze.  Sour dough bread makes me happy!  Staff was also very accommodating.  See you soon fog house :)

_UB1WXP6gZ1wU_Gall-y2w.review_text: They have the freshest, best seafood of any place. It is on par with Scomas. The clan chowder is delicious.

CrDBJKwmGuAwN9upipfsiA.review_text: The best clam chowder in a bread bowl I have ever and will ever have! Phenomenal!! Chase it down with a Anchor Steam and you're good to go! My GF and I absolutely loved this place. From the ambience to the outstanding service. If it's the famous Clam Chowder in a Sourdough Bowl you're looking for ....Fog Harbor is the place to go.

r20fgMU5gW0R24eONq8IxQ.review_text: Stopped by on my visit to California. Had reservations for the evening but stopped in for lunch and was quickly accommodated.  Food was delicious, had the clam chowder, a must, baked oysters and the seafood penne and had the penne substituted for linguine. All were excellent. Would definitely recommend. Beautiful views of the bay and Alcatraz.

zBMPGHJYyBK6rJfb_ycXXA.review_text: Environment: 2nd floor of Pier 39. Pretty big restaurant and most of the seats are by the windows so you can see the water!  Food: I've been here twice and the food is honestly nothing special. I would stick to a bowl of chowder and a salad here.  Price: Under 25$ a person unless you're ordering drinks too. 2.5 dollar signs!  Occasion: We came here for a friends birthday dinner. They seated us at a round table (were were a group of 7) right by the window. And they wrote "happy birthday" on our table for us. A little tacky but we appreciated the effort!  Overall: I think this place is good for parties bigger than 4. The food can definitely use some work but the chowder is good!

_oe1TkhJuKoFNKWUwE3vFQ.review_text: I am not a sourdough fan so I am not really impressed by it. This restaurant is all about seafood, i ordered Pacific Sole, it's a bit salty and I don't like the way they cooked it, it's more like indian flavor. One of my friends ordered Dungeness Crab and looks good though. The service is very good, we've been there till 10:30pm and nobody seems impatient with us. I would say it's a good restaurant for treating friends just visiting SF since the location is great.

8XrM2C6Gp4-Nztsum9jPcw.review_text: We made reservations here to start off our day in the city to show my friend from SoCal around.  The place is right in the middle of all the touristy destinations. We waited around 10 minutes for them to set up our table, but we just looked at the menu and decided what we wanted to order during that time. The place is very nicely decorated and we were seated next to the windows. We got a very good view of the ocean and the activities outside! To top it off, our waiter was also very pleasant and gave us some recommendations of what we should order too.   What we ordered: - Blue Cheese Garlic Bread: so good! It's a must-order starter. Definitely could of gotten full from this alone.  - Fried Combo: Consisted of fried fish, calamari, shrimp, french fries and cole slaw. We could not finish this. It was huge.  - Seafood Cioppino: We added the pasta with the crab, fish, shrimp, scallops, clams and mussels in the stew. This was amazing and definitely my favorite. I loved the crab and scallops; both were very fresh. We tried to finish this, but we couldn't either.   The portions here are huge. Everything was worth the price. The three of us could not finish our meals. My SoCal friend really liked this place. We really wanted to order dessert, but we were stuffed.   All of us definitely full and were happy to walk off our meal afterwards by the bay. I would recommend coming here if you're showing of San Francisco to someone! I would want to try the clam chowder, more seafood, and desserts next time!

6lVdZlDnBEc0fuUzZ6OkNg.review_text: Great food. Prices are a bit higher that the Yelp summary makes you think, so bring some extra money. Clam chowder is amazing as is the sourdough brad bowls!

e-uR0uACjDx9lFE2rBEDrA.review_text: I've been here a couple of times and both times I've been satisfied. The food is good, although I haven't had anything amazing.   This last visit I started with clam chowder and the red chili garlic shrimp. The clam chowder is really good. The sauce for the shrimp is tasty with a nice kick. I had a half order of the roasted garlic crab. That was good too, but not as good as I expected. Also had a couple of Moscow mules from the bar that were good.  Service is pretty good however out waitress seemed a little flustered. She was pleasant but probably just overwhelmed since it was s busy night.  Overall my experience both times were good. It's in a great location (Pier 39) if you want to walk off your food after, grab dessert or just check out the view.

vY9L93W2q32d-YMvW2rLpw.review_text: For Fisherman's Wharf this place is good.  I had the clam chowder, which was good, not great.  But then I had the Ahi Tuna - this was fantastic and cheap.  For $23 it was a huge piece with veggies and mashed potatoes.  Tasted great!  Get the free blue cheese garlic bread from the yelp ad too ;)

n2CncV0cclTnjOQow2iVgw.review_text: First time in the pier so we had to eat there. I am a sucker for great views so we decided on this place.  Based on the reviews my expectations were not really high but I was pleasantly surprised by how good the food was. My husband had half portion of crab and I had the pacific sole which was pretty good. After touring all afternoon, we both left satisfied. We wouldn't mind coming here if we were in SF again.

DJDS4P_0nrEk7Dt4iyfqnw.review_text: Excellent New England clam chowder and fish and chips!  The portion sizes were big too.  Service was excellent also.  Will definitely be back again when visiting.

QxMx12ZCth8g4jtQCur-NA.review_text: There are tourist traps and then there are city gems that are conveniently placed for tourists to relish in. This is one of the later.  A great atmosphere with a great smattering of universal and signature sf seafood dishes.  Plus, they have paper on their tables which puts them on my list of fav sf restaurants quite automatically.

4XAPdDK3h0Uc0kYLdJCR1A.review_text: Service is definitely off par starting from the time we waited for our table, to getting our food.  The server dropped our french fries on the table and said she was going to replace it, but she never came back. Asked for more water and it took about ten minutes before I got anything.   Asked for a bottle of ketchup and a guy brings it out only to give it to another table.   If you want to put up with this kind of crap, this place is for you.  If there was a negative star I'd give it to them.

KmPhSm1ckHpigirrUJ5LZQ.review_text: Great food and what view.  After a great day at #nada2015 the #webdocpeter and Ron "madmax" needed a big meal.  Started with the clam chowder and finishing with the crab.    Angie is going to be so jeolous. The desert was great

Afu7arUhdJTeCT3RI6QRDw.review_text: Had a great lunch with a great view of Alcatraz and the seals of Pier 39. Our server took great care of us, providing excellent recommendations. We had the crab cakes, clam chowder and crab & risotto app. Highly recommend stopping by. It's nice to eat at a family owned restaurant with a great staff and great food.

ymohZAk94wGZMjPYe-EjdQ.review_text: Came here to meet up with a couple friends, because the boyfriend really wanted seafood. Naturally, we ordered a spread of different seafood dishes including crab ceviche, clam chowder, a seafood platter and the cioppino.   Clam chowder was decent, nothing special and definitely can find better in San Francisco. The seafood platter was also standard, and came with a ton of different shellfish, enough for all of us. I was most excited for and most disappointed by the cioppino; it was literally boiled array of seafood swimming in tomato sauce and immensely lacked depth of flavor.   On the other hand, the restaurant had a great view and good service, but definitely more of a touristy place. Don't know why I expected anything more from Fisherman's Wharf.

KjLNlhXAS7QKlLCY5QpcAw.review_text: I have to say, they have a very nice view of the harbor! And yummy clam chowder!!  But the excitement kinda ended there. We ordered the seafood penne and the crab cake but both were OK. The seafood penne didn't have much flavor, though it had a lot of seafood so that was nice. You couldn't really taste much of the crab in the crab cake because the herbs kinda overpowered it.

qxeIhWOJfg9k8O7GRqb41Q.review_text: Yes, the rumors are true, their clam chowder soup is good.Get it while it's hot!  First of all, I totally love the view. The restaurant is right next to the bay on the second floor Pier, so anywhere you sit, you can dine and enjoy the ocean/harbor view. I like to daydream while I eat, so this place was a dream come true.  Service was superb, they seated us prompted and gave us a quick meal as we mentioned we were on a time constraint. I order oyster anywhere I go, and theirs were fresh, no surprises though since this is the bay area. Really wished I had time to try the Dungeoness crab, but we were rushing around. But no worries, I will be back for you, San Francisco!

bJcH5UNzLCXk-pxHnwAi9g.review_text: AWFUL service. I am not sure if we just hit them at a weird time but literally the table next to us got in after us and left before us. We sat around most of the time just waiting waiting for our food which was soup and salad only. One of the girls in our party ordered a clam chowder bread bowl and we were all half way down with our meal before she got hers. I think they must have completely forgot about our soup because after we said something to the waiter it came right out - except for our one friend. The bread it came with was good, I would not call the clam chowder "award winning" too creamy but did have some good flavor. The drinks we had were good but all in all this place is an over priced tourist trap.

-K_YNEARt02MULbbBWvCag.review_text: We thought we had  a very good experience at the Franciscan...well, we topped it at the fog harbor. The crab clam chowder is EXcELLENT! And to top it off: great view of the harbor, great service and a very first: view on the sea lions of the San Francisco Bay! I thought it was going to be touristy: it was, but the quality was there too!

C53glIBDgyrkvuPVZ0xocg.review_text: Great atmosphere and a real nice place. Got the sea scallops, so good, and nice n' spicy. Not a big selection of beers, but a great selection of wine.

yGHP5LUQe73kOvYQZF6Dqg.review_text: Beautiful place to eat at with a view. Going straight to the point- two orders of clam Chowder in a sourdough bread bowl, 2 Laguanitas IPA, and calamari. Calamari with tarter sauce was good. However I think they used squid instead of calamari. Sauce was on point. The clam chowder was creamy and delicious. I got a bite of clam in every spoonful. The complimentary bread was great but I wish it were more hot. Total bill was $56 before tip.

IFyGlsXVPtGRojVHkomWuw.review_text: Lovely server Madison charmed her way into our hearts just about instantly!  Charm, grace, wit, humor and maturity beyond her years created a stellar experience for us last Saturday night at this most dreamy of ocean view restaurants!  The view of the boats and sparkling lights on the water was mesmerizing.  A window seat on the water front, a full moon night, a first date!  What more could a girl ask for?  Granted, I am not let out of my cage that often, but this was a truly magical dining experience.   As my date and I basically took out a rental on the table we occupied for the greater part of the evening, I would say that our server went above & beyond the call of duty in catering to all our whims and needs.  Oh yes, and the food was delicious!  We loved the clam chowder, I ordered the Mixed Grill plate, and darned if I remember what my date ordered, but I know he cleaned his plate!  Five stars for sure!

PTLfianlaIhaMjoqiOPwiw.review_text: One of the best restaurant experiences my husband and I have ever had! It's a lovely, elegant place while still having a relaxing, casual feel.  We made reservations, and secured a nice table overlooking the bay. I enjoyed the bleu cheese garlic bread, which is free with yput Yelp check-in! Too bad my husband couldn't eat any, because of a gluten allergy.  I ordered a couple oysters, which were amazing and made me wish I ordered more! I ordered Garlic Herb Dungeness Crab, which was amazing!  This place is great about handling food allergies. My husband has gluten and mushroom allergies, and ordered the chicken, with which he was thoroughly impressed.   Definitely go here for a lovely atmosphere, delightful food, and a classy experience!

ReGxijkS5xZ-JrcmO_DMjQ.review_text: My boyfriend and I went here (after reading some reviews on Yelp!) for a nice lunch on the waterfront on our recent trip through San Francisco. I was looking for some high quality, fresh seafood and this place prides themselves on their sustainable seafood selection!  First they seated us at a table away from the windows and when asked, quickly and politely got us a nice booth instead with a view of the water and sights.   Service was nothing short of great: a prompt, courteous waiter who didn't hover but brought us our drinks and complimentary fresh-baked sourdough bread with butter and tended to our needs unobtrusively.  Food was delicious; I ordered the Grill Combo which featured perfect portions of shrimp, swordfish and salmon in a delicious citrus butter sauce with a side of veggies and choice of wild rice or garlic mashed potatoes. My boyfriend ordered the Fried Combo, which came with a very generous portion of house-battered and fried calamari, shrimp, and cod, with French fries on the side and dipping sauces. My one disappointment: the side of veggies was not to my liking, a green that looked like stringy broccoli cooked with some cocktail onions. I expected some mixed veggies at least!   All in all a great meal and experience! No wonder they get such great reviews! MUCH better than a generic Joe's Crab Shack experience any day!!!

WeV73N2zV8CxbKTCfw6nwA.review_text: The best clam chowder ever and it was reasonably priced ($10 per bread bowl). The blue cheese salad was just alright. The view was very nice. Amazing staff!

ODsM6-_BvHt6-cqNylJn7g.review_text: I'm really going to have a hard time with this review as I actually really did enjoy the food, but it was easily the worst service I've had in a decent amount of time.   Not sure if they were having a hard time adjusting for the Labor Day tourists, but when you have to ask for ketchup three times from three different servers, you know things aren't going well.   I had the crab roll which was great. Gf had the ahi tuna which was also great. Mom had the mixed grill which wasn't too bad. It's a typical seafood place located within the tourist utopia that is Fisherman's Wharf.   We had a nice gentleman who was taking care of us while our server was on break, and he was fantastic. Once he left things really took a hit. Our server was nice, but we barely saw her. We had oyster shells on our table for nearly 30 minutes. 30 minutes. They normally take those away within minutes.   It's a nice location, with pretty good food, but they really need to step up the service.

onXW3feeMlULCH5z-ebyEA.review_text: My experience at Fog Harbor was average. The service was subpar and disappointing. Our server Robert payed no attention to detail, was not attentive and showed no interest in serving the needs of his patrons. Robert had no personality and acted like he'd rather be at home. We had to ask for EVERYTHING :-( refills, bread...etc.   The food was good. I ordered a salmon club salad and a salmon/shrimp dish (can't remember the name of it). The taste was pretty good.   Beautiful establishment. If the service was better, my experience would have been great. It irritates the HELL out of me when servers are terrible. Ugggghhhh!!!!!! I'm so disappointed

GQlWomRTmT_W2fPqUo3GLQ.review_text: Amazing! I do not know where to begin!   Calamari might have been the best i have ever had. Helpful waitress, when she was available, but i was pleased with the speed of the food coming out that i didnt mind.   Crab Alfredo and the Surf and Turf were amazing. I will be coming back to try their clam chowder and crab!

CLL2yqudvHj6FrmEXGQyYA.review_text: Had a fantastic meal tonight....great oysters, shellfish platter was immense and creme brulee was delicious.  Couldn't recommend highly enough! Also service was no.1. A must visit in San Francisco if you're looking for great seafood.

R3219ePRI6SWZ01PSBGwGg.review_text: Decided to brave Pier 39 on a Sunday evening since we were craving whole crab... Because it's such a touristy area I really wasn't expecting such an amazing experience. Excellent service and the freshest seafood you could ask for... a dozen oysters, crab stuffed lobster and a whole roasted garlic crab. We also shared chowder and a salad... Outstanding... will definitely back again before crab season is over! :)

CtaFCHFvt75m-bXdNXoUEw.review_text: I came here for my two year anniversary with my boyfriend and it was the best evening ever. The food was flavorful and exquisite, the service was fabulous, and the atmosphere was romantic and elegant. I ordered the linguini with clams & my boyfriend got the wild salmon. The food literally melts in your mouth. The drinks were good as well; the cocktails were just the right balance between alcohol and sweetness. The wine selection was fabulous as well. For dessert we got the chocolate cake and since it was our anniversary it was on the house! The chocolate tasted like heaven. Our server was very nice and knowledgable. Overall this was a great experience and we will definitely come again. And the view from our table was beautiful.

wi7DAzM1CHM3zJQVWeyuEg.review_text: We did a walk in on a Wednesday night and were seated promptly. We requested a window seat, which is the way to go. The view is outstanding. It is conveniently located on Pier 39. It's the place to be after a long, chilly boat tour around the Golden Gate and Alcatraz.  The food and drink didn't disappoint either. I was shivering from cold after our boat tour. The Hot Apple Cider with Ginger Liqueur and Cinnamon Whiskey was the perfect drink to warm me up. The Crab Ceviche was also good. I had the Lobster stuffed with Crab. All excellent.   Our server was the reason this place does not get 5 stars. I agree the place was busy but when you charge $$$, one of those stars is for service. He made me feel like I was at an Applebee's; one of those eat - pay - leave places. In fact I have received better, more attentive service at Applebees.
