ZYLx8FpH3JKjrnaPJIXU8Q.review_text: This restaurant looks good on the surface. Sustainable fish (hooray! A priority for me), amazing view of Alcatraz, nice decor, and a tasty sounding menu. However, many of the items we ordered were mildly disappointing.  Our starters, chili lime shrimp salad and (on special) crab ceviche with mango and avocado, were bizarrely similar just with different protein. The ceviche was served on lettuce, drizzled with the same salad dressing which was mildly mustardy and didn't go with the dish. Also, while the amount of crab was decent, it actually seems skimpy on the mango, avocado, and lime. Definitely missing a ceviche sort of flavor, but it was a tasty pile of shredded crab meat. Both starters also had the same house made tortilla chips, just in different shapes.  My husband liked his crab roll sandwich, and the sweet potato fries that came with it were good. If I had realized my salmon sandwich came with fries, I would have upgraded to sweet potato. Blackened salmon was a nice option. Half my sandwich was leftover and still good the next day, cold.  Our drinks were just okay. We didn't stay for dessert. If you go, insist on a seat with a view.

kKTcYPz47sCDH1_ylnE4ZQ.review_text: I visited San Francisco (for the second time ever) last weekend and we decided to eat at Pier 39, since I remembered that it had great seafood restaurants.  I realized that I'd actually eaten at Fog Harbor Fish House during my first visit to SF exactly 7 years ago!  I was not disappointed at all by my second visit.   It was a beautiful and clear (not foggy at all!) day in San Francisco and the tourists were all abuzz in the pier area.  Though Fog Harbor Fish House is a huge tourist attraction, it's definitely not a tourist trap.  I really enjoyed the service (very nice!) and also the selection of foods.  I was stuck between choosing the seafood platter or the seared ahi tuna.  In the end, I went with the seared ahi tuna, and it came with this amazing wild rice and seasonal vegetables!  The tuna was a very decent portion and it came crusted with sesame seeds and a ginger glaze.  So delicious!    To top it off, I got a bowl of clam chowder (their chowder is amazing here!) and a pina colada on the side.   We had such an excellent view of the bay - the Golden Gate bridge was in view, as was Alcatraz island.    What a lovely visit to SF!  I will certainly be back again to eat at Fog Harbor Fish House when I'm in SF in the future!

521_QKerZNYI0ylftfbj4g.review_text: As a Bay Area resident, I try to avoid eating where tourists normally flock to. But since we were in the area playing "tourists", I booked us a reservation for 2.   The restaurant is situated in the heart of Pier 39. The inside is classy without being too intimidating. You can come in here dressed up for a date night or casually stroll in wearing jeans and tennis shoes. They have sone awesome window seats overlooking the bay and the Alcatraz view.   They start you off with fresh-out-the-oven sourdough bread. I usually shy away from white bread, but I just can't say no to crunchy on the outside, soft and warm inside--fantastic sourdough bread. We also ordered the calamari and clam chowder for appetizers. The calamari is great! The batter is very light, crisp and tasty. It's served with lemon aioli sauce. The clam chowder was also very yummy. It was the right creamy texture with good flavor and the perfect amount of saltiness. For our main entrées, I got the Seared Tuna with a side of mashed potatoes and my bf ordered the whole garlic crab with fingerling potatoes. Blame the appetizers because I didn't get to finish my entrée. However, the tuna was delicious. Perfect seared exterior with the pink inside. It wasn't overly seasoned, and still featured the natural flavor of the tuna. My bf devoured THE WHOLE CRAB. That means it's good right?  I will definitely brave the touristy crowd and the expensive parking to eat some great seafood from here.

MP1fSFSGz6Ftw65Zd3goJg.review_text: First off, I just want to say that I originally had 1st intentions of going to another restaurant to celebrate a 6 year anniversary. Unfortunately, that place was already booked (place is called Navio located in Half Moon Bay; attempted to book reservation two weeks ago; no luck). Anyway, I must say that I'm so grateful to have found Fog Harbor Fish House.  This restaurant was going to be my backup plan B; however, should never be considered a plan B. This restaurant is the real deal.   I booked a reservation at 9:15pm (used open-table) and right below reservation time I stated under special requests...this is my first time for the restaurant and personally wanted to see if any staff representative can label "Happy anniversary" on the table nearby a window for viewing and personally requested to buy a cake and have the plate labeled in icing "Happy Anniversary Day". Little did I know that they would actually do this; well turns out they granted all requests. My server was Pedro; hands out provided the best experience for my girlfriend and I. Thank you Pedro for a job well done.     My girlfriend and I sat down at exactly 9:15pm as stated, anniversary in coloring on the table and a great view of the bay. Atmosphere like can be a little noisy, but that didn't bother me at all. Service is excellent and the food is superb. It's the real deal. My girlfriend got the lobster plate stuffed with crab for 35 dollars; it's worth every penny!!!! I got the halibut for 32 dollars; best tasty fish ever!!!!! They both are seasonal.  My girlfriend was speechless when she saw the "Happy Anniversary" in coloring on the side of the table. Toward the end, Pedro closed it by bringing a tiramisu cake, candle on top and with "happy anniversary day" labeled in icing for my girlfriend chanting Happy Anniversary Day. She was blown away!!!!!!!!!!  Even better, while I expected to pay for the cake (as listed on my special request through open table), I realized that the cake which was 8.50 was reimbursed as a manager compensation. I can't believe this tremendous service, outstanding food, gorgeous view of the bay and last but not least experience exceeded beyond my own expectations. Plan to come here more often. Drive is worth it. Pier 39 parking is free for two hours (make sure you ask waiter to stamp the back of card for you).   Thank you Pedro and Fog Harbor Fish House!!!!!!!

hWt6PvDkgUNmyy8i8gVoeA.review_text: Love their clam chowder!  Great location with beautiful view!!

iqHbDGyKhZdjvbNx4s0hPg.review_text: Edgars: Do you know how the ancient Greeks defined happiness? Garibaldi: Not off-hand, but I'd be willing to bet it involved three goats and a jug of wine. Edgars: "Happiness", they said, was "the exercise of vital powers along lines of excellence, in a life affording them scope". Babylon 5  54F degrees outside temperature 8pm.  Should I stay in the freezing cold and be squished and bumped like last year for the 4th of July fireworks show or is it time for something different...  We opted to watch the show from inside the restaurant.  Warmth.  :-)  Turned out the view was very good as the lights were turned off by the windows for the duration of the show.  :-)  A much more civilized way to view fireworks.  :-)  On to the food...  The sourdough bread is excellent here.  Crunchy on the outside with soft inside and that great flavor of sourdough.  I put in a special request for fresh swordfish instead of the standard frozen cod.  I have tried the fried cod and shrimp combo and the frozen cod was ok.  Similar to what you would get at Red Robin.  Fortunately the manager approved my request.  The fresh swordfish was hand dipped in a thin coating of beer batter and came out a golden brown.  Awesome crunchy batter with that flavor you get from only the finest fresh swordfish.  The texture was dense as I expected yet came apart nicely in my mouth.  This was the best fried swordfish I have had.  :-)  Well worth paying extra to get the higher quality fresh fish.   I also sampled the New York Steak.  Excellent blend of flavors from the beef and peppercorn glaze.  Really nice cut of beef just below what you would get at Ruth Chris.  For dessert I had the creme brûlée.  Sweet crunchy top and delicious creme filling.  Perfectly executed dish.  Among the top 3 creme brulee's I've had.  :-)  In addition to the awesome view of the bay the customer service here is superb.  Everybody from the hostess to the waitress to the manager made it a pleasure to dine here.  I've visited every time I'm in town the last 3 years and had the most excellent dining experiences here.

Ml2i2mGdUyrRswXZZlbKNw.review_text: Fog Harbor Fish House is located at Pier 39 on the second level. We came here for Dine About Town 2014 and made reservations about a week in advance to secure a spot for dinner. We had parked in the Pier 39 garage where Fog Harbor would validate 2 hours of parking when after 6pm. We came here on a Saturday night and boy, the whole restaurant was packed! There were even people waiting for seats. When you first enter Fog Harbor, you'll notice that they have a really cozy fireplace area for those who are waiting. We were seated in one of the booths near the window with a nice view of the bay. I wish we came a bit earlier when the sun was setting though.  Food- Red Curry Steamed Mussels: The PEI mussels were steamed in garlic, onions, peppers, and a coconut curry broth. The coconut curry broth was not too flavorful. I could barely taste the curry flavor. However, these mussels were REALLY fresh. YUM. Definitely, the freshest mussels I have had compared to all the other restaurants I've been to.  Seafood Cioppino: The cioppino comes with crab, salmon, shrimp, clams, scallops, and mussels stewed in a tomato herb broth with pasta. What I thought was really cute was that Fog Harbor provides you bibs so you won't get food on yourself! A plus for me since I can be a pretty messy eater when it comes to seafood. The tomato herb broth was really flavorful. I ended up taking the complimentary bread and dipped it into the broth. So delicious. My cioppino came with 3 pieces of crab, a good amount of salmon, shrimp, clams, scallops, and mussels. All the seafood were really fresh and in good quality. There's no fishy taste to them. My seafood cioppino also comes with pasta too. Originally, they had forgotten to include it into the dish, but the manager on duty quickly apologized and provided me a bowl of the pasta. Regardless, the seafood cioppino has really BIG portions. They are not skimpy with their seafood.   Molten Chocolate Cake: The cake was served with vanilla ice cream and whipped cream. The cake was REALLY sweet. The ice cream definitely complemented well with the chocolate cake. Unfortunately, the cake didn't have any melted chocolate in it when I cut it open in half. :(   Our dinner lasted for almost 2 hours! That was pretty surprising but in a good way. :) At the end of the meal, they also provide you Biscoff cookies. Per our waiter, he stated that they are quite delicious when dipped in coffee or milk. The overall service was excellent. The waiter and the manager on duty really made sure that everything was going smoothly and checked up on us. I think this was a successful Dine About Town! :)

ndiZlnpglRpvjbZ2Vp4JMw.review_text: Great food and service by Shawn.  We had the crab and the prawn cocktails. Good flavor and plenty to satisfy the palate.  The blackened sole was delicious. And, of course we had to save room for dessert... Crete brûlée and their blonde. Creme brûlée is always good. Their blonde was so good. Great chocolate flavor and ice cream and whip creme for balance.   Fog Harbor knows how to do it right. Always good.

QngNoyM4MFJMYfQ8mWwKdg.review_text: The sourdough bread bowl for the clam chowder was amazing, but for salad and clam chowder it comes in at a whopping $15pp, but can be expected for being directly on the pier. The check with dessert  came to around $50 for 2 before tip with only tea and soda ordered for drinks.   The views are great with a window over looking the harbor where you can see the sea lions resting on pier 39.   The service was varied. the food came out fast and multiple servers would come to refill drinks, but no one checked on us during any point when refilling glasses and we had to ask to see the dessert tray.

0LwN37IQHOPTSpVTmG1eKQ.review_text: Amazing view, great food, friendly server - what more can I ask for? I know that this place isn't the cheapest, but Fog Harbor Fish House is in the center of tourist mecca. I know there are lots of similar restaurant options nearby, but they either lack in food or interior or attentive servers. I tried to nitpick and find things I don't like about this place, but honestly I couldn't (again, apart from having to deal with major tourist crowds, which is no fault of the restaurant) Just be sure to check out tourist brochures and/or yelp check-in for modest discounts or freebies. In fact, most Wharf/Pier39 restaurants have some form of promotion. They also validate parking so make sure to take advantage of that.  My party had clam chowder, cioppino, crabs, shellfish platter along with some white wine and dessert.  Clam chowder wasn't the best I've had around bay area, but they were above average. Seafood was fresh and prepared right.  This probably isn't the best place for family with small children, but for more adult-oriented crowd or date nights, I would highly recommend.

0ZqF6yC2AZYVzZWgMGgHdg.review_text: When in San Fran, I always get cioppino and this place did not disappoint!  Cioppino was full of awesome mussels, clams, fish and shrimp.  We had the calimari as an appetizer and not only was it amazing, but they brought out way more than we could possible eat- so bring your appetite!  Michael took great care of us... Will definitely be back.

M4Vm2b4C4qyg5EEOvu-f9g.review_text: My boyfriend and I had a great experience at Fog Harbor. We made reservations in advance and emailed them asking for a table with a view. Something extra special for our anniversary. When we arrived we had a reserved table with an amazing sunset view.   Our server was really attentive, super funny, and suggested a really delicious appetizer.  He made the experience that much better!   Our food was delicious! I had the cioppino and my boyfriend had the surf and turf. We both really enjoyed dinner and our apps. It was all well cooked and very flavorful!  Also for how crowded it was all our food came out in record time! We never felt that  "where the hell is my food" feeling, which I sort of expected due to the Saturday night crowd.   We will definitely be back!

hJWQ_8bDOKtojl9E3X9I0Q.review_text: Everything was fantastic. Service was great. Food was way better than expected. Clam chowder bread bowl was some of the best I've had. Make sure you order extra jalapeno aoili for added flavor for the already good fish and chips.

l7wxZPKiYV5XU6c5_E87KA.review_text: Made resv for 6pm on a tues. Arrived around 530pm so we could sit at the bar first and have a couple happy hour drinks. There was a heat wave in sf, and this place was insanely sweaty hot. As I sat at the bar sucking down a cold drink, I looked around at the people sitting at the window seats, where I was going to be sitting soon, to see them all using their napkins to wipe the sweat off their forehead. Nightmare status. NO AC!  This was a dinner for my birthday, and I was hoping to not have to rush through it just to get outside for some fresh air.  Bartender was super nice, don't remember his name, but when we told him we were gonna go get seated so we wanted to pay for the tab, he offered to make us another round of drinks and bring to our table at the happy hour price (which was about $5 cheaper). Awesome.  Told the hostess I would rather die than sit at one of those window seats where the other customers were stewing in their own sweat. So she sat us in this room off to the side of the main dining room, right next to a window that just wasn't in the sun and the window was propped open a bit. Perfect spot!!!!! So thank you so much for being accommodating!  Now for the food! Started with the calamari, lightly battered/fried rings, a nice lemon aoli type dip (very light).  Chili shrimp - woah. SOO good! Spicy! But flavorful!! Used the fresh sourdough bread they give you complimentary to dip in this spicy broth  1/2 garlic crab - good garlic flavor! Tender meat, have to crack it yourself   Dungeonous crab cocktail - decent portion of shredded tender crab meat served over ice with cocktail sauce on the side.  Think that was enough? No.  Dinner was a whole Maine lobster with a side of mashed potatoes and a grilled corn on the cob. The lobsters tail was over cooked and chewy, but the claws were tender. Kinda sad about the lobster tail, but I guess that happens when you get a whole lobster?   Dessert was complimentary cause it was my birthday, I was just brought out a dessert the waiter, Rudy picked. It was some sort of warm chocolate rich almost lava melty cake with vanilla ice cream and house made whip cream. Really decadent.   Good service, lovely ambiance, and fresh seafood. Fun birthday dinner ;) Thanks Fog Harbor!

3g4irxK-dTBXATqnRUnwSg.review_text: Came here around 2pm with no reservation. The wait was only about 15mins.   I'll start by saying I am not a fan of blue cheese AT ALL but figured id try the blue cheese garlic bread since it was free with a yelp coupon. It was AMAZING! Exceeded expectations.   Tried some oysters from here and they were great! I definitely recommend. Next for the clam chowder and it may have been the best chowder I have ever had!!! Loved it   I ordered the entree with the crab cakes, big mistake!!! I love crab cakes but I tasted everything EXCEPT the crab so that's obviously not something I would order here again.   My boyfriend ordered the fish and chips which were exceptional! Wish I had ordered that instead. It's cooked to perfection!   I ordered a Long Island, which was sub par. It's a pretty strong drink but the purpose of the Long Island is to not taste how strong it is. I'd try something different.

lpC7nYyt1LHulO-86dIATw.review_text: I had a good old friend coming to town and he wanted to have seafood. Since he's new to the city I decided to venture into Pier 39 for its convenience, but wondering whether we would end up in a "tourist trap". That was not the case.  Food was good and so was the service. We got a nice table by the window with beautiful view over Golden Gate and Alcatraz.  We both had Lobster + Crab as main dish and it was super fresh. The warm sourdough bread was also very good. Many of the dishes are not cheap ($25-$35) but you can still find some stuff at around $12-$20.  Overall great experience and wouldn't mind going back!

9_opUR0cFDRYNHEoPOuvyw.review_text: I was here for a short trip and wanted to experience an amazing meal. I wasn't disappointed!!!  I came right after Dungeness crab season started, and had that.  My server was the bartender, Jason.  He did an amazing job of offering suggestions to try (both on the menu as well as things to see while in town).  Will definitely be back!!!

-fPnMS8IvaPwCTZy7dlP3w.review_text: Check in to "Pier 39" on Yelp to receive a "fun pack" at the California Welcome Center located a few shops behind Fog Harbor Fish House. You will receive a coupon book which contains a coupon for 20% off your meal!  Boyfriend and I came on a Monday in October around 1pm. It appeared busy and there was a 10-15 minute wait to be seated, but the gentleman seating us stated that it was "slow" today!   Luckily, we were seated in an empty connecting room facing the water! I liked this area better because your body is facing the water, as opposed to having to turn your body to face the water in the main dining   We were served HOT, fresh sourdough before receiving our main dishes.   I ordered the king salmon dish which was "market price" - apparently market price in October was $32! That's how much a salmon dish at a popular Disneyland restaurant is! It was REALLY good, though! I substituted the potatoes with wild rice.   You receive a Biscoff cookie with your check, and at the bottom of the check is a coupon for the Biscoff Coffee Corner located on the first floor on Pier 39. I think it was 30% off?  Not only was the food good, but the ambiance was quiet (while we were there, at least!) and romantic. I had a hot date, eating deeeeelicious salmon and looking out at the water, tourists, sea lions, Golden Gate Bridge, and Alcatraz.. how could I go wrong?!

AXCDbZohyTIY4qeYcrtPNw.review_text: One of the waiters here name Khaiman was really friendly. He gave us really good suggestions. The food was amazing for reasonable pricing and this place has very good service.

_w_Vj5p4-vECHKXDIiY-UA.review_text: First time coming to the pier since moving to the Bay Area so we just picked a place. The chef was awesome enough to make us a delicious crab dip bread bowl even though they don't offer it. Our food and service was great! We were in a hurry to catch the ferry and the waiter made sure everything came out fast. Definitely will be coming again.

u6j0S_vTNxSZ2wWI_KLvEA.review_text: They serve an awesome Ahi Tuna with wild rice, and their clam chowder bowls give Boudin a run for their money. The cioppino is tasty, and of course anything fried like the  fish and chips, and  calamari appetizer are good as well.

55jKBDDr47Ec0bDa8Q3EiQ.review_text: My girlfriend and I came here expecting the better end of seafood because of the location and reviews for this restaurant. We were sorely mistaken! If I had a choice I would have avoided this place and gone somewhere with more of a specialty in seafood. What happened here?   What we had: Seafood platter for 2 (no butter), Iced Tea  The Good: Nice views (if you are lucky) Nice waitress Excellent claim chowder (award winning) Iced tea was clean and refreshing Clean cutlery and dishes The crab was the only redeeming quality of the platter   The Bad: Significant wait times 40 minutes - hour Rude, unorganized, woman who took down wait times (not just to me)  The terrible: Seafood platter for 2 was ~50 dollars The platter was not even close to what we were expecting: We believe it was cove mussels that were used, minuscule amount of meat inside, some were even empty (no QC check) We maybe got 10 mussels in our meal, 10 pieces of shrimp, a few clams, and 2 full sets of crab legs Corn was stale and not fresh, this was evident by the fact the core was dried out  Avoid the platter at all costs - it is not worth it. I could have easily finished it by myself with room to spare. The quality was poor and prices were very high. Check came out to almost 100 dollars after tip for 2 people. Stick with the lobster or other dishes that were more highly reviewed.

xYhE81kALW3IJNEkDTaEng.review_text: Fancy and upscale decor. Amazing views of the bay. Friendly and attentive staff. The best crab dishes. I can't say enough good things about Fog Harbor.  Service: Our server, Meron, was extremely friendly and attentive. She made sure we had everything we needed and came over several times to see how we were doing. She even helped us open the towelette packet and put on our bibs. The manager, I believe, noticed we needed something and immediately helped us and thanked us for being patient. My scarf fell off my chair to the floor and a different server noticed and picked it up for me. The entire staff was top-notch. Excellent service all around. Very impressed (and I'm not usually that impressed by service).  Decor: Dark and intimate. Very fancy and upscale atmosphere, but the attire ranges from casual to fancy. Although it is fancy, nothing about this place screams snobbish (being tourist friendly helps). Even the bathrooms are clean and nice. Definitely request to get a seat by the window. The view of the bay is incredible. Where else can you go fine dining and look out the window and see the boats glistening in the water up close? I felt like I was on the Titanic.  Food: I loved how the Darigold butter was slightly warm and melted, which makes applying it on the sourdough bread much easier. The garlic roasted dungeness crab was superb and was my absolute favorite dish here. It comes with roasted fingerling potatoes, corn on the cob, and garlic oil sauce. Absolutely delicious. After having the perfect dungeness crab as the first dish, it set the bar so high that no other crab dish could really compare. The crab clam chowder was good and rich, and also another favorite. The swordfish and crab linguini alfredo were good, but personally not as impressive. The chocolate lava cake was to die for. It wasn't runny in the middle like other lava cakes, but the instant you put it in your mouth and your tongue touches it, it melts into liquid chocolate. What kind of witchery is this? Seriously. It was like MAGIC. It looked like a regular chocolate cake but it melts into chocolate in your mouth! I still can't get over how amazing and mind-blowing it was. It was very rich like a brownie and the vanilla ice cream pairing was the perfect complement to it. The whipped cream was also sweet and flavorful, and definitely not from a store-bought spray can. I was so fascinated by the lava cake that I immediately googled recipes so I can attempt to make my own cake-that-turns-into-chocolate-the-second-it-­enters-your-mouth.  I am dreaming (& drooling) of the day when I can come back and have another taste of the heavenly dungeness crab and lava cake.

VoC3uOuZ_5-naxtvRrXKjQ.review_text: Great seafood, the lobster mac n cheese was delicious.  Moderately priced food.  Try the Blue cheese bread, it's free if you check in on YELP.  Great view of the bay as well.

GsCNN9Oa1SapI2L349FX6Q.review_text: This is my favorite Pier 39 restaurant. It's in a beautiful location (right at the front of the Wharf on the upper level) and the interior design is classy with a fireplace!   The food is truly as good as they say it is. The chow-dare is creamy with big clams. There isn't the fishy after taste you can get from old clams in chow-dare. Freshness here!  I also tried the blue cheese bread (free with first time check-in btw). I normally hate blue cheese to. the. max. but I actually really enjoyed this. It did not have the nasty blue cheese taste at all. And they weren't skimpy on the cheese either.  Highly recommend if you're ok with slightly higher prices. I think the prices are reasonable for the quality. And you're on the Wharf so those prices aren't really higher than any other sit-down restaurant.

-Jv-JX6Ll9z7JFxUWkn6xQ.review_text: The bf was looking for some good ole San Francisco clam chowder, and we naturally went to Yelp. Being that we were at Pier 39, we were led to Fog Harbor. We took a seat at the bar and were quickly attended to with menus. The female bartender said the bread dough is from Boudin's Bakery, who supplies it to all the restaurants. What's special about their sourdough is that the water used comes from the bay.   We ordered the clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl. Boy, it sure hit the spot! The base was nice and creamy with a good amount of clams. We polished off that bowl, so the bf asked for another cup.   Tip: visit the California Visitor's Center next door to get a coupon for 15% off your total bill.

UFnKmgINmdvAaHgiDTWtWw.review_text: I honestly just went to this place because we had a group of 8 in our party, and it was the best compromise amongst what everybody wanted for a Saturday lunch.  Seafood is better at the small hole in the wall places, but those only seat like 10 at capacity and don't take reservations.  So I came into this place knowing what I was getting to myself into, and still the food was just ehh.  I got a chowder bowl, which was okay at best.  You can honestly get better chowder by walking down the wharf a little bit and getting it from one of the stands.  I also got a seafood pasta dish which was good but definitely not memorable (probably why I can't even remember exactly what it's called).  I think I spent like $45 total with a beer on top of those 2 dishes so this place is definitely not on the cheap side.  In the end, it's basically one of the touristy spots, and you should only expect as much.  If you have to, then it's an okay choice, but it wouldn't be my first choice, or second, or third...

i_jq10I66vCPE3ShSaBl-g.review_text: Tasty food, good sized portions, great service, amazing sourdough bread.

-9v9WWod_h44Rc12usPDtQ.review_text: Came here 2 days in a row...ordered a Sourdough clam chowder bowl with crab meat...freaking delicious. And on both days I ordered Fish and chips. Best fish and chips I have ever tasted IMO.

VbCX_dF3xTArvwLua46tUg.review_text: Great experience from the front door in including the service, the view, and the food.  We got to share the cioppino and there was more than enough food. The sourdough bread is perfect with this dish. Pumpkin bread pudding and excellent coffee made for a wonderful end to this meal.

nutpQPyrsK-mJ-y2LOIeUg.review_text: I really wanted to like Fog Harbor, from the beautifully warm and comfortable entry way to beautiful views and what looked like a great menu.  There are so many great seafood restaurants in this area that competition and expectations are high.    The crab cakes were great.  But from there the experience went downhill quickly.    Part of my food was undercooked while I had to spit out a piece of swordfish because I couldn't chew it and my husband indicated that his dinner was nothing special.  As our meal progressed, I noticed our neighbors sitting for long periods of time waiting for...well, waiting for service.  And soon, we too joined the ranks of the ignored.  Water glasses went unfilled and it took 25 minutes for them to notice that our plates needed to be cleared.    Now, I enjoy lingering over my dinner, particularly when we have a view of the bay and the food is worth enjoying, but for the money that was spent, the lack of service and food quality was inexcusable.    It might have been an off night--we're all allowed those--but as we're close enough to the city to visit often and do, this restaurant will not be receiving any more of our business when we're down that way.

z4iln5ZW8NAVUG_WSaeFow.review_text: Got the fish and chips with a cup of clam chowder. Both if which were pretty good , can't say they were the best I've ever had but worth going back to again. I think my server forgot to put the rest of my order in because the table cleaning guy came by to clean my table and clear it. 20 minutes later  and still no fish and chips. I mentioned to him I was still waiting for the rest of my order. It then arrived 5 minutes later.

Ruc1aArEXQDSJPbYwrjJzw.review_text: Excellent food (had crab) in very pleasant surroundings on a mild Friday evening in January. Not as touristy as it seems from the outside. Good choice of food and drink. The waiter wasn't that great, hence the 4 stars rather than 5 but no actual complaints about the service.

zQfszAWNRDjoo2RA_AD34Q.review_text: Good place when you are hanging around this area. It's a nice spring day. Not too hot, not too cold. We enjoyed the the food. The price ok for SF higher end dining. Khaiman was our waiter. He is a nice guy and took care of us. The Oyster was excellent giving me some mojo for a few days. Try the Calamari too. I ordered the Laguenita IPA beer that worked out well. The Clan Chauder was good in that bread bowel as well. Try the place if you can spend money on food. It's a good dining experience.

-vYw9TCVCufy8-hRZRdAMw.review_text: Absolutely delicious!  I had blue cheese garlic bread from the check-in, some calamari, fried scallops, and the clam chowder for my appetizers.  For the main course I had the garlic whole crab...it ROCKS.  If you happen to eat here be sure to get your parking ticket validated for a parking garage nearby - we didn't notice the garage until AFTER we finished our meal and explored the area.

9Ez0VRTa3LBxuduAgdqVIw.review_text: Very nice place on the bay with great drink menu and food with an awsome chowder bowl

-DTpelkNudFUIxWqXpl_3Q.review_text: Great atmosphere, great food, great service. Khaiman was our server, he went the extra mile to make sure we had a perfect experience. Try the clam chowder and the banana bread pudding for sure.

64konRX-4_8NwJctk70qwg.review_text: Came here with my family on Christmas Eve. Got seated pretty quickly, even without a reservation. The food was very good, I had the Shellfish Platter with 1/2 crab, mussels, clams, and shrimp. Very good portion, but pretty pricey. The other portions (not specifically sure what the rest of the fam got) were quite small though. Not worth the money they said. The service was...ok. I wasn't able to get a refill on my ice tea because my waiter didn't come around to check enough. Waters stayed empty for most of the night. Waiter seemed very flustered and looking to get our table closed out and on with our nights.   No matter, Pier 39 is a nice place to search for desserts and coffee too!

q5aG7pkJdHjb5O9YjgupSA.review_text: Four of us shared the crab ceviche, clam chowder in a bowl, seafood platter for 2, and the cioppino. Total was something like $130 before tip... (pricy!)  Nothing was particularly remarkable. My favorite dish was the seafood platter - the shrimp, clams, mussels and crab were seasoned simply (garlic salt pepper butter) to really let the platter be about the taste of the seafood. Yum! But nothing I want to pay for at a restaurant. The cioppino was _really_ disappointing, tasted like a can of tomato puree dumped on a bunch of seafood.   I won't be coming again.

XcWmZ6BTXyiEGL6lofBAbA.review_text: Great food, great view, don't make the mistake of getting the bread bowl though. You can just get the large chowder and keep ordering free bread. Use the 2 dollars to buy half a coffee in a hip coffeeshop somewhere nearby.

66yzYNSzh2cP3Vb4SRehPQ.review_text: Bay scallops and calm chowder.. all you need to know.    Only bad thing is getting a table you want. I have yet been able to get a window seat despite open tables. If you want one I guess you have to make a reservation.  The food is worth putting up with the snooty attitude on seating. Waiters are friendly and helpful.

AKHX3VbnKrdE_nIOCd5ptA.review_text: This used to be my favorite restaurant on Pier 39 because of the view, food, and service. A trifecta!  However, my recent visit this weekend left me slightly disappointed due to the service. First, we were seated at a table too small for our party though we made reservations weeks in advance. The sun was glaring on our table and made us uncomfortable, so we ended up changing tables. However, once we changed tables, we ended up with a waitress that was extremely grumpy. Maybe she picked up an extra couple shifts? She was tired and lifeless and was not keen on interacting more with us than possible. There were plenty of servers and waiters around on a Sunday evening when only 30-40% of the restaurant was filled, yet our service was so slow. Our waters were too often completely empty. It was also a birthday as stated during our reservation, but we had to remind the waitress a couple times to get a candle... When the desserts came out, low and behold, candleless... and then the waitress brought out another dessert with a candle 20 minutes later. She then, charged us for the extra dessert and we had to ask her to take it off. Sloppy... and off...   The food was quite good and well-priced, as usual and the view was nice, though slightly too sunny during sunset (they didnt lower their shades over the offending windows). Enjoyed the mixed grill, clam chowder, crab ceviche, and seafood cioppinos. Don't know what's wrong, but service is getting sloppy.

aLSJxufr-JwJbLdVF6zg5w.review_text: My husband and I dined here twice in the week we visited San Francisco. The food was incredible! The crab cakes were delicious, the calamari was good, the sourdough bread was wonderful. Oysters on the half shell were fabulous as well. They were accommodating to our friend with dietary limitations too. Our server offered suggestions on the menu for her.

Sm9p2M-EPPmg14ww33D0YQ.review_text: The food was pretty good, but the ambiance was almost unbearable if you are trying to avoid packed/touristy places. We had the crab cakes which were my 2nd favorite only to San Juan island (in WA) and the ahi tuna (ok) and the garlic crab (ok but maybe too butter rich).   So food good, worth price et cetera et cetera.  But ambiance we felt like we were packed like sardines.  I've been to plenty of nicer restaurants which deuce food seafood and don't feel so cheap by putting people together. That said the service was very nice. I just wouldn't go back.

82P1dqLERWO0mJ-dCfJVZA.review_text: This restaurant is pretty classy and is situated right on the pier so you can see out into the bay.  My friends and I were lucky and got seated right next to the huge windows with a great view of the water. The inside is dimly lit and would be great for a romantic, fancy dinner. I loved the ambience and the fact that it's on the water and as my friend said, I suppose you're paying for the view as well as the food, which is why it's pricier.  Apparently their clam chowder is very good, and I almost ordered it but instead, I went with the curry mussels, my favorite seafood. The mussels were really soft and soaked in the delicious curry sauce. I was relieved that the curry wasn't spicy at all, although it had a nice small kick to it and was slightly sweet and creamy. I really liked the sauce and I also dipped the complementary bread they serve into the sauce. The amount of mussels they served in the bowl was worth the price, especially for a fancy place.  Service was okay, nothing bad but nothing stood out either. I would like to come here again sometime though, for both the food and view!

TXzUwgCFs-dGcP5-uOBtqw.review_text: Nice place. Swordfish was great. I would come back. They have a really nice bar, but a pretty limited drink menu, weird.

_OCVA417JevjE1ifcftgIA.review_text: I usually don't ever come to the Piers because it's super touristy and crowded. The food here is pretty good. I got the Trout and calamari appetizers. My friends got the lobster mac and cheese, salmon, cippino and fried platter. Everything was pretty good and the portions are pretty big. I would definitely come here again. We parked at 80 francisco parking garage it's $10 for the full day until 9 pm.

2-gMqp9WnP-0bQbdLaL6nA.review_text: Khaiman rocks!!!!!  Food was wonderful.  Service was awesome.  Khaiman really went above and beyond to make our experience memorable.  Gave us great suggestions about the city.  Highly recommend.

U1GiQ4GDGZXRqE3Oxe0P_w.review_text: Excellent bar - Barrel Aged Manhattan with oysters to start.  In crab season you can't beat their garlic roasted whole Dungeness crab!  Great service, even if just for one guy at the bar.  Comfortable place to relax, and AWESOME harbor views.

CcekFVBRIPPKue16475frg.review_text: I was definitely impressed. Better than your typical tourist spot.  This restaurant is fit for foodies.  The restaurant staff keeps the establishment very clean and maintenance is efficient.  The clam chowder is very good especially w a garnish of fresh Dungeness crab. The crab avocado Caesar salad is a wonderful seafood treat.

j1obgwUy5MLvbMTvElyUig.review_text: Great Place! My boyfriend and I were visiting San Francisco and had just finished the Alcatraz evening tour and couldn't wait to get dinner at a local seafood house.  This was definately a great place to dine!  The entrance is gorgeous with the backlighting to the water feature in the entrance by the fireplace and nice seating added a welcoming touch to our dinner. We had 2 free drink vouchers from our hotel (Radisson Fisherman's Warf) to use which was a nice surprise.  Along with drinks we got a chicken caesar salad and the fried shrimp plate with veggies and wild rice pilaf.  Fantastic!  We arrived at 930pm and were immediately seated, received our food and were out the door within 1 hour.  Very nice Fog Harbor!

ytpGEstuMuxpQF_nu67_VA.review_text: Shawna suggested the Moscow Mule and it was very refreshing. She is a great bartender I highly recommended you stop in and say Hi to Shawna  shrimp cocktail was nice as well

D9IMOsV39BvoDNb08N9myQ.review_text: We had some pretty amazing food here. The crab was fresh and delicious, specifically the Cajun one. (or was it creole? I know its not the same. ) I also had the fried combination, since I was really craving some fried shrimp. Unfortunately it only comes with two, a slab of fish, and a boatload of calamari. It would've been perfect, but we had already ordered calamari as an app.  The non seafood options are also pretty good, and with the care and quality taken to prepare those well shows this place can deliver 5 star food when it needs to.

b974DuLfzoKvS4PKZgPZ9Q.review_text: Your typical touristy restaurant. Nothing amazing about it, not terrible either by any means.  First of all, I will mention that this location is superb and the views are amazing. This added some enjoyment to the experience. Unfortunately, the experience was rather meh.  The biggest downfall to our visit was the fact that our server was very timid and didn't explain anything that well. It felt instead of being a knowledgeable server, he was rather just fetching our meal/drinks back and forth.  I ordered the lobster tail which was pretty tasty, but the vegetables that accompanied the dish were under-seasoned and boring.  If you can, steer clear and spend your money elsewhere.

XNIAsEmbEWh8snJendr1Sw.review_text: great food.. great service great prices. make a visit you wont be disappointed.

zBGRIMCTD4MCQSxHnVp1Jw.review_text: I love coming here and I love the view. Blue cheese garlic bread is yummy. Fish and chips I'm not crazy about the batter. Crab is delicious and generous portions. I just had the pumpkin martini and love it!

ga3Xol_m2SC_6dGa9DiGfg.review_text: This place is phenomenal! I brought my boyfriend here for lunch for his 20th birthday and I guess we were not prepared for how pricey it was going to be since we just happened to stroll by and decide to eat there since we were hungry and looking for a nice sit down restaurant. We were seated by our sever John who was probably one of the best severs we've ever had! He was professional, sweet and helped us pick out something for appetizers since we both couldn't decide. I ordered the garlic roasted Dungeness crab (it was crab season) and I don't quite remember what my boyfriend had to eat but it seemed like a fried seafood platter of some sort. The garlic crab was SOOO good and it was big enough to satisfy me even with how hungry I was. Unlike other restaurants the garlic flavor could actually be identified while eating the crab meat and not just laying around on the shell. My boyfriend loved his entire plate and finished every bite. For drinks since neither of us are 21 yet, we had the iced tea and the ginger lemonade. OMG I wish I could have that ginger lemonade right now, it was quite strong but combined with the mint and lemon it was a perfect drink paired with the strong garlicy crab. For appetizers my boyfriend ordered the fried calamari since I had never tried it before. It was pretty good even though I know for some people it's an acquired taste but I liked it as soon as I got over the texture :p All in all we had a terrific upscale experience even during lunch hours and customer service here was outstanding so we will definitely be returning. I feel a little guilty for not leaving a bigger tip than I did and after we left we both felt so bad because we have never been served that greatly and John definitely deserved it!!

fvV_EA7EHCpyh-x3OR-3eQ.review_text: The atmosphere, staff, service, and food were all excellent. It was quite crowded, but service was very good and i hardly had to wait for my meal!! i would recommend this Fish house to anyone!!

_Oz_-_BrfcxqR3Uvwd4-BA.review_text: Wow! I did NOT expect to find such good food at the Pier. Fog Harbor is a sure bet for excellent food and service with the killer view and convenience you're looking for.   Clam Chowder breadbowl was as luxurious and decadent as you want it to be. It is perfection on a cold (or even cool, for this FL gal) day. Tuna Poke was uninspired and lacked texture Chilled half crab was so fresh and delicious. Cracked - easy to eat All of the cocktails we tried were creative, well-balanced, and strong.  Total bill approximately $100 including tax and tip (two people).   *Although I didn't order them, my friend's crab cakes looked way too bread-y for the price*  Bonus points to our Ken doll look-alike server, who proactively separated our checks by couple.   Fog Harbor would've earned 5 stars if not for the lackluster Tuna and high drink prices. Still, not to be missed if you're in the area.

OJ6Fl4Be5YeIUgAqvRIRLg.review_text: Outstanding views.  Friendly but slow service:  we were seated right away but it took 10-15 minutes for a waiter to show up and take our drink order and another 10-15 minutes to actually receive our drink order (very fresh cold Lagunitas IPA, Yummy!).  This slow theme repeated itself throughout the meal.  No biggie, we weren't in a hurry but it seemed like the waiter was spread too thin and the lag times were noticeable....not really a good thing. Sourdough Bread:  A+ Steamed Mussels:  A- Clam Chowder:  A Crab Roll:  B+/A- Tuna Poke Salad:  B+/A- Lagunitas IPA:  A All in all a nice meal.  Were it not for the slow service and low cozy factor of Pier 39, we would be back.

dg4q1yi_soxfDrp7KzHF5Q.review_text: First time, I really wanted to try this place because it has  4 stars of 1000 reviews. Plus the other place I wanted to try was packed. I mean it is a Saturday and today is the giants vs. LA dodgers game.  This place is upscale, fine dining type of place. I like that they offer places like these in an attraction base environment. Cause sometimes you want to enjoy a nice dinner with a fantastic view. Like this place I'm at right now.   Our server is nice, but when we asked for water she said it's coming, and made it seem like someone else was bringing it but she brought it to us instead. Sometimes she'd walk by just to walk by and see that my water is almost empty and doesn't fill it up, you're just walking back and forth, what are you doing?   Anyway, what we ordered: clam chowder bread bowl, seafood ciopponi with pasta, and steamed clams.  What it tasted like: everything looked amazing. The clam chowder was the best thing we ordered, it was hot and very good. The seafood ciopponi was ok, there was some type of flavor I probably won't remember. The noodles were hard. The seafood in the ciopponi were good, I like the variety. There was salmon, fish, mussel, clams, shrimp and crab legs. The steamed clams, I've had before somewhere else taste better with garlic broth. This chorizo with tomatoes, I didn't really care for.  Would I come back? Maybe I'll try somewhere else first before I give this one another shot.

wHxbG6VF_10diXjFUqWfxQ.review_text: I gave it 3 stars because of the food. Dungeness crab meat sandwich is super yummy  but the  service was poor.

HPWI9uEYjTxmNWZABchoDw.review_text: A more solid 3.5 stars but I gave it a bonus 1/2 star.    Service was excellent 5 stars.  We were very well attended to the entire time.    We had the 1/2 crab Louis w/sub for blue cheese which was a nice side salad for 2 if you're not too hungry.  The dressing is one of the best I've had.  Cheesy and creamy just like my grandfather used to make!  Forget the Louis dressing and go for the blue cheese!  We also had the sliders which were pretty overage and overpriced.  I wouldn't order them again.  The crab sandwich was excellent.  Bread was freshly made and the crab filling was delicious.  We had the kids and they had the salmon which tasted very good and the $0.95 sundae was a can't miss  Overall a really good experience.

JwsanJ9GmI4xo9desz66fA.review_text: We had the greatest service and the food was phenomenal. NOT! I wanted to treat my little girl to her favorite meal of fish and chips at her favorite place in the City, Pier 39. Since my daughter was famished, I stopped by the first restaurant that served a kids portion of fish and chips. It was Fog Harbor Fish House. What a big mistake that was. Our waitress, who acted like she had some sort of hearing impairment, seemed like she was on 'something'. I had to repeat my order four times. Yes four times. But whatever. Maybe she was having a bad day. We ordered the kids fish and chips, curry mussels, and the cheeseburger. After waiting for about ten minutes, my daughter started to complain for that she was hungry, and was there any bread for her to nibble on before her fish and chips?  Looking around for our waitress, she was no where to be found. Finally the double doors to the kitchen opened and out came our deaf waitress carrying our mussels. She sets  it down and I start digging in. I offered my daughter some. She refused, she just wanted bread. The mussels were fresh, but didn't taste curry enough (probably the freshest thing that we ordered) and  the curry sauce just sat at he bottom of the dish. It was like the mussels were steamed separately and the curry sauce was just an afterthought.  I looked up to ask for the bread, but the deaf waitress disappeared again. She not only forgot our bread but also a bowl to put my shells. I told my daughter to simply drink her cranberry juice that she ordered. She was quiet. I asked her what's wrong. She just looked at the juice. I grabbed the juice and sipped throughout he straw and to my horror that juice was SPOILED!  Half-way through eating, the double doors flung wide open and out comes our deaf waitress. I practically shouted for a bread basket. And as quickly as she came through the doors she quickly disappeared through them again. But too fast for me to request a bowl for my shells and to fill my water cup. Sigh. She comes out 5 minutes later with warm sourdough bread and butter. My little girl was finally in food heaven. After 10 minutes, my daughter's long-awaited fish and chips and my cheeseburger finally came. I finally asked for a bowl for my shells. Our waitress noticed that the cup was still full of cranberry juice. I politely told her that it was a bit rotten. She stated she'll take the juice out of my bill. My burger looked awesome. But at the first bite I noticed the burger was a bit tough and the bacon old and leathery, liked it was MICROWAVED :( NOT GOOD. The fries were okay, nothing spectacular. I was thirsty and asked my daughter for a little of her water, since i drank all mine and the deaf waitress was now where to be found. Then I looked at my daughter's fish and chips. I asked her why she was just picking at it. She didn't say anything. I asked her if she wanted a to go box for it. She said, "No box, please". She NEVER says this. I took a fork full of fish, that $hiT was COLD AND HARD! OMG. I quickly looked around for our deaf and invisible waitress, but she was no where to be found. I finally saw her robustness and asked for the check and two boxes (hey, I wasn't going to waste food. My dog hadn't eaten and could use the cold fish and hard burger). The check came and as I was about to sign it, the manager came up to me and inquired about our meal. I made a face and rolled my eyes.  He said that wasn't a good sign and to tell him what happened. So I proceeded to tell him about the fish and chips and cranberry juice. I was about to tell him about our lack of service, but he grabbed my check and went to fix my bill. He took out my daughter's meal and gave me an extra 20% off.  He even offered to fix my daughter another meal. Nice gesture, but it was too late. This place already gave me indigestion. Any minute longer there would have given me food poising.  *KUDOS*:  clean bathrooms my adjusted bill sourdough bread mussels (but see below)  *ATROCIOUSNESS*:  service fish and chips cheeseburger with the leathery bacon the lack of 'curriness' in the mussels

MZuvl0oUK3QSv7faGx9i5w.review_text: Fog Harbor is a touristy place, but tourists wouldn't come here if the food wasn't good.  We stopped in for a late afternoon lunch and cocktails. The cocktail menu is a bit pricey at over $10 a drink, but consistent with other bars we've visited at Fisherman's Warf. We both had Moscow Mules; they were crisp and refreshing, garnished with lime and ginger.  More importantly, you will be delighted in the freshness and high quality of their foods, especially their seafood. Both my fiancée and I had their blue cheese wedge salad after seeing one delivered to another person at the bar. The salad looked mouth watering when we saw it, then we proved it was delicious when we ordered our own. It is loaded with creamy blue cheese, crumbles of blue cheese and bacon.  I had the Seared Alaskan Halibut and it was perfect: flaky, over a bed of quinoa, leafy greens, dried berries and a delicious sauce to bring all the flavors together. My fiancée did an appetizer combo for dinner including a crab cocktail and clam chowder, she said both items were fresh and delicious.  For those with gluten sensitivity, their menu is clearly marked with all the items that are "prepared without gluten." They have a significant selection of gluten free dishes and one gluten free desert. Our server, albeit quirky, was very conscientious about my needs and took ownership of communicating my needs to the kitchen.  We'd also like to thank them for listing the dungeoness crab cocktail on their receipts as "dung crab cocktail." My fiancée and I can verify that the crab cocktail didn't taste like dung, it tasted like crab. However, we we appreciated the laugh.  Overall, a great meal and a wonderful view of the bay. It may be a touristy due to its location on Pier 39. Nevertheless, you'll get a great meal in a nice atmosphere!

WoBY39POG80D99hoyF-sDw.review_text: I got the clam chowder bowl and crab cakes, which were both fresh and perfectly filling. Delish. My friend got the crab, mango, & avocado ceviche which was also super tasty.  If you check in, they give you blue cheese breadsticks. Unfortunately, they came to the table last and although they were pretty good, they were a touch too oily and at that point we were already too full to eat them.  Overall: nice ambiance, good service, decent price. Was happy with the experience, but wouldn't make it a priority to come back again.

aURXctTpENUmTuCQSs_0yw.review_text: Good service from Michael and free blue cheese bread from Yelp a good offer too. Wine list and menu all good with large portions, food fairly pricey but ok as you're in a tourist area. Recommend getting on early. We are before 5pm.

lEDPV3-25q49SeG5N2UL1g.review_text: Sorry gotta give this place 2 stars service was so so waiter didnt clear the table till we were leaving.i ordered the crab with a spicy tomatoe pepper concoction how are you sopposed  to eat the crab with a ton of sauce poured over it?my wife had the alfrado and crab it was bland at best not enough parm in the sauce.for this price it wasnt worth it great views but 1 star food go to bubba gumps much better quality.

FkL2bIqiO5TWN1ya0QHH5A.review_text: We had a fantastic view from our table! The waiter was super nice and he suggested some good plates to chose from. i had the Mix Grill i would recommend getting it with the rice instead of the smash potatoes. The food was out in no time, quick service. I also liked how in the waiting room they have a fire place it made you feel at home. i will definitely be coming back!

QCSD_v13NrlYCMH5_l2LcA.review_text: The waiters and waitresses were so nice and kind very fast and helpful on questions. The atmosphere of the whole restaurant was nice, low lighting slightly quiet but got really loud at some points mainly because of kids but that's normal.  The main reason for 3 stars, the food was great but I got major food poisoning from the crab cakes with the aioli sauce, very sure it was the sauce that did it, probably the worst food poisoning I've ever had or I would've rated this higher, if I had not gotten food poisoning at all it wouldve definitely been a 4-5 star rating.

ORGpSK4fXHBWDl44MFDBgg.review_text: Really good service here with attentive service staff! The view was great as you can literally see the ships, seas and all the tourists below the restaurant.   Came here for restaurant week but ordered a bowl of clam chowder on the side. Was surprised by the small portion of the clam chowder but the taste more than make up for the small size! Wish I could order another bowl!   Had the crab ceviche and crab cakes. ceviche is better than crab cakes as the plate came with fries and made me feel like it was an unhealthy meal!  So come here if u like to eat with pretty scenery and be served by nice people!

f0bbZOzD9iWEojm__o15MA.review_text: Me and my wife had a dinner here for our honeymoon. The service was excellent! Very informative and fun as well. The food was excellent. We were told to get clam chowder and it was the best I have ever had and then we got the steamed platter. That was a great choice it was awesome. I would tell anyone to go here if you make it to Pier 39..

ap6LAP_g7IuKXlfVlKYXVg.review_text: Stopped here for lunch before going on Adventure Catamaran Tour at Pier 39 (an awesome tour by the way). Decided to eat at the bar to save time. The bartender, Tony, made our visit extra special. Despite being very busy, he took care of our food order and got us in and out in less than 30 minutes. The fish and chips were awesome, and they have a good kids menu. I agree, its nice to see a not quite so touristy place with good food, in the middle of this tourist trap of a Pier. We will definitely come back when we can spend more time!

Ij7OcAO5FpoNKxS1RzNoWw.review_text: We stopped in here for a couple of drinks before the rehearsal dinner. Its a huge place but its awesome - kind of touristy but it is what it is. We had some great drinks - I had some girly pink lemonade drink but it was awesome and strong. The food smelled and looked great so I would definitely go back to try some of it.

cikMH120Xypm7-GjgvnRsg.review_text: This place was the ONLY good thing about Pier 39 on our visit recently. I have lived in the Bay Area for 30+ years...... and I don't usually got to Pier 39. But a friend wanted to go, and I agreed. This place was a saving grace of our day trip.  The food was excellent, and our waiter, Derik was super. The sour dough bread was the best, and it's baked every 15 min!  I had the crab cakes, and they were Yummmmy.  Everything was fresh, and served hot. We did not feel pushed to finish our meal, so they could seat someone else.  GREAT PLACE.   If I go back, I will NOT use the parking garage (big rip -off) and will go straight to FOG HARBOR.

d23OLx3YK3wsJRsPzDvGTQ.review_text: I can only speak from the one experience I had there, but it was great. The windows overlook Pier 39 and you can see Alcatraz Island as well. The waiting area outside was cute, and the waiters were friendly. I ordered crab cakes, and they were wonderful. My husband got seafood pasta and he loved his. I'm not an expert on seafood, but I enjoyed it and that's all I can really say!

GN83yGu-5Isw5iVJ5cFj9w.review_text: Made an afternoon pit stop for drinks...while the bartenders are friendly...their drink mixing skills are somewhat off the mark.  We'd ordered a cosmo and gimlet and the drinks came out looking bright Christmas colors (red and green).  At our request, the bartender was nice enough to make us something else - we opted for on the rocks with splash of juice.

76vIFZcC7owykCBjMfGVXg.review_text: This is your typical touristy restaurant in the Pier 39 area, which decent tasting food and a nice view, but inflated prices. Make sure you check in on Yelp to get a free Blue Cheese Garlic Bread appetizer. I came for my friend's birthday (Kellie C.!) since they have a separate room for large parties in the back of the restaurant, and were able to accommodate a group of 18 on a Thursday night. We came in around 8:15pm, and the table was ready, so we were seated right away. Although the table sat 18, we could've used a little more room. However, it worked out fine, and I got to try: -Blue Cheese Garlic Bread (Fresh Sourdough, Topped w/Garlic, Pt. Reyes Blue Cheese, Herbs, $8): Just ok. The blue cheese overpowered all the other flavors, and you couldn't taste the garlic. The bread was also too crunchy for my liking. Skip! -Oysters (Served w/Cocktail Sauce, Dozen $26, yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-…): The oysters were fresh, but the cocktail sauce and mignonette were just ok. I wish they had given us some Tabasco with the oysters. Skip! -Crispy Lemon Calamari (Seasoned w/Lemon, Served w/Lemon Aioli, $12, yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-…): Yuck.. the calamari rings were chewy, and the batter was soggy. This is one of the worst fried calamari dishes I've had, and they should really re-look at their recipe. Skip! -Ahi Poke (Marinated Raw Tuna, Avocado, Mango, Sesame-Soy Sauce, Wasabi Aioli, $16): Ok. The tuna tasted fresh, and I liked the wasabi aioli. However, the sesame soy sauce didn't have much flavor, and the dish overall was bland. Skip! -Crab Louis ($22, yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-…): They didn't skimp on the crab, and it tasted really fresh, which was great. However, there were pieces of cartilage in the crab, and the salad itself was bland. I wouldn't order this again. -Crab Roll (Fresh Crab, Celery, Shallot Aioli, Served on a Buttered Roll w/Sweet Potato Fries, $19, yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-…): Pretty good if you like mayo, and I liked that they toasted the roll nicely. The sweet potato fries were also really good. Recommended! -Fish & Chips (Hand Dipped in "Anchor Steam" Beer Batter w/Cole Slaw, $17, yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-…): They give you a huge portion (2 large and 2 medium sized fish sticks, fries, cole slaw), but the fish was just ok. I didn't like the taste and consistency of the batter- it tasted bitter from the beer, and was too crunchy. The cole slaw was also just so-so since it was very bland. However, the fries were done nicely, and the tartar sauce was delicious. -Award Winning Clam Chowder (The Best in San Francisco, Bowl, $8, yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-…): This was a pretty good version of clam chowder! It was rich and creamy, and there were big pieces of clam in the chowder. Recommended! -Apple Crisp a la Mode (House-Made w/Granny Smith Apples, Walnuts, Butter Crumb, Served Warm, Topped w/Vanilla Ice Cream, $8.50): Ok. I liked the butter crumb, but the apples were a little hard. I wouldn't order this again. -Warm Chocolate Lava Cake (w/Creamy Chocolate Center, Served w/Vanilla Ice Cream, $8.50): Just ok, nothing special. I wouldn't order this again. The best dishes from here were the Crab Roll and Clam Chowder, and the fries from the fish and chips. Although I don't think I'd come back for those dishes again, I would recommend ordering them if you are dining here. The service was good up until the end- it took them a long time to bring the dessert and our check. Make sure you ask them to validate your parking ticket if you parked in the structure across the street.   Overall, there are so many better restaurants to eat at in SF, and it's not worth coming here unless you can expense your meal, or if you really want a view of the pier area.

_9iZTjwRl9rBWRfcyX928Q.review_text: Everything was great except for not knowing who our server was. It took so long for a server to finally walk up to our table and acknowledge we were there. We seriously were thinking of getting up and walking out if it took any longer. Something in our hearts made us stay, well maybe because the sound of crab on top of clam chowder was just something we did not want to pass up. So we're glad we stayed and after we made some crazy eye contact with who we assumed was our server, it got better from there.  Definitely order clam chowder, whatever the option it may be, bowl, cup, in a bread bowl, you will not go wrong.   I had the crab roll, it was a good amount of crab in a butter toasted super soft bun. My wife ordered the soup and salad and it was perfect.

U2BDYntmmVanSvYExOhP-A.review_text: Excellent view.  Awesome food. And a great service.  It is a bit pricy for my budget but it was worth it.

Y6yg0sxJjZg7m2UdF9eGZA.review_text: 3.5 stars   Fog Harbor serves up a good, solid lunch with great views.  The restaurant is a good size, and the view with the boats and the like entertained my son quiet well.  I ordered the crab cake appetizer as my entree, and I thought it was delicious.  My glass of riesling was a bit on the skimpy side though.  My husband's clam chowder soup and crab roll were delicious as well.  My son's mac and cheese consisted of very-overcooked pasta (and I usually like "overcooked" pasta) with way too much butter, which completely seeped out and puddled when I opened the leftovers box the next day.  And although the sourdough bread that they served was hot and fresh with a nice crusty exterior and great flavor, I have to say that they completely squish their bread by cutting it wrong. Whoever is cutting it needs to learn 1) use a serrated knife and 2) saw back and forth.  Otherwise you are killing the good efforts of the baker to make great bread.  Overall, not bad. We'll return another day, but will probably skip the kid's mac and cheese and go for something else.

b76FcjQd1RkpnP6I-ajhjw.review_text: My fiance had the lobster special and I had the clam linguini. The food was pretty good with an awesome view. The price was decent. The only thing was the waitress wasn't very friendly and took a long time to attend to us, but the food made up for it. I also had  scoop of vanilla ice cream with drizzled chocolate on top and that was amazing all in itself.

tTHzLMuhjatBE8CZ-L5ZUg.review_text: I was very pleased with my visit! I was not used to the great customer service that I got because most places that I've been to since moving to San Jose, service sucks lol   I had the Fried Shrimp w/ fries and THE BEST CLAM CHOWDER EVER!   I definitely recommend this place for clam chowder and their whole menu actually looked pretty good!

yhwtDBHillyYM6GuWrmzdw.review_text: This place is awesome! Great view, it's worth every minute that you have to wait for a seat near the window. Great service, very friendly. Great food, I had the oysters, clam chowder, and mixed grill, all superb!

BHej3YG3nmkCxDeJHOKQzA.review_text: Clam chowder and oysters are delicious. Do not get the calamari. Worst calamari ever. Server went on break and no one was really checking up on us. I ordered a cup of clam chowder and never received it.

sKd2Mn9-ws34UwZ3D54huQ.review_text: I had an amazing time at this restaurant. I couldn't give a 5 star, because our original server didn't have the best customer service. However, for some reason, a new server Morgan took over and our time here became almost perfect. She was very kind and always had a small on, and had great customer service for a high quality restaurant. She checked up on us as much as she can, and really changed our time there. I highly recommend asking for her if you want great customer service.  As for the food, the seafood was high quality and everything was absolutely delicious. We had the crab and avocado salad, clam chowder, and the crab ceviche to start off. All of the flavors were upto par and super fresh. I recommend trying their whole crab, their mixed grill, and their shellfish platter for a variety. You can order for 1-2 servings with the shellfish platter. All of the seafood was very fresh and seasoned well.   Overall, I will definitely be returning for their quality seafood and the customer service we received in the end. One tip: make reservations for the view because the view really makes it much more special. Thank you Morgan for a wonderful Christmas Eve dinner with my family!

gurcmVDESVQ8X20xpw4btw.review_text: Solid, very touristy spot.   Now, you're probably not reading this thinking its a "local gem", but i want to be explicit. This place is on the edge of the touristy part of SF.   That said, the food is solid - Dungeness crab season all the way! The service is good and the place feels clean and open. There is a great view of alcatraz as well. Overpriced a bit, but not terribly.   So, overall, its a great place for tourists!

85nh-P4jR2TgjQlyqArznw.review_text: I was able to book a reservation last minute thru yelp. Awesome.  Ha the margarita (organic) was really good and well done. My dish was the crab cake. Good portion if you are not a huge portion fanatic. Was very good and the crab cake was real crab. Coffee was really good as well. The bread was still warm! I like this place.

mL9GtEYtR5e3kae0B7pCsw.review_text: After just 3 years in the Bay Area I still feel like a tourist. So any opportunity to act like one is taken with gusto. My cousin came in on a cruise ship en route to Alaska or something and she wanted to see my family while she was at port.   Now - I have 2 kids, a 2 year old and a 11 month old, so I am always cautious not to go out to restaurants that are not kid friendly. Luckily, most tourist venues fit the bill - even nicer one's like Fog Harbor.    I made reservations right here with Open Table, noted that I had 2 kids and we were set-up with crayons, a coloring menu and a very attentive, patient staff.   Now onto the food - it was good, nothing too fancy. I had a delicious steak, fried calamari, my wife enjoyed an Ahi Tuna and our guests were full from Chinese Dim-Sum - but they did have some lovely shrimp cocktail.  I can't complain, the 4 stars were really for the kid-friendly atmosphere and great views from almost anywhere inside. Oh and they validated parking.   TLDR version: Good for kids, good food, validate parking, enjoy the Pier :)  p.s. there is an awesome merry-go-round at the end of the pier, it was epic. :)

o_p7twtyTsJ3NmXmL5yyRA.review_text: This is my favorite place ever. A friend and I were in the city one day and took a cab to Pier 39 for lunch, we were soooo hungry that we walked upstairs and said "Hey, this place looks nice, let's eat here" it was the best meal either one of us has ever had. I now come here for birthdays, anniversaries, and any other excuse I can find to get there. The clam chowder is amazing, but the swordfish is why I keep coming....the service is great EVERYTIME. The drinks are delicious.

yoMyZL8PpA8-P-lTMHbkKg.review_text: Second time here and still not disappointed. The sourdough bread is addictive the service is great.  Clementine was my server and I really can't say anything bad about her.   She was attentive funny and made the experience even better.   I am vegetarian so I had a special dish made by the kitchen. It was good. My partner ordered fish and chips and loved it.   Clementine made sure our drinks were strong and that we were enjoying everything.  Now if only they would get rid of the silly dessert tray.

egJ0KB6iuj9_2HsnOfVgLw.review_text: Took my visiting mom here for some fish & chips and it was a-ok. The view is remarkable and worth a visit for any tourists. The food is about what you'd expect in Pier 39.   All and all a decent experience if you're looking to patronize any of the Pier 39-area restaurants and stay budget-conscious.

4s9VYDlkstf7EhLxJv7FBA.review_text: Stopped by on a busy Sunday evening and was told the wait was 45 minutes. My daughter and I definitely wanted to try Fog Harbor so we hung out and sat in the super comfy chairs near the fireplace out front. 25 minutes later my name was called and we were seated at a lovely table in front of the windows. Our waitress was sweet but the service wasn't particularly fast. To be honest, that was ok with us, we wanted to take our time and enjoy our last dinner in the city. Fog Harbor was full of tourists but didn't feel touristy.  Our food was AMAZING. She had shrimp cocktail for dinner and was happy with the six very large shrimp plus the warm boudin bread and butter. I had the half garlic roasted Dungeness crab with fingerling potatoes and corn on the cob. My mouth is watering just thinking about it and dinner was two hours ago!  I highly recommend Fog Harbor Fish House!

xiBOTayhN5vkDOWmIy-cXg.review_text: Food is amazing and so was the service from Shawna! We will for sure come back to this place!

0aQ57h7pu4FyxjWHq1EpQg.review_text: My wife and I went here for a nice dinner on our trip to SF. It's a classy establishment with nice views of the Bay. We ordered the scallops appetizer which was Amazing as was the sauce that came with it. I had the Crab Cakes which were LITERALLY the BEST I've ever had and I've had my share. My wife had the crab cocktail. The actual crab was delicious BUT order the cocktail sauce on the side. They smothered the crab in sauce which was sort of unexpected. I would absolutely go back again. I will say expect to run a decent tab if you go BUT you're at the ocean. You can't skimp on fresh seafood.

UKyn5u9C-F9QkucQIUG7pw.review_text: Had a terrific dinner here tonight. Started with the bleu cheese bread and fritters. I would recommend both.   My wife had a bowl of the chowder.   It was creamy, and had wonderful flavor.  Especially liked the crab meat topping.  I had the seafood platter.  The portion was a good size, and felt it was reasonably priced. All the shellfish was cooked properly and loved the slice of bread for dipping in the garlic butter. Finished off the meal with tiramisu- which was spectacular.   Our server was Shawna.  She was absolutely terrific.  Took the time to answer all of our questions, and was very prompt with her service.  She frequently checked in with us and ensured that everything was good.  If I were to be back in this area again, I would definitely ask to be seated in her section.  Beyond the food and service, the place has a wonderful ambiance. The views overlooking the water are terrific, and found the noise level was not so loud that you could not have a conversation.  All in all,  really enjoyed the meal and service we had.

YnAT3WxbrlJqrny-lS8gog.review_text: We stopped in for a late lunch two years ago and the food was delicious.  We returned this fall and the food was still wonderful.  We had the shell fish plate for two and a bowl of clam chowder each. So much food, all wonderfully cooked.  After all that good food I wanted something light for desert.  I ordered the tiramisu  and it was just right, just a bit of sweetness for the end to go with the coffee.    I'm sorry some of the reviewers had a bad time.  Our waitress, Madison, was delightful. She took the time we needed to answer questions and made sure we had everything we needed.  We came in right before the rush, I am sure that helps.

jhE0HCEgIxBvE3PXbxm4AQ.review_text: Who knew such a good restaurant is alive and kickin in the biggest tourist trap ever?!  I ordered the mixed fish plate and the fish was sooo good!!!    The rice wasn't cooked all the way but the bread made up for it. It was hot and yummy!!!  Save room for dessert!!!

9xXBniVmut2nVkB2CBKT4Q.review_text: I thought the clam chowder tasted like it had flour or starch or something in it. And my bf didn't think the ahi tuna was that great kinda chewy. For the price tag i would say try somewhere else

lh3Erb-PSSw6Pi4mzhQmHw.review_text: If you're near pier 39, come to this restaurant! Everything we got was fresh, not heavy, an absolutely delicious. From the freshly baked sourdough garlic bread to the lobster Mac and cheese to the mixed seafood platter, everything was delicious and they don't skimp on the portions. Come here, for what you get for the price you will not be disappointed!!

JPXsEViInojd0GBJPoCLUA.review_text: My husband and I came here for dinner to celebrate our anniversary while on vacation. We almost ended up at Scoma's but I'm so glad we didn't! Fog Harbor exceeded our expectations. Starting off with two delicious cocktails (Manhattan and dirty martini) at the bar, we were given great recommendations from the bartender. After being seated at a window table with a wonderful view of the wharf and "Happy Anniversary" adorably scribbled on it, we began to indulge.   For our entrees my husband ordered the seafood cioppino which was chock full of large shell fish and a broth that lit up our tastebuds. He's literally still craving it 2 weeks later. I on the other hand decided to be difficult and create my own dish that was not on the menu. Our waiter Richard who was phenomenal and beyond accommodating, brought me exactly what I was craving (lobster and Dungeness crab pasta in a cream sauce) A-mazing!!  After dinner we were gifted with a large and decadent dessert (a warm walnut brownie with ice cream) for our special occasion. All in all, Fog Harbor made it a very memorable night for us and we thank Richard and staff for the awesome service.

jTLcYO0sWQergwONKPcNNQ.review_text: Came here our half year of being together.   The environment was very elegant and slightly romantic. The waiters were very well dressed, well mannered and respectable.   We ordered the clam chowder in the bread bowl. It was excellent; very rich and creamy.   We also ordered the fried calamari. It wasn't anything extraordinary but it did taste good. A lot of the calamari tangled together.   Overall, each dish is about 16-25$ except for the clam chowder, which was 10 with the bread bowl.   At the end you get a 30% coupon for the coffee shop nearby.

hRD1uMCRXkpDSbr5xC3R8g.review_text: My husband and I had a good time here. Yes, it's in a super touristy location and has that grande, corporate feel to it. It didn't bother us too bad though.  We tried: -Clam Chowder -Whole Garlic Crab -Fish & Chips  The clam chowder wasn't to my taste - it was incredibly thick and lacking flavor. The garlic crab was great - sweet crab cooked perfectly. The side of corn on the cob was horribly overcooked though. The fish & chips were good, with a light crispy batter and moist fish. However, the fries that it came with were bleh.  The best part was our server. I don't know his name, but he was the BEST. He was on top of it and very friendly. I can't say he reflects the rest of the staff, as a table near us wasn't greeted for several minutes and had to notify the hostess.  All in all, we probably wouldn't return, as touristy areas aren't really our thing. However, I'd recommend this to others who plan to be in that area and are in the mood for crab.

-c9Z5MQHWIc5YsWIHE8d2g.review_text: Excellent place to enjoy Pier 39! Great food (pricy) but very worthy! Try their blue cheese bread and their clam chowder! Enjoy it!

ZNKbBH45FnFF-9aNbGmKHg.review_text: Great location on Pier 39. Had the platter for two. Was good, came with crab, mussels, clams, shrimp and corn. Tasty buttery garlic sauce. The Caesar salad was really good. Dinner comes with hot baked sour dough bread. Platter was just perfect for two. Desserts all looked delicious, had the Apple Crisp. Yum! Comes with a scoop of vanilla bean ice cream.  Atmosphere was nice, had a table over looking the water. Prices are decent. So good ate here twice on one trip!!

OKKfEypDO-42cBQaddaeQQ.review_text: Even though its centered in one of the most touristy areas in sf, Fog Harbor was an awesome standout seafood restaurant. Although the exterior isn't much to look at, once you go upstairs and even to the waiting area, it's a really nice fine dining experience.   A few friends and I were really in the mood for oysters at around 11am and found fog harbor through yelp.
