The view from the inside is amazing as you can look out across the pier and see all the boats and tourists wandering about.   My gf and I shared a dozen oysters ($25), a clam chowder bread bowl ($10) and a Dungeness crab roll ($19). I just had to order a crab dish as they just started their crab season just the day before.    The oysters were freshly shucked (they shrunk as I added lemon juice) and very sweet, definitely did not disappoint. The clam chowder was very creamy and had lots of clams, although a bit lacking in the amount of actual chowder but its a novelty item so I didn't mind. The crab roll was overflowing with their crab mixture which had good amounts of crab that you could taste in a nicely toasted butter roll.   At the end of our meal, our server notified us that they were doing a promotion in which you rate your experience on your smartphone on their website and you get a complimentary dessert!! And they aren't the skimpy "one ice cream scoop" desserts. Actual full fledged desserts like a 5" Creme brûlée, huge slices of tiramisu, bread pudding. We got the cranberry and apple crumb cake with vanilla bean ice cream. A great way to finish off the meal.   Our meal for the two of us came to about $75 because we were also ordering a few beers. I would definitely come back here again. Service and quality of food was spot on.

0Nb_pTU9o-taKP8EBeWGwA.review_text: Great seafood restaurant! The calamari was excellent. Perfectly seasoned! Had the cod with veggies and rice....delicious! Didn't have a reservation but didn't have to wait long for a table. Beautiful view of the bay! Great end to a great day in San Fran!

FZgzMFY50CME1vPvfy_qGg.review_text: Good view, very thick clam chowder but i liked it. Should try the Ahi tuna with avacado and mango for a starter! Nice in general!

DTJC_VEeLh8wg-JC3FSuOw.review_text: Went to this restaurant based on Yelp reviews, the menu and the proximity to our hotel. I never would have expected such poor service from a restaurant like this, especially one in a prime tourist location. A little background, we had reservations for Sunday at 4:00 PM. Here's a summary of our experience here after being seated:  -No one acknowledged us, no one as in any other waitstaff -Another server had to take our order 10 min after being seated. He tells us out waiter didn't know he had the section we were in. -Our waiter served a table that was seated after us and still don't stop by our table which was four feet directly across from their table -We didn't get water after 20 minutes and that's after asking multiple times  -Our waiter didn't acknowledge us for over 15 min, didn't say hello or apologize for the wait -We had to ask for bread -It took 50 min to get our food -We had to flag down our waiter to get boxes and the check -The general manager didn't even ask how everything was even though it was obvious we weren't happy and were looking all over the place for our waiter throughout our entire time there  I cannot stress how bad this dining experience was. How could a tourist restaurant be so poor in customer service? It should be the exact opposite in my opinion. I will not be returning here and will tell others to not go here. The food was mediocre. We ordered the blue cheese garlic bread, clam chowder bowl, crab roll, and the mixed grill. Nothing memorable besides the food was rather bland especially the mixed grill plate. Don't waste your time and money going here. The view of the water and Alcatraz isn't worth it, trust me, the ambiance isn't worth it. If anyone from this restaurant is reading this (which I highly doubt), I'd recommend on training your staff better, especially your general manager working on August 11, 2013.

7Q4xvpbjLa_s7P802HtEJg.review_text: My boyfriend and I visited for our anniversary dinner. Around 9pm on a Saturday night, we ended up waiting a little under 30 minutes for a table. Service was great; from the hostess to our server. On to the most important part and the reason why you're reading this review... The food:   - Oysters: Fresh. Fresh. Fresh. I am not the biggest fan of oysters, but I had to try them. They are the cleanest oysters I've ever tasted. I could've eaten half a dozen by myself.  - Ahi Tuna Poke: Decent size chunks with avocado and I believe it was mango as well? The Sriracha drizzled around the plate adds a kick of spice if that's what you're looking for. Down side to this plate was that there was only 3 wonton chips to share!   - Clam Chowder: You can't come to SF and not have a bowl of clam chowder. You won't regret it! So rich and creamy, you can actually tell that there are clams in there! (Also had clam chowder from Nick's Lighthouse... Fog Harbor blows them out of the water)   - Garlic Roasted Dungeness Crab: YUMMY. So glad we went with this over the steamed dungeness. It had so much more flavor to it and was way more juicy than we expected, which is a definitely plus. (Tip: Dip the corn into the garlic/butter... Also, if you prefer mashed potatoes to the fingerling potatoes, just ask your server to substitute it for you)  Overall, we had a great experience. We also ordered 2 drinks from the bar to go with our meal which brought our grand total to ~$108 (excluding tip). Will definitely be back again!

hAU72qKgpuev6md8_6SngQ.review_text: Hubby and I stumbled upon this place.  We opted for H.H and ended up sitting in the bar area.   Our bartender/server whipped up a mojito for me despite the fact that they don't offer mojitos during H.H which is understandable- I mean who wants to muddle all of that mint during a busy H.H.   Service was impeccable- everything was just on point.   Food was so delishhhhh esp the a la cart Salmon sliders, I could've ate 6 no lie!!   Crab Louis was ENORMOUS!!  We both shared it and couldn't finish it.   The view wasn't breathtaking but still nice.   What I really loved about this place the most was the non-touristy vibe it had and may I mention I spotted Barry Sloan from the ABC Show REVENGE sitting right across from us but I was too much of a chicken to say hi as he was with his family.   All in all we had a great experience and can't wait to come back!

MBvB4l4N39_emF5KmC9Gpw.review_text: I had the best sliders ever for an appetizer and had the perfect meal of a clam chowder bread bowl and chicken Cesar salad all of which was DELICIOUS! My only complaint is that the lettuce of the salad was not cut at all, pretty presentation but, left me cutting lettuce like I would cut a steak...

gBxIhdBw-NLcjV3XNUTxUw.review_text: If you are at the pier, this is the best restaurant there and it also is one of the ones that will validate parking in the nearby garage.  The clam chowder and crab is excellent, everything else like fish and chips is just average, but not bad.

-8EnCioUmDygAbsYZmTeRQ.review_text: For a San Francisco dining landmark at PIER 39, I'd expected better, but the food wasn't great, the restaurant is beautiful, the views were spectacular from our booth, amazing views of San Francisco Bay and the Golden Gate Bridge! We passed by this place, thought the decor was nice enough to eat here... The crab house next door didn't look nice to us...  Had a spicy Bloody Mary ($10) at the bar while waiting for our able, it was sooo spicy, but a good one! Bartenders were very strict at carding me! They insisted to see my ID first before making me a drink! ( Hubby had my ID at the moment & he went to restroom) Responsible! That's a good thing. :)   Got a nice booth facing the waterfront views, a dozen of raw oysters ($2.5 each) to start, the oysters were fresh, but the sauce wasn't so great to go with those. The complimentary bread was delicious.   I had whole Dungeness crab ($39), 2 lb crab steamed, served with mashed potatoes and sautéed veggies: the crab was not meaty, very plain, flavorless, I had to dip all the crab meat in Tabasco to finish it.   Hubby had Linguini & Clams ($18), fresh clams, garlic, olive oil, tomatoes: he didn't like it too much, flavorless  Had one more Bloody Mary and a Stella on draft, didn't like the food. We have had wayyyy much better seafood in LA, disappointed, the service was good, the views made up a little bit, but still not impressed. :( Let's try some other places next time.....

W7Kz2IfXL6aVsFXnFWSwrg.review_text: We wanted to have some lovely seafood while we were in San Francisco, and we chose the Fog Harbor Fish House from the many options on Fisherman's Wharf. Overall, very high marks. First, the view is lovely, and the restaurant itself is very nice and well-appointed. A nice place for a relaxed lunch, date night or a special occasion. Second, the food: -I ordered the ginger coconut cocktail, which was generally very good and tasty, but I felt had a bit too much coconut. It was kind of offputting in mouthfeel but did have a delightful ginger/lemon/spritzer type of flavor. I was torn between loving it and hating it and in the end only drank about half. -The chowder. Oh my god, get some.Some of the best chowder you will ever have. Thick, creamy, silky, delicious. Think cup, but go bowl. You're welcome. -Poke. I do love tuna, so poke is a tough thing to ignore on a menu that isn't in Hawaii. This particular poke is mixed with fresh avocado and mango, with a small amount of seaweed like you'd find in a seaweed salad. Light, gingery, soy-ey (??) and really yum. -Salmon. I got the salmon entree, which was just delicious. Cooked perfectly, with a med-rare center and beautiful grill marks on the outside, set over a creamy sauce with spinach and potatoes. A beautiful piece of fish and a huge portion! -Tuna -- perfectly cooked again with a nice big rare center. Served over a great hash-like mix that included these delightful bits of bok choy. SUPER yum.  In all the food was really excellent. We didn't have time for dessert. Our server was good, helpful and composed. Not cheap -- we had two apps, two entrees and two drinks and the tab topped $100 for LUNCH. Still.... We would definitely come back!

qTUJzyNeORGlT_I7zUwqEQ.review_text: My family and I went here for dinner and had a great time.  The view overlooking the bay is gorgeous and all of the drinks were wonderful. Their Lombardi Lemonade is so addictive. We started off with the blue cheese garlic bread and steamed clams.  We found that the clams were a little bit bigger here than anywhere else we had been to so that was a plus. I ordered the half shellfish platter, when it got to our table I completely devoured it.  A generous serving of crab, mussels, shrimp, and steamed clams hit the spot. The atmosphere is very nice and the waitstaff are friendly. Definitely worth a try!

B-PKqWdTolVFksd0Lgk1JQ.review_text: I had the best birthday dinner with my husband a couple weeks ago at Fog Harbor. We were on a trip to celebrate our anniversary, my birthday, and our "babymoon" as I am 7 months pregnant. We chose the restaurant randomly as we were walking through Fisherman's Wharf and I am so glad we did! Our server Shawna was absolutely amazing. She was happy and funny and very knowledgeable about the food and wine menu. She took such good care of us and made sure I had a fabulous birthday! Our table was right by the window overlooking the wharf. We had the calamari, halibut, crab louis salad, and a complimentary Ghirardelli chocolate cake that was to die for! We will definitely return to Fog Harbor for dinner the next time we are in San Francisco. Thanks for a great experience!!

HzX0WGVJVqzT0E8Givft7A.review_text: Came here on Valentines Day with my hunny. The service was great, our waiter was very helpful & the wine she recommended was pretty good.   For our appetizer we had crispy lemon calamari which was the best calamari I've had. We also tried the clam chowder and the reviewers were right. The best clam chowder I have ever had.  Entrée: I got the special that was not on the menu. It was a half lobster stuff with crab & shrimp with garlic mashed potatoes. It was delicious. My hunny got Mixed Grilled Salmon, Swordfish and Shrimp, citrus buerre blanc, sauteed vegetables, wild rice or garlic mashed potatoes. He said it lacked flavor but our waiter brought 2 sauces over & he really liked it. Overall it was delicious & service was awesome.  Will definitely be coming back.

W7tKBCQ1XugMEDjB8ZBXqg.review_text: Much better location and atmosphere than the other seafood places on Fisherman's Wharf (i.e. Alioto's and Fisherman's Grotto). This place is much more updated and SO much more crowded! But seriously, the atmosphere is what sets this place apart. The menus at all these places are comparable. I had the fried shrimp and was happy with it. The fresh sourdough is reaaalllllly good!  (Bill for my shrimp meal, my bf's fish and chips, a salad, two beers, and a sprite came to $68. Pricey, but that's a lot of stuff)

91b3eFKZ628pHxELnzYnRA.review_text: Clams in the chowder (one or two in every spoonful) were meaty and not chewy. The blue cheese garlic bread was nice. Heavy, but great. I thought the tanginess of both the cheese and sourdough would be too much but they were a nice combo. Since we had bread for an app, I just got the soup in a bowl. We also shared 1/2 a crab, which was my least fave item. Crab is so much work and this crab wasn't sweet or moist enough.  Lastly, the oysters were great! Cold, fresh, and big!

RZZ_ZHuAHvCg41-UG_icRg.review_text: Delicious! I had the tuna poke, which is a must try. Perfectly marinated and seasoned, it's a great dish all around. The tuna was fresh and full of flavor, and the wasabi mayo was a perfect garnish. For the entree I had the lobster ravioli special with tarragon, butternut squash, and sun dried tomato. It was creamy, but not too heavy, and the tarragon balanced the dish really well. My lunch-mate had the clam chowder and ciopinno. Both were great. Get the crab out of the shell for extra convenience--it's worth the money!

OQHGlNKQdcp4noK5NrvyMg.review_text: Excellent food, great service. Bit pricey and crowded, but all in all a great experience

VEp_VFuXdwv3zWJw1RLacw.review_text: Looking at all the reviews, I think I had way too much expectations for this place. Went for a dinner (2 people) fairly late to not catch the tourist but service was so average and so slow for a late night. The free Yelp check in bread and blue cheese is very basic so take it but please stop raving about it. Then we tried the baked oysters which were really good, and I know my oysters. Following other reviews we tried the lobster mac n cheese which was way to average for the upscale dish that this represents. We also try the cioppino but not good.   My overall take is that if you want seafood in a decent place on the Wharf then this place is overrated.

adKonsQWY64vJYglPotH5Q.review_text: I don't normally enjoy touristy restaurants because of the crowd, but going to Fog Harbor is definitely a cuisine experience I would recommend to any local or tourist. The view is gorgeous, the service is beyond excellent, and the food is heavenly. Shout out to our waiter Jonathan!  I ordered a cup of clam chowder ($6) because I didn't want that to be my main entree, and it's cool that they offer options to have clam chowder in a cup, regular bowl, or bread bowl. Personally I think this is the best clam chowder I have ever tasted in SF, and I have had a LOT of clam chowder in SF.   I also ordered the linguine with clams ($18) which has garlic, olive oil, and tomatoes. This might actually become a regular item for me, if I didn't want to try everything else on the menu at some point. It's fresh, creamy, and very filling.   Even their bread comes straight from the oven, hot on our table. Their selection of cocktails is worth taking a look at as well. I'm just in love with every aspect of Fog Harbor. Make sure to call and reserve a table ahead of time to avoid a long wait!

exTHuOFaWck-gHqEeMahpA.review_text: Absolutely loved the clam chowder and my garlic roasted dungeoness crab. It was so good. Our wait was long but it was Christmas Day and they had these really comfortable shairs and sofas set up like a family room that made the wait actually pleasant. We had such a good time.

I_jqi8s4MySkNAnXWEU1ug.review_text: For good seating with a view, MAKE A RESERVATION ahead of time!   Food: the mediocre-est, whatevs.  Clams appeteaser: so-so, nothing special.  Service: was great, prompt, even though they were quite busy.  They had me at the warm sourdough bread basket, which doesn't say much for the restaurant at all.   Oh! And if you're annoyed by tourists, do go elsewhere.

-0u3FtuSiJGzLicKlw-zsg.review_text: Went in to just have a glass of wine and I asked for a Chardonnay that was on more of oak side and I was recommended the "Annabella" which I had never heard of! Being a San Francisco Native I felt I was being taken advantage of by them short pouring my wine and charging $9.50!!  It was a literal quarter size glass full!  Then another bartender says "Oh did you want the 5 ounce or the 8oz glass of wine"!? Well, if there was a choice should the brain dead over bleached bartendress that helped me in the first place have told me that??   Never going back as a Native or a Tourist!!!!

LR9lb4Qk3Q2s85e5Fsw8sQ.review_text: This was my first meal in San Francisco and I was pleased with my choice.  Touristy?  Yes.  Still worth it.  I started with a drink from the bar.  A rarity for me.  My drink has a cucumber basil infusion and tasted fresh.  We went straight to the meal... No appetizer for us.  We traveled all day and were hungry.  I had the garlic roasted whole dugeness crab.  The garlic and olive oil bath was similar to al mojo de ajo, except some of the garlic was caramelized.  This is a garlic lover's dream and I enjoyed every bite.  The plate also has fingerling potatoes and corn on the cob-- all fresh.  I sopped my potatoes and the table's sourdough bread in the garlic bath, too.  This is a messy meal, so not something for something for a first date or someone in a hurry.  The service was attentive.  Our drinks were continually refreshed and our bowls for the crab shells continually replaced.  There is a children's menu and crayons and paper table cloth to color on, too.  This occupied my children through our time consuming meal.  My 11 year old wanted fish and chips and thought the children's menu would not be enough.  This is the only area where I would have liked more server guidance. The adult portion was huge.    I tried my daughter's fish n'chips. The batter was light and flaky, and had good flavor.  The price was perhaps a little higher, but I cannot say it is out of line for the area.  My crab was $39, my daughter's fish and chips was $17.  My drink was pricey-- around $10.  Last, the view was pleasing and the restaurant is designed for most seats to have a view.

uzuAMu2B9PFhNlHfm69hLg.review_text: Their food is delicious! My husband and I went while on our honeymoon and absolutely loved it. The food was great, our waiter was delightful, and the ambiance was perfect. The only thing I would change is the time we waited. But overall the wait was worth it!

lTom1MhX38nCrYaCsvMrkg.review_text: You can do a lot worse in a touristy area. Very tasty. Great service. Highlights: crab cakes, cioppino, crab Louie salad, good burgers. We had a party of 12 and had excellent service. I'd reco in the area.

EFE39kqoeODPZhOVzSRVVQ.review_text: Super friendly staff, small but varied menu, and everything was really tasty. I got the garlic half crab and it was drenched in olive oil; super delicious, but trying to crack it and get the meat out was certainly a challenge with slippery hands.  We went at a fairly busy time and were seated right away, and our food came fairly quickly, as well!

P0i4-c8SBYBvCnpX-XA-kg.review_text: Just ate here yesterday for the first time, I loved it. I have to confess that we decided to eat here because our parking garage said they validated parking, so we got 2 hours free :). We just wanted a good bowl of clam chowder, in a bread bowl, of course. We got right in, and got a window table, and the view was amazing! The server (I think she said her name was Clementine, maybe?) was there promptly to take our drink orders and had our iced teas and water out in a flash. We ordered 4 clam chowder bread bowls ($10 each, not bad for a nice restaurant on the wharf) and we had those in less than five minutes, so so so so so yummy! It was the best clam chowder any of us have ever had, (we've tried a lot of clam chowder). We will definitely be back and recommend this restaurant to others!! All in all, great view of the wharf, great service, awesome atmosphere and DELICIOUS food!

mmaE7ZZxYiite10QSvWEOA.review_text: Going to school in rural Pennsylvania made me crave for some good, comforting SF clam chowder. I've gone to the Pier Market for chowder in the past, but thought I'd try this place. I was happily satisfied.  Clam chowder - very good and full of tender bits of clam. It's not life changing or the best ever, but well worth the price.  Steamed mussels in the curry/tomato/white wine sauce - savory, cooked perfectly and absolutely flavorful. Dipped my bread in that sauce too.  Crab cakes - light and fluffy.  Complimentary sour dough- warm, fresh, chewy, delicious!  Venue- gorgeous view of the pier/sea/boats. Clean interior. Nice and cozy ambience.  Bill was ~$50 for two people.  Helpful Tidbits:  1. Recommend making early reservations if you want to see the sunset! 2. Free sour dough so why order a bread bowl of chowder?  3. A bowl of chowder with bread is pretty filling. We felt really full after finishing 2 other appetizers. Glad we didn't order more. 3. They will validate 2 free hours at the parking lot at dinner time.

vSgLX23Zl5sGljme077b3A.review_text: Rating 5: It was a great experience and food was delicious!  I'd go here again for a special occasion.   I made a reservation for Sunday lunch and made a request for a table with a good view, since it was for a special occasion: my dad's birthday.  Upon being seated, I looked around and realized that they really did save one of the best seats in the house even though the rest of the area was full, plus, they wrote happy birthday on our paper table cloth, and of course they offered me to pick any of the desserts on their menu for my dad!  I was very pleased!   Food: My family ordered the lobster mac n cheese, the cioppino, and the clam linguine.  There was also perfectly fresh and warm sourdough bread.  The lobster mac n' cheese had a fair amount of large chunks of lobster, so I was pretty happy.  My mother was very happy about the cioppino; it had a nice range and variety of clam, mussel, fish, and some crab legs, plus, she reported everything was very fresh. Plus the soup was delicious. My dad is a quiet man so I didn't hear much about the linguine, but it looked great. Overall, everything was very good. The dessert we got for my dad was the apple crumb pie + ice cream on top, which was great!   Price: Fair for the freshness of the seafood and the occasion.   Service / Experience: As written above, everything was perfect.  Our waitress was always nearby, brought everything as requested, and was very pleasant.  The view is of the bay, Marina, and Alcatraz.   Extra: They will validate your Pier 39 parking for 1 hour for lunch, 2 hours for dinner.   Thanks Fog Harbor Fish House, I'm very happy I brought my dad here!

vSzkOeEvATax2ODfJz3EdQ.review_text: A friend was visiting from India so wanted to show off with the food available in SF. I had an option of Boudine or this place, and i selected FHFH because I had never visited here before and thought, well, two birds with one store. We started off with drinks: Alcatraz Escape and the Blueberry Ginger beer drink (don't remember the name). AE was OK, I liked my blueberry ginger beer concoction. We then moved to the starters: Blue cheese garlic bread, Fried Scallops, Crab Cake & fries. Special shout out to the fries! Just the right amount of crunch and softness that I like in my fries. CRAB CAKE was the bomb, LOVED IT! Blue cheese garlic bread was tasty. The fried scallops did not do anything for us and we left that plate almost untouched. The dips we got with each of the dishes was awesome! Unfortunately, after the above dishes we felt stuffed and did not actually try the sea food platters/ entrees that we set out to originally have. Well, then again, there is always a next time!

jWtsx9S2IrgqII6yn-iWpw.review_text: First time visited was 10 years ago on our honeymoon trip to portland.  Nothing seems to have changed since then.  Nice clean restaurant with good food and people.  But it can get pricey when you have large group of people with you.

BskjkKH4d1_1nsXizJ_cKw.review_text: Yes, 4 star is for Fog Harbor. I went with my Fiance to have dinner a few days ago. We went on a little mini adventure for food. Our frist time at the Fog Harbor. THE CUSTOMER SERVICE WAS EXCELLENT!  although the food was not as great, i come for a good experince of customer service and i got that from the bar and NELSON was our server. awesome server! I got a fish and chips with fries and it was not what i expected. Ive had BETTER fish n' chips. my partner got herself a bowl of clam chowder and baked oysters. She liked the Oysters, since she wanted to try something out of the ordinary. she said baked oysters was OK.   Her Clam Chowder on the other hand, she took 2 bites and she was done! she said the clam chowder tasted like its been sitting out to get it to our table. Basically she said the chowder was not what she expected. she was expecting something delish since we are at the Harbor and they are known for their chowder.   Overall, i will probably give this place another chance for a 2nd come back. MAYBE their other entrees are better.

oOEv1P4X6oNNhQakqQtndQ.review_text: I have tried the seafood in several restaurants at Fisherman's Wharf in San Francisco and this is the best so far! I had the baked scallops appetizer and the mixed grill seafood dish, plus I sneaked a taste of my friend's clam chowder. The food is amazing! The staff was very pleasant and our waiter was exceptionally friendly and attentive. I highly recommend Fog Harbor Fish House in San Francisco!

VnMAmbek5X2Ghel-JWN23A.review_text: The location of the restaurant and the views over the Bay greatly help the rating for Fog Harbor Fish House. We made reservations for two on a Friday night and were seated within minutes of arriving--make sure to request for a table with a window view as the view is breathtaking.   As for the menus, both the food and wine lists were extensive with multiple options and lots of specials. The sourdough bread that they serve is absolutely delicious and probably one of the best breads that I have tasted. We had the Steamed Clams as our appetizer and that was definitely the best dish of the night--most likely because of the amazing chorizo butter sauce. For our main courses, we had Swordfish and the Lobster Mac 'n Cheese. Although both were good, they were not anything special which was very disappointing (especially considering the price).  In the end, I would recommend this restaurant simply for its location and views but I don't think I would go back again for the food other than appetizers.

qQ_rDvogQyXSMEe41maQ6A.review_text: We sat at the bar for a quick lunch on a busy day at the pier.  The bartender was awesome!  Super friendly and fast.  My son had the salmon, and it was delicious.  He won't eat fish if it's not super fresh.  I had a whole dungeoness crab, and hubby had fish and chips.  Delish! Hard to stomach the price when you aren't used to SF prices, but worth it when you want good seafood.  Great views too!

66JCCGQBbVvo33FMaabLpQ.review_text: We came to this place largely on the reviews and it did not disappoint.  We came at 2:30 pm.  Still a very busy time but no wait.  Every seat has a terrific view of the harbor and GG Bridge.  All the staff were wonderful, especially our server, Ashley.    All of our meals were top notch.  The clam chowder was superb.  It had just the right amount of creaminess to it.  The blue cheese garlic bread was original and an excellent side to wet the appetite.  The seafood penne did not disappoint.  And if you are thinking of getting the dungeness crab, spend the extra $2 to get the garlic roasted whole dungeness crab.  To die for!!!  And if you are looking for a healthier alternative, the dungeness crab mango cerviche salad was just as delicious.

Nun2tsAdXkcOLXBM4PG9XA.review_text: Lunch cost $85 and included a somewhat controversial "Sf Emp Ord 4%" tax that I did not notice until after I got home. Google the quote for more information like I had to since I am from the east coast. Then we paid tax on the food bill subtotal + Sf Emp Ord 4% for a total bill of $93(rounded). Fog Harbor bill includes a suggested gratuity amounts. The suggested gratuity excludes this controversial tax, as it should. It does not feel right also for a tax to include this Sf Emp Ord 4% either (taxing a tax); a double tax situation.   Controversy aside, the food is very good-unequivocally. The Wedge Blue Cheese Salad with bacon was perfect with the sourdough bread. We had the fried combo(calamari, fish, & shrimp), 2 orders. I prefer the squiggly ends of the calamari. My companion likes only the rounded pieces. We traded and ate the pieces each of us like since each plate had some of both. Forgo drinks, if you want to be frugal. Our food came to $52, not bad considering this is SF, Fisherman's Wharf & on the pier. The view is tax worthy. The ambiance of Fog Harbor & the pier area in tax worthy. So freak, perhaps taxing patrons directly for employees health insurance is okay too, just as long as the employees get all the money and none of it magically improves Fog Harbors bottom line.  The folks making all the wonderful food appear deserve health insurance. That is not a controversy for me.   We were seated at a window table for 2 looking at Pier 42 from Pier 39.

1-rTuP6bBdOyXI3gXIjvEg.review_text: I ordered the ahi tuna and it was absolutely delicious. Our server was nice and the view of the pier was beautiful. However, one of the waiters there was a bit rude when I asked her questions. For example, we asked her for two straws and she turned around, didn't say anything, came back with our straws and left without a word...even though I said thank you. Other than that, the restaurant serves good food, along with beautiful scenery.

eBH9-CdtLcOQ6Znp7VQVJQ.review_text: Came here to eat a crab. Pretty big legs, lots of good meat, fresh as can be. I got steamed veggies, and a salad. The service as a tad bit slow, not the warmest, but I was content.  Pretty pricey.

7gNtYzygF7dB8e7k1mWdjA.review_text: On the No1DP's last visit to see me, he made a request: he wanted to try SF's clam chowder. What the No1DP asks he gets, I just happen to be the lucky woman to tag along. I had another restaurant in mind that was a little less touristy but after some research and consideration we ended up eating here instead.  VENUE: We went on a Sunday night, just as the sun was about to set. The host put us in a table right next to the window. The No1DP and I were able to watch the people walking around Pier 39 and people just getting off the ferries. While the No1DP and I weren't able to secure a window that overlooked Fisherman's Wharf we weren't too far from those windows and we could look at the massive amount of tourists walking the wharf.   SERVICE: Service was excellent, as expected from a fine seafood establishment.   WINE: Both of us had white wines. Although I don't remember specifics on the grape varietal, I remember my wine was a little sweet and went well with my dish.  FOOD The Yelp check-in gets you blue cheese garlic bread. The blue cheese was a bit strong, but it's good for anyone that really likes blue cheese.  We got bowls of their famous clam chowder. One of the better clam chowders I've tasted, and the No1DP agrees. It may look watery when you're served the bowl but don't let that fool you. Instead we were treated to a quite creamy (and not starchy!) soup with good amounts of CLAM. They were quite generous with the clam but they better be considering how much you pay for a bowl!  No1DP got one of their special dishes lobster mac and cheese. As a New Englander, he has a right to be picky about his seafood, especially his lobster. His dish was "quite comparable to an equivalent dish I'd be served back home". Lucky him. I tried it and it's quite the rich dish - the cheese is RICH and one big bite can make you significantly fuller than before... No1DP ate less than half of his dish. The lobster was to his liking.  I got another special dish: 0.5 lbs lobster stuffed with dungeness crab. I thought this would be an excellent dish as this would combine two of my great seafood loves - lobster and dungeness crab. When I was served this dish the tail part was the lobster while the head was stuffed with the crab. The crab was quite sweet, I'm not sure if this is supposed to be how the crab naturally tastes, but the sweetness took away from the crab. Lobster was excellent, soft and buttery yet I could taste the lobster. Spinach and mashed potatoes were good sides yet were not too rich to overpower the seafood.   Dessert consisted of creme brûlée. The sugar was hard enough that I can crack it open with one swift tap of the spoon. Custard was creamy yet not too rich. The speculoos cookie they put on top was a nice touch and gave the dessert a subtle ginger taste if you eat it.   Though Fog Harbor can be considered a touristy restaurant to some, the food was still excellent. Thanks to the No1DP for another excellent eating adventure!

KA-2FWXthIgcd6iJDIs7AQ.review_text: Fog Harbor is just average. Was excited to finally eat here after reading all of the rave reviews, and chose it over "Fog City" on my most recent trip to San Francisco. I started with a bowl of their award winning clam chowder, which I must say was excellent. From there, though, the meal was downhill. Our server was not very happy at all, and it was took about 25 minutes before we ordered our food. We both got fish & chips, which we agreed was very plain. The restaurant itself is very nice and it has great views, I just wish the food was a little better.

rt3pQ-DH_Tq_AwDFuI2usQ.review_text: Clam Chowder was deeelicious as well as the oysters!! Definitely going back when i visit S.F.

k4NFubHKPXLLiZtc4ndpmQ.review_text: Great place at pier 39. The ambience is great with an excellent view towards the harbor. Seafood cioppino was delicious, husband had fish and chips and no complaints. I definitely recommend this place! Our waiter was very attentive, only complaint was the klan of kids next to us that wouldn't be quiet!

IY5ePfJJ_PSDiZ9-yo8seA.review_text: I reserved a table for 2 for my boyfriend's birthday and we came a little earlier than our reservation, so the hostess seated us at the waiting area for a bit. I actually got a bit grumpy while waiting since they let other people in, turns out they were prepping our table! They wrote happy birthday and birthday wishes all over the paper covering, which was a really pleasant surprise!  We had a rum and coke, lollipop drop(?), crab roll, lobster Mac and cheese, and baked oysters. We also got a free order of blue cheese garlic bread because I checked in.  The drinks were good, although a bit watered down. Garlic bread was yummy, and the oysters were super good and flavorful. Crab roll was also delicious, the bread was nicely toasted, although the sweet potato fries were kinda cold when it got to our table. The lobster mac and cheese was pretty epic...at one point I found myself saying "There's too much lobster in my Mac n cheese".   Service was excellent. They also threw in a lava cake for the birthday boy! Overall it made for a really pleasant dinner.  Btw I reserved through opentable(via the yelp app) and under special requests I asked about the birthday stuff, and they delivered nicely. 5 stars!

WDuJyy-qfDJouRRWkt88RQ.review_text: Best Calamari and Clam Chowder on the pier!!!  Lovely views and romantic restaurant for a perfect lunch or dinner date.  Definitely worth the trip for us to come out and enjoy.  I grew up just 3 blocks from Pier 39 and have such great memories here!!

X8nGV6Xm2lQBxR68K_Qdag.review_text: Fog Harbor = Best clam chowder soup i ever had!   Great service, great food and beautiful view. I will definitely come back!

UZ56rff2phhJ7L05Fzl3Dg.review_text: Very good service and great quality seafood. I had ordered the very famous shellfish platter and split it with my family. The food was excellent, it had a ocean of flavors. The service was excellent and the wait was kind and took a lot of time out of his job to talk with us, crack a couple of jokes, what everyone wants with a waiter. The sauces for all the dishes were exploding with flavor. My only grip with the restaurant is the kids meals were a lot less flavorful than all the other dishes, but they were still good.  Overall, this is a must go if you ever check out Pier 39. There are so many places you could check out in Pier 39 but this restaurant, when you order the right food, could be one of the best.

BK3F1OyAv_YPPRNii0A-Fw.review_text: AMAZING! My sister flew in today and I wanted to show her a good time.  We decided on Fog Harbor at Pier 39, and we're glad we did.    I had the Ahi Tuna and it was absolutely incredible.  My sister had the crab cake entree, and from the look of orgasm that came across her face as she ate, I would say she loved it.  The restaurant venue was very nice, with views of the GG bridge.  If the food and ambiance were not enough, the service was remarkable.  Oscar was our waiter and was very helpful, and Ryan, the manager, stopped by to check on us and make sure we were enjoying our experience.  I'll definitely be back! Thanks Fog Harbor!

GMY44WcTkOSIRR77SFsDCw.review_text: fisherman's wharf is a tourist trap.  I was skeptical of all those side walk hawkers promising the best food... yelp directed me to Fog Harbor and I owe you both a huge thank you!  it goes like this, the wife had to take an important work conference call, this area is crowded, she ducked into an alley.  the three kids and I found ourselves stuck on the sidewalk.  the kids started to melt down, one of my son's punched the other in the nuts , so he got hit back (as I explained, you hit somebody in the balls, you expect to get hit back, hard).   these kids needed to be out of the sun, and food in their bellies.    this place was nicer than I expected.  the staff was SUPER friendly to me and my three kids.  I caught glances at plates of food being eaten by other people and I saw what we needed, BLUE CHEESE GARLIC BREAD! ($8)  that and I got myself a beer, when in SF Anchor Steam it!  bread came quick, kids loved it and everybody quit crying and no more nad wahcking.  my daughter consumed an entire salmon BLT and loved it.  my oldest son loves soups, he had the chowder.  youngest son had the kids menu fish and chips.  HOLY FREAKIN CRAP that fish and chips was good and HUGE!  I've seen smaller portions from the regular (non-kids) menu at other fish houses.    after an hour in that alley, on a conference call. t he wife joined us and we enjoyed oysters!    we later agreed that Fog Harbor was one of the best (albeit nearly accidental) finds of the trip.  and a BIG thanks to the waitress that has SW themed tattoos behind her ears that matched my jacket, it was our destiny!

BG0jH_nUwn8-iR_s50VxSQ.review_text: I was in the area and i am not a tourist, but got hungry and i knew that every place here is a tourist trap. but walking around this place looked really nice, so we decided to give it a shot. we were pleasantly surprised.    Their clam chowder is amazing so make sure you try that out. everything i tired here has been good so i wont go into detail, just go here and try everything.   The complementary bread is out of this world.   In pier 39 area i think this is one of the best places to it. In an area that is full of bland tourist traps, this really stands out as a very flavorful dining experience.   Make sure you park your car in the pier 39 lot and you can get like 2 or 3 hours validated.

3kPOK-VhFmLWHhKlXromjg.review_text: I think ill pass.  After a girls day out in Napa's winery, my friends and i decided to make a trip to the city for the rest of the day.  Our initial choice for dinner, house of prime rib, had a two hour wait and we were all pretty famished. We decided to just play it safe at pier 39.  We were debating between dining here or crab house, and finally settled for this. I ordered the calamarie and bowl of clam chowder.  My girlfriends ordered the seafood penne, new york steak, and the seafood cioppino. We all took a sample bite of each other's orders. Their clam chowder was good, but not as "award winning" as id expected. Calamarie tasted mediocre.  I actually only ate about three pieces, they werent very appetizing for some reason. My friends steak was kind of dry, and the penne and cioppino just were too bland for my liking.   Overall, i probably wouldnt come back. Prices were fair for being in the heart of a tourist attraction, but i feel like i would be more satisfied elsewhere for the same price. Pass.

CFm6FNt_wfv1Quzv3XEPog.review_text: The food was great. We came at a very busy time so we had to wait about 30 minutes for a table. And we couldn't even get a table with a good view. When we sat down I saw a window table open up and I asked the waitress if we could simply move but she had to make a big deal about it and go talk to somebody else to see if it was okay to get up and move two tables. And wow can u believe she said no! That automatically dropped her tip by $10. Her loss. I wasn't very happy about that. Plus she felt super fake. The crab fritters were delicious so was the clam chowder and the shell fish platter, honestly I was not a big fan of the lobster mac and cheese it did not appeal to me at all. The service was okay the food was good. I'd probably go somewhere else before coming back there.

DYJkNduguM18W6cUMfxk7g.review_text: Saved myself from eating too much breakfast so I could have the Clam chowder here at the Fog Harbor.  Ordered just the bowl of chowder, $8.00 and  was served warm bread  with it.  It is very filling and absolutely the best chowder I have ever had.  Sat at the bar, and although I usually don't like to eat while sitting on a bar stool, I found the service at the bar was incredible.  I had 3 people waiting on me, and another just came by to see if I liked the chowder.  Great place.  Will do dinner next time.

G4R3wdn9X-mizJemLA47Rw.review_text: Of all the seafood restaurants aboard Pier 39 I decided to dine at the Fog Harbor Fish House.  This place had a great menu with some amazing dishes. The red curry mussels were a great appetizer to the swordfish dish which was very delicious; the fish was cooked perfectly and the roasted potatoes, squash, capers, and sautéed pesto sauce was a great addition to the dish and on a personal note the portions were generous.  Along with the meal came great service from the host Travis and waitress Catherine.  Catherine was very fond of the entire menu and was very welcoming, courteous and patient.  She offered some great service for us.  This is definitely a restaurant I will recommend to anyone heading out to SF looking for a great meal, not to mention an awesome view.  Thank You!

bAFzHp_ZZlg4wNCi42MmrA.review_text: Usually the item appeals to me .Simply it is every one of the great and also amazing beautification. I really like this kind of position significantly and also endorse for its 2nd floor dinner and also wine beverage. Not too big although really feel every one of the environment involving my own house and a touch of warm and friendly services on the employees.  Foods is usually mouthwatering in my experience and also My partner and i never ever could hang on ahead the following all over again.

acUNF4BuOyDQcfRFjLFQ-Q.review_text: If you want a nice sit-down meal at Pier 39, and a great view of Fisherman's Wharf, this is the place!  Only had one day to spend with cousins from Brazil and this is where we went, they liked it.  Love the fireplace and waiting area out front on a foggy cold Fisherman's Wharf day...

W2EHApKCRZSDbpxwJ7KaZw.review_text: Super small portions of their chowder in a bread bowl and the place was full up with an older crowd. At $10 a plate, I should get more than 3 spoonfuls. I was still hungry afterward. Come on.   It was tasty, but no where near "San Francisco's best" like they claim. The service was practically non-existent and we had to flag down our waiter for everything even though it wasn't very busy (maybe 5-6 other parties total?). Super disappointed and would urge you to go somewhere else.

AREZ5SxeASLK-kPM983mqQ.review_text: A great restaurant with a great view. The food was pretty yummy. Their mac n cheese was one of the best I've tried. Their calamari was spot on too except they used old oil that gave a slight bitter aftertaste. The linguini was pretty good, not the best though.

xi-ofEtyhWDL7QJ6gRI3-A.review_text: I am providing this review as a caution to other diners as my husband and I chose not to come here as we witnessed something very disturbing and quite disgusting. The open kitchen is a nice concept as it is usually great to see the chefs at their craft. At this restaurant,  we saw one of the cooks eat what appeared to be a baked potatoe as he continued to cook some other meal. This was not a "taste test." He had his fork still sitting on the platter filled with more baked potatoes. My husband gave feedback to the manager, who's response was "He shouldn't be doing that" That lackluster response is disappointing.  We will never eat here and other diners should beware!

dqflxF33RZhHAZyQi7NreQ.review_text: My dad was visiting from Florida having never been to California before in his life.  While I'm well aware that everything over at Pier 39/Fisherman's Wharf is a tourist trap, he was determined to eat there so I chose the Fog Harbor fish house.  To my surprise we actually had a really fantastic time.  I ordered calamari, he got the shrimp, and we sat at a really lavish table right by the window so he could see the whole bay.  The food was really good (although the portions could be larger given the price), and the drinks were even better.  Our waitress was very attentive, and he had the best time which is all I cared about.  We went on a Monday for lunch so the place wasn't that busy, so we might have had a different experience on say the weekend, but for the time we went, it was a great meal.

od9lQailMMWvHp6bBFhcQQ.review_text: Our waiter Kahim was the best!

Lij7BEvJu9Kd_K0NooPZHA.review_text: This is a great restaurant, especially for a big group (ask for the Alcatraz room) that needs / wants to unwind after a long day at a tradeshow or work in general.  Waiters are very attentive and also provide some entertainment!  Menu has a lot of San Francisco classics - clam chowder, Shrimp or Crab Louis, and tons of seafood - and they also have steaks.  I like the Pacific Sole or the Swordfish.  Crab cakes are awesome and can also be ordered as an entree.    If you want a nice view, you can request a table by the window, but this really only works if you have a small party (like 6 or less to get a booth that faces the window of a table right next to it).

Zz7wvkHp0mT8dSLgz_lgog.review_text: No bread or crackers included with chowder. Bread is .25 a slice. Bread bowl heavily pushed. No crackers available at all.  $7 a small bowl.  Good chowder though.

TN80OluTQXjOfk7ug71-1g.review_text: Back in Maryland, where the Chespeake churns and the Old Bay Seasoning flows, the crustacean of the day is the blue crab. Here in San Francisco, the crab of choice is the stout Dungeness, a veritable wrestler versus the comparatively dainty, ballerina-esque blueies we have back where I'm from. Having had my fair share of crab in my life, devoured mostly with mallet and mini fork in hand mind you, I was ready to give the Dungeness a try.  After a long day exploring Fisherman's Wharf, a nice plate of crab cakes, some fries, and slaw just felt right. The restaurant was quickly becoming crowded so I felt lucky that my two friends and I managed to snag a window table. Tired and hungry, we were all happy to be greeted by a basket of steaming hot San Francisco Sourdough and softened butter. I've always appreciated the tart bite and hearty crust of a good sourdough in sandwich service, so the pure unadulterated experience of quality bread led us off on a good start. Hey, it's the little things in life that count. Soon thereafter, our food came out. I was greeted by a surprisingly ordinary plate of two smallish pan fried crab cakes, fries, and slaw. Unfortunately, the "ordinary" aspect seemed to be a theme as I began to eat my dish.   Strike one was that the crab cakes were merely warm and didn't seem terribly fresh. Furthermore, while I was hoping for delicious lumps of sweet crab, I instead got a pretty bland interior which tasted more of filler than crab. Whether or not it was indeed filler and breadcrumb I was tasting or it was the way the strangely finely minced crab was prepared that threw my tastebuds off is up for debate, but it was disappointing. While crisp on the outside, the inside was mushy and pasty. Luckily or not, since they were small, I didn't really have much to go through before it was gone. A truly great crab cake should highlight the quality and flavour of the crustacean that honorably served in its preparation, not of bread and onion. The fries were also a disappointment. While they were hot, they were devoid of seasoning. Unsalted fries are a sin! Why why why would you ever serve unsalted fries? Finally, the slaw and remoulade were inoffensive, which is to say, pretty unmemorable.   Moving on to the service and space, I should first point out that getting to Fog Harbor can be a little tricky. You must access it from the upper balcony level of Pier 39. Once inside, you're greeted by a nice dining space. It's open, the servers are dressed professionally, and if you get a window seat, you will be greeted by a beautiful view of the bay. Service was also good. Our server was quick, friendly, and readily agreed to split our check.   So why the two stars? Well, while the service and space were very good overall, I was disappointed by the food. My dish was bland, uninspired, and got literally beat out by bread and butter. In addition, later that night, my stomach really did not agree with what I ate. Considering I ate toast for breakfast that day, I think my cakes are the guilty ones here. I hope that I maybe caught Fog Harbor on an off day since others seem to really like this place. Unfortunately for me, it just didn't hit the mark.

jLlcNjDKwWQaYCrl2webMw.review_text: Great food! Great atmosphere! Had the mixed grill and it was amazing. Service from our server wasn't all there but overall I would recommend this place.

IveMgM8uG0qflyfWCyu2IQ.review_text: This is the place to be if you want to have a view of the harbor and sea lions. The food is excellent and service outstanding.  Even for being in a tourist area the servers treat you well. A must visit if you are visiting the Pier area.

mIIO4NxyCksoaONsit5hnA.review_text: Food is good, but a bit pricey. You can see out the window though to the water so there is a nice, relaxing view. Touristy.   I had the crab roll as recommended by the waiter-it did not disappoint...until I got the check-it came out to be $19 for a sandwich and fries. If i had paid attention to the price maybe that would have deterred me to choose something else. But it was good. I'll say that. And it's a hefty portion. I can't make that meal myself so worth it.

U50UvCcyr8YFsjrVAgjnzA.review_text: A touristy spot but definitely worth visiting! The view from Fisherman's wharf was beautiful and the food and cocktails were great. We loved the crab and seafood pasta. We went to celebrate a friends birthday and got a free dessert as well!

jVpKmCHCdKsPYhmFCkgzmw.review_text: Dungeness Crab & Mango Ceviche:  There was a good portion (about 1/2 cup) of crab mixed with mango.  It taste fresh and the lemon & mango complemented the crab nicely.  Fried combo:  The combo came with 1 fish, 2 shrimp, about a cup of calamari, fries and coleslaw.  Everything was fried crispy but not everything was seasoned properly.  The calamari was perfect and tasted great.  The fish was crispy on the outside, moist in the inside, and fresh but it lacked salt. Once I salted it, it was good.  Unfortunately the shrimp was bland and badly needed the cocktail sauce.  The coleslaw was bland and taste like just cabbage & mayo. It had no seasoning or vinegar and was very boring.  Hind sight, I would have ordered the fish & calamari but skip the shrimp.  My server Ashley G. was very nice and friendly.  She was offering suggestions to tourist visiting the area.  If in the area, I would eat here again.

nlcaC4xoSEzVaLWXNi5ggg.review_text: Great food and an awesome view...the mixed grill was wonderful! The only reason I didn't give a five star review was because our waitress was like a sad emo girl who hated life and her job... Other than that, it was great!!!

jjpRf68hqmFWhHNdKked9A.review_text: I visited the bay this past weekend for my birthday and decided to book a reservation here for lunch on the pier. I came in expecting delicious fresh fish, and I left feeling a little disappointed.  Having a reservation definitely helped because it was quite crowded and we only had to wait a minute or two. Our server was friendly and checked in on us just enough - not too frequently, and not too little. We got a free Blue Cheese Garlic Bread from checking in on Yelp, and it was so delicious! (Thanks, Yelp!)   After a pretty long wait, even with consideration of how many people were there, we finally got our food. My boyfriend ordered the Ahi Tuna, and it was cooked basically perfectly. His mashed potatoes were also pretty good. I ordered the fresh salmon, since salmon is my absolute favorite thing to put into my stomach. It was not as large as my boyfriend's tuna. It was like a little strip, which I wouldn't have minded if it wasn't over-grilled and burnt. The moist parts tasted good, but for the most part, it was very dry. The smokiness of the greens under the fish were good on their own, but as a part of this dish, it made everything taste overcooked and burnt. I wish I had ordered something else instead.  All in all, it's pretty good, but I'm not sure if I would come back again. Especially since I'm not a baller (lol) and the salmon was not as tasty as I had hoped.

2jxxBNs1TA-p1R3SMEN90g.review_text: Convenient place to eat if you are at the Pier. Menu has a lot of variety, so the restaurant is great for groups!

EaQj-sWaliph2Uu5KBJf1Q.review_text: Checked in on yelp and got the free bleu cheese garlic bread.  Normally not a fan of blue cheese but it was definitely tasty.  Quick highlights of what we ordered:  Crab cakes Mixed (seafood) grill Clam Chowder and the fried seafood platter?  All in all, everything tasted excellent and was very fresh BUT the glaring issue with this place is the SERVICE! Understanding it was a saturday evening in tourist central (Pier 39), I kept my patience but when the table behind us that got seated after we did got their entrees first, we had to complain to the waiter.  I know it's not his fault but in the words of the ESPN NFL countdown crew, COM'N MAN!!! At the beginning of the meal, our waiter, Khaiman, recommended we write a review after I showed him my Yelp check-in that earned the free garlic bread so things looked promising too.  The big save was that this place validated up to 2 hrs parking if you parked in the garage next to pier 39.    If you're looking for a full service restaurant in touristy Fisherman's wharf, then you could definitely do worse than FHFH but I wouldn't necessarily go out of my way to eat here.  I don't know the SF area that well but I'm sure there's plenty of great seafood restaurants in town.  In fact, I'll do a quick search on Yelp to prove it!

hSF13x9LL95rmASKmeQZ0Q.review_text: It's a tourist trap, but it's not too bad.  The food was decent, better than most tourist traps but not great considering the wonderful seafood available in San Francisco.  I ordered the seafood sampler plate. Both fish were overcooked slightly but the flavor was great. The clam chowder was very good, with lots of clams and not too many potatoes.   The best part of my experience was my server, Haiman. He was very nice, genuine, and helpful. He made the boiling hot dining room and stuffy, touristy atmosphere worthwhile. Without his service this place would be 2 stars.

FThLp5E46r-Jv3Bz-J2UcA.review_text: Definitely the best clam chowder I've ever had!   It's a great restaurant smack in the middle of the wharf. Great views, prices are reasonable and the service was fast and friendly.

4KpcFxWlqFkmOGCrMXEgVQ.review_text: One of the best seafood restaurants on Pier 39. Very reasonably priced. The oysters tasted like the ocean. My only pet peeve was that my table did not get any bread!! As we were leaving we realized everyone who hadn't started their meal yet were given complimentary bread! But not us!

Z_JQpx279FLIymcCnNk5JQ.review_text: This was kinda late but i had to leave a review. I came here with my boyfriend on forth of july to see the fireworks. We yelped this before we came to the pier and gave this place a try. I know they were busy and i didnt mind the wait for an 1 hour and a half. Luckily there was a lounge so my boyfriend and i were able to rest. When we were seated we thought we got the best seat because it was at the corner near the windows. We can see the fisherman wharf but on my right, people from outside can see us which was awkward. So the waiter was very sweet and was kind to take a picture of my boyfriend and I. Since I LOVE the picture so much, i had to give him a tip. So anyways, 1 star for the service. Food....however.... Was HORRIBLE. My boyfriend order the Surf and Turf, medium rare. Nope. It was well-cooked. Then he ask the waiter for a recommendation for a heavy wine. My boyfriend thought it was all right. Wasn't heavy for him, but everyone is different. So for my food. I order the Caesar salad (idk the full name but it's close to it). Maybe it was me, but I have never really experience not having my lettuce cut so i had to cut them myself. I asked for chicken too but they only gave me like 8 small pieces and 3 croutons.....I was upset. I had way better salad at other places. Other than that, if you love oysters, you gotta try the baked one. IT WAS DELICIOUS! +1 Star. If i knew it was that good, i would have ordered three instead of that salad -_- but nope. The osyter appetizer came after our dinner. But yeah i don't think i'll come back :l

-in2D0VQ0tApfmfK0I0RfQ.review_text: Hard to believe such a great restaurant in a touristy location. We came on a Monday around Christmas and the wait at lunch was 45 minutes!  The clam chowder was very good - lots of clams, not too many potatoes, nice bacon flavor.  The kids had the salmon - though small the filet was fresh and cooked correctly (i.e. not over-cooked). I had the crab roll - the restaurant didn't bother with a lot of fillers and they didn't skimp on the (dungeness) crab meat either. The wife ordered the crab salad - also very good: fresh ingredients, lots of crab, not too much dressing.  Service was efficient and friendly. We sat at a table with a fantastic view of Alcatraz.  Can't wait to come back to try some of their other dishes (cioppino, for example).

km85xKVg_nEx0CJT0uSMRw.review_text: This place has really good calamari and clam chowder sourdough bread bowl! And a nice view

w-eGoyyLHi1jlDglSolkMg.review_text: Love Fog Harbor!  Great food, great views.  The chocolate cake is to die for! The waitstaff is very helpful and friendly.  Miss Madison rocked today and we had a blast!  Thanks, be back soon!!!!

BXcHv4rl9WH3pHFN5M_oNg.review_text: Ordered the grilled tuna and it was delicious with just the right amount of sear to outside.  The sides were great with crisp vegetables and mashed potatoes were moist with right amount of creaminess.  My lady had the clam chowder which was rich and tasty. The seafood pasta was elegant and just had the right smooth sauce.  Definitely be coming back as this was our second time and won't be the last.

THpdwTb37PglZswyUW0orw.review_text: This was a great choice for our lunch.  The best dish was the crab topped clam chowder.  The soup was delicious and the crab was plentiful.  Even though served in a small cup, it was quite filling.  I did not particularly care for the crab cakes though others at the table enjoyed them.  The burger was average but then it's a seafood restaurant so we didn't expect any different.  I don't normally like sour dough bread, but it was very fresh and I enjoyed it very much.  Good service.  I would definitely return.

r8gJ47mAsvkIWeh_Yn65hg.review_text: Excellent seafood and great customer service! I ate the Pacific Sole fish and it was fantastic! One of the best dishes I've ever had!

eTidg3pTf9ZvxCgV15HLwQ.review_text: There are so many touristy (and mediocre)  restaurant choices near Fisherman's Wharf, so we were surprised to have enjoyed such a wonderful dinner at Fog Harbor. I really enjoyed the cioppino, which had a good variety of fish, crab, mussels, clams, shrimp and scallops. Others enjoyed the crab cakes and steak too. The view at sunset topped off the meal.

TmhFYYTHodJnrubq9IeFNA.review_text: Had a wonderful time here. We got an awesome table overlooking the bay, probably because we had reservations. Nice to watch the sunset while enjoying dinner.   The restaurant itself is very nice, loved the decor. It's on the 2nd floor of Pier 39, first restaurant as you enter from the front. Loved the fireplace outside as you wait on comfy sofas.   Food- we started out with the Crispy Bay Scallops.. yum! And Blue cheese garlic bread which I really liked. There was so much on the menu it was hard to decide LOL. I ended up ordering the Fried Combo (fish, calamari, shrimp, fries, cole slaw). Everything was delicious, and it's a big dish. My partner ordered the Cioppino, which was truly amazing. So good! I wish I had ordered it also. We ordered 2 cocktails each but maybe we're raging alcoholics because we thought they needed more alcohol LOL. Next time we'll order wine instead.   And yes we'll definitely be back. Pier 39 is tourist-y and we're locals, but no matter. It's actually nice to feel like we're on vacation in our own city! I will definitely take my visitors here, it's a winner. Oh and awesome service!

jzG5b7yQ80QqcrHhUD0FqA.review_text: Yummy food. Great service. Wonderful restaurant overall. Had the Lipstick Lemondrop, Crab Spinach Dip, cup of Clam Chowder, and Chicken Breast. Since I am not a mushroom fan, I asked our waitress to hold the sauce on the chicken and she suggested a creamy butter sauce that they use on one of their fish dishes. It was delicious!  Definitely a must try.

4m9NXICYBC5i9t4aTt-I6w.review_text: I stopped by here earlier this year with my wife and her parents for dinner.  To be honest with you I wasn't too happy about heading here as I thought it was going to be a touristy place with a ton of tchatche due to its location on the pier.   However, by the end of the visit they had me and I truly enjoyed eating here.  We started off our meal with the blue cheese garlic bread that was compliments of Yelp for checking in.  I loved it and it set the tone for a meal which would include good fish and lots of bread.  As a matter of a fact I think that I OD'd on the sourdough bread here between the garlic bread and then the complimentary bread which I ate a ton of both before the meal and then dipped into the leftover broth from cioppino.  The bottom line for me is that I would stop by here again in the future if I was in the San Francisco area.  I really enjoyed the food, especially the bread.

w3TOr5aR02TyLglQ9S6XPw.review_text: HORRIBLE SERVICE WITH KATIE (the server) she is so unprofessional and bad service... Never ever come back here again.....

x0ufaAxxrUqjXLcleOvT8A.review_text: Ok so I've been in the restaurant business for over 15 years and I NEVER do this because I know how it is. Bad day, fluke experience, whatever but this place was ATROCIOUS! We started with some beer/wine once we finally got service...the drinks were good once we got them after our appetizer had arrived....the was the start of the bad meal with horrible service.   We ordered the baked oysters to start because they resembled oysters Rockefeller which we love no matter what type of oysters they are. What came out was a weird cream based, over sauced oyster plate. I was ok with eating them until I got to the last one which was totally and completely rank! I'm not a huge oyster aficionado but not only did it taste as though the cute sea lions down the pier had pooped in them but it smelled totally stank (which I actually thought was either my servers breath or a fellow patrons unfortunate gas at first...a little harsh and I feel bad for ever thinking that but I never thought an oyster or any seafood for that matter could smell that bad) Ruined the rest of the meal...the only reason I'm giving 2 stars is because my Salmon entree, which was a special with veggies including Brussels sprouts which are some  of my favs, was pretty good after I sucked on a lemon, downed my entire water, and shot some tobacco sauce in attempt to get the bad oyster taste out of my mouth. Little did I know that would be the only water I would be offered throughout the rest of my meal...  Super unfortunate because I'm a huge foodie and love using yelp but this turned out to be an awful choice. Would have walked a bit further into the heart of Fishermans wharf to try different food or the street car (cods something...) everyone is raving about.

606Y-ca75UEryJIKmtc8wQ.review_text: Food was pretty good - I got the sole fish. Little heavy on the tarragon, but that's just me.

UMVPBTth2Qj_coidEXjIcw.review_text: Brought the future father in law here looking for some good seafood close to where he was staying and we were all pleasantly surprised, especially by the service.  Khaiman was our server and definitely took care of us that night offering excellent suggestions and frank feedback on specific dish details that we really appreciated.  All in all, the service he offered really made the experience.

b68abECX_1r65zqF56wvdg.review_text: I had the Crab Cake Entree with sautéed spinach & roasted fingerling potatoes; my boyfriend had the Fried Shrimp; my brother had the Swordfish; and my sis-n-law had the Garlic Roasted Whole Dungeness Crab (w/out all the nasty stuff from the shell)....we all enjoyed our meals. Good food, great service, nice views, and not very expensive!!

yhEpYHXZjF-JxvqrKWNbUA.review_text: Because of Katie I'll give it a 2star.... I'll come back to give it another try but I hope she won't be my server again....

Et0qEP5K0oTCpAZ0aULmpw.review_text: A huge expectation beater. Really touristy area, so our expectations were low for good food. Had some great chowder an amazing bread. Also got a blueberry cocktail that was super refreshing. Most impressive was our waiter (Khaiman). He was super warm and friendly and made us feel like we were on home soil.  Loved that all of it was sustainable too. This place just hit all the right notes.

UiBhRpIT1_8tI2naA0wMYw.review_text: Clam chowder was delcious! Best we had after three days of eating chowder. Mix grill was good, as was calamari.  I had crab ceviche which was flavorless.  Needed some type of sauce.  Our waiter was an elderly ESL man. Horrible service.  The other waiters kept jumping in to help and they were great. Would go again.

PJRDBGVCrgk25IGJbDqlWQ.review_text: The food and the view are great.   No free refills. My sister ordered a few lemonades and it came out costing more than her meal ($22). Dumb.

q-zcBRObGdiAMScvBIy2tQ.review_text: Good food and great view. Entrees probably average about $15-$20. I ordered the clam chowder in a sourdough bowl which was wonderful. My friend got crab that she really enjoyed as well. I would recommend this restaurant.

8xHIhD97GeZ4G2oKoQJdWQ.review_text: This is a late review, however, I wanted to input the info. GREAT CLAM CHOWDER bowl, great ambiance, service marvelous (even though it was so busy on a Friday night!), the fresh flower arrangements are beautiful, and found the staff all to be quite pleasant.  I spent a girls weekend, visited SFwith 8 gals, was very nice there and we all had great things to say about the place!  YES, DO GO AND YES ENJOY THE EATS AND THE PRICES ARE GREAT!  THUMBS UP!!!

swqSj4zuamI_HFfPTj63Hg.review_text: Came here with my girlfriend and had an awesome time. When we got to the restaurant there was quite a bit of people out front waiting and so we assumed that it would take a while to get seated, but they had us in and eating within 15 to 30 minutes.   The service was great all around. The guy filling the water probably stopped by the table every couple minutes filling my glass. Even if it was half full, he would fill it back to the brim. Our waiter took our orders and was quick to bring out our food.   They started us off with some free bread which was surprisingly delicious, but after polishing those off, we ordered Clam Chowder in a bread bowl and some sort of sampler/combo dish which came with fish&chips, calamari, and shrimp. The clam chowder was amazing, but the bread bowl it came in was pretty normal sourdough. The fish&chips were delicious and the batter they used was flaky, but not too oily or crispy.    A little on the pricey side, but was expected because it was a tourist-ey area. I would definitely come back to this restaurant again if I could.

Js5HfzUPQLALBUQm_lyLCA.review_text: Great food! Highly recommended steamed whole crab and jumbo shrimp! The dinner made SF trip better!

xoJV_T6LRUNJDKXvwUue6A.review_text: Very impressive! Scallops were good if you like them fried. Mixed Grill was great as well as the Fish and Chips-not too greasy! Dessert was wonderful. They have an interesting Chocolate Martini and a great Apple Crisp. Though the food was great, the best part was the view of the bay. Definitely try to get a window table. Enjoy!

U0W-ukKnBMgKAXAHviTNTQ.review_text: Overall, a great experience but unnecessary for the hostesses to keep us waiting outside in the cold while they set up our 15 minute table in an empty restaurant.   Oysters- fresh and tasty  Cioppino with linguini for extra $2- yummy and large but wished they provided more pasta Garlic fried crab- overly drenched in butter and lackluster in flavor  Service- great

4-WV8bA6Zfc4JR8vLBdvPQ.review_text: I was impressed by the reviews and wanted to have some good seafood while in San Francisco, hence the visit to Fog Harbor. It was good but for the price I expected more. My fiancé and I came for lunch on a Monday. I made reservations online, which was great because I probably changed the date and time at least three times. It wasn't too crazy during our visit and we were able to get a table overlooking the harbor, so four stars for that.   However, I'd rather have an awesome meal than a good view, and that's where the issue is. We shared a small bowl of claim chowder, a Blueberry Press cocktail, and ordered the fish and chips and a spring special, the Alaskan halibut. The clam chowder was very tasty although it didn't have as many clams as I'd hoped. But still very good. And with the crunchy sourdough bread? Yes, very very good. I ordered the skinny cocktail, which is some locally distilled vodka, blueberries, lemon, soda water, and Splenda. They gave me the regular by mistake, which has ginger beer, and I quickly noticed. The regular was very good and much better than the skinny (unfortunately he whisked the first one away rather than letting us keep it). But in neither drink could I really taste any of that locally distilled vodka, so three stars on that one since the drink was $12.50. For that price I should at least taste some vodka!  On to the main courses. The fish and chips came with coleslaw and fries and were very good. It had large chunks of well cooked and nicely battered (Anchor Steam) fish, but I would expect all of this for a price of $17.  I ordered the seared halibut, which came with quinoa arugula salad, tomato relish, pine nuts, and dried cranberries topped with a citrus buerre blanc and crispy leeks. The quinoa salad was delicious; it had a great flavor and the ingredients really went well together. But the main attraction, the fish, was a disappointment. It had a good texture but was lacking in flavor and was also dry. The presentation looked amazing but it fell short of my expectations.   Our server was courteous and prompt with the service and apologized twice for the drink mistake. Overall okay but I will try something else next time I visit the city.

cujMgdKEfauUEIg_hnCcew.review_text: I went here with low expectations given it is right in Pier 39.  But wow, what an awesome meal.  By far the best whole Dungeness crab I have ever had.  I had the garlic preparation and can't wait t have it again.

Zk0-wvM40P8F7tSah2v61w.review_text: Did not like the hostess attitude towards my friends and I. We are all in our 20s, of ethnic background, and because of that I think the hostess place us all the way in the back next to the bathroom in a pretty much empty restaurant. I had clam chowder which was nothing special. Entree was linguini with clams which was watery and clams were not cleaned properly. Did not even finish quarter of it.   Although our waiter provided exceptional service I will not be returning.

CcrnWI3OyY8ki7xfkTNLxA.review_text: The service is great! Even with the high volume of people who come into this seafood house of deliciousness, the staff maintain their can-do attitude!   I really enjoyed the Ahi Tuna, the wasabi aioli and stir fried vegetables compliments the Tuna very well. The view of the Bay was nice especially around 5:30 when the sun starts to set.    It's obvious that the folks who work there really enjoy what they do and are professionals. I would expect no less from a Mom & Pop restaurant that has been open for over 6 years.  I am glad that I took a visit to the California Welcome Center which is right next to the restaurant. They gave me plenty of information on places to dine and visit around  San Francisco.

5YUfy39pMeDI_ZNuAj2Iig.review_text: We live in the East Bay and came her for our evening in SF due to the great reviews on Yelp.  1. Lots of hot  warm fresh Boudin baked bread. Am embarrassed we had 2 basketfuls for the 2 of us. 2. They serve sustainable fresh seafood. 3. Clean environment, crisp linens. Did not look rundown. I did not expect this being this is a location on Pier 29. 4. Great View of the Bay

CR8kQqfMzOqZwL-boCoMiw.review_text: Yumm! Went here during vacation with three of my girlfriends. Our waiter was super nice and on point with service. Food was bomb too! The oysters were super fresh and their complimentary bread was super good!

IfHplx86fRtsyQiyELmo8Q.review_text: Dinner was FANTASTIC!    I live in SF, but my bff was visiting, so we wanted to go somewhere fancy.  We split: the crab risotto fritters as an appetizer, the swordfish as an entree, and the apple crumble for dessert.  Literally all of it was delicious, particularly the fritters.  That and the swordfish was as light and fantastically cooked as I have ever seen it.  Our waitress Brenda was also lovely about splitting our portions.  She even had the kitchen put our entree on two separate plates.  We came in ~5:30 on a Saturday and didn't need to wait for a table of two and everything came out of the kitchen very promptly.

5i2N8iaD17NFwXhxVpoMaA.review_text: I had some delicious oysters as an appetizer then a chicken dish that was amazing. The waiter was very knowledgeable about wines which was very helpful.  The best part must have been the service, it almost seemed like we were the waiter's only table.  The wait was a bit long but we put in our name before our whole party arrived and got in just as they were calling our group.  It was a good place.

1BxLEvXHe1iugR0ZBOmfPw.review_text: Great restaurant - will be back!  Well priced, great tasting dishes and best of all, they are serving sustainable seafood- and promoting it!  Must try the clam chowder and their garlic shrimp in home made sauce!   Fresh, warm bread is served with the meal which is  great touch!   We also finished the meal off with the apple crisp- which is like a cobbler!  Great views of Alcatraz also- ask for a table by the window but away from the door, if dining later in the day/night!

8ciQzrRSDqCeS9EIYdpkvA.review_text: I had trout, lobster, grape fruit juice, and dessert with latte. Very tasty.  Great ocean view. Because of the location, this place is popular.  We were able get seats because 5 p.m. for dinner.  Only thing is that I wish the plate was bigger as a big eater.

Dwu59YY2uedK3barvDMg7A.review_text: if you want to get seated right away, do Go elsewhere. The hostesses were rude and ignored us when we were standing in front of them. It took them a while to notice that we were standing there waiting to get seated. It did not look like they were happy to be at work. It was my first time here and first impressions are important. So so Glad our waiter took really good care of us. Drinks and food was mediocre. Do get their pumpkin spice bread pudding with vanilla ice cream! It was so yummy. Four stars for our waiter, he was awesome!

u60Iv8mCW5ILazQru_B_EA.review_text: Best chowder and great service! The Meal was fantastic! Service was over delivered. The bar tender made the most delicious Moscow mules! We were sat before our reservation and the fire works topped it off!

Y8NE-yilQrV30JsP4N6Tvw.review_text: The steamed mussels were one of the best things I have ever had! Also tried a few salads, linguine with clams, clam chowder and baked oysters. Visited twice in our trip. My husband had a few shell pieces in the pasta on our second visit but other than that we didn't have any issues. Baked oysters were probably my least favorite.

NQnkFYJidv0mjQWTQA_eKA.review_text: My girlfriend and I had the crab, mango, and avocado ceviche as well as the garlic dungeness crab. The food was phenomenal and worth every penny! We also got a bottle of moscato wine, which was delicious. We asked to sit by the window, and the staff was more than accommodating. The view was beautiful.   If you're looking for a great place to splurge for awesome seafood, stop here.

fTWtXca0hmdjLQFvkrNDPw.review_text: Located on the top deck of the Pier 39.  Came in on a Saturday evening for dinner. I have patronized the restaurant two times. Each time ordering wine or bringing a bottle of wine.   Each trip I had to wait to be seated but wait wasn't too bad. Host was correct on the time.   Seated and menus were provided promptly. Practically no wait was resulting for placing order. Initial drink delivery was prompt. The wine or corkscrew and ice were delivered promptly. Another trip a Manhattan. Manhattan was made nice and stiff.  Food order was taken and again no really a wait from order point to arrival. We had a free garlic bread coupon to which the wait staff was happy to apply to the whole table of eight of us.   Food order included chicken pasta, and seafood (paired with seasonal vegetables). Both time the staff was able to serve the sides separately due to a seafood allergen with my woman.   A warm fresh side of bread is provided free.
