The free garlic bread was properly portioned for group enjoyment. Chicken pasta and fish were flavorful and filling. Seasonal vegetables were tender and good on their own.  Drink refills and staff were good to refill and check on the table.  Towards end of meal, check and bill were closed promptly.   Good: Flavorful food, refreshing drinks, great service. Best cork fee on pier.   Bad: nothing to date.   Overall four stars. I'll be back.

j7MgNFeLAm_0AWfjNHHcuA.review_text: Crowded, with a view.  All along the pier, it's hard to pick out a restaurant that will actually be good for the price you pitch (it's San Francisco, you've got to make every dollar count if you want to make it a few hours). Fog House Fish Harbor was one of our first choices because there wasn't a line in front, and the lobby looked welcoming (albeit overly dressed-up like a hotel, I'm not kidding)  We were seated immediately, but the crowd that occupied the restaurant would be daunting for any staff, and I knew right away that this would take awhile. High over the waterfront on the clear day to see the whole Bay, the view from anywhere in the room was fantastic. But even I got a bit bored waiting for the waiter (I'm hilarious).  We ordered two Sourdough Chowder Bowls and their Salmon Flatbread. The former didn't stand out to me, but it's getting increasingly difficult to tell the difference between the dozens [and DOZENS] of chowder-serving locations. The Flatbread wasn't shabby, but shabby doesn't cut it for $13.00 (it's four triangles...small triangles)  Better places for better prices, but perhaps their crab and lobster put up a better meal's experience. Cheers.

VyMTtfwKskXZBbnB0ijwsQ.review_text: First time in SF so I wanted to have the best clam chowder bread bowl experience. This IS a tourist trap!   For three people, we each got the clam chowder bread bowl, a salad, the tuna ahi poke, calamari and two cocktails. Total before tip comes to about $95 dollars. Not worth it for appetizer meals.   Although the chowder was good, nothing about it was outstanding from the rest of the chowders. I wish it contained more or cost less. What makes up for the price is the view of the bay; but depending on where you were seated it wasn't much of a view.

Prp_rRpeLUdvlJKMkxIVoA.review_text: My wife and I had a great time! We were anxious to find some great clam chowder while in SF and this place did not disappoint! The sourdough bread bowl was incredible! The best we've had while on the West Coast.   Our service was very good. It's clear the service team knows they provide great food and it shows in how they take care of their guests. Our waiter was very knowledgable and efficient. We did have to do a little bit if waiting but only because we went on a busy Saturday in early August. All that in mind, the service was very good.   The prices are not cheap but not overly outrageous. We got what we paid for and left happy!

sEyHTyMF3nQ0kMjAEZx6Tg.review_text: On Pier 39, yes a touristy place, but we were doing the tourist thing! Great views of the dock, fresh oysters, cold beer, creamy yummy clam chowder, crusty sourdough bread, yummy I am in heaven!  They have a great seafood menu of every crustacean, Dungeness crab, fresh fish, and items for the land lovers too.  Great white tablecloth dining and servers.

bnZgu29f1ZnLH_exbTZptg.review_text: This place was really awesome. We made reservations even though it was located in the heart of Pier 39. I was looking for a delicious restaurant that didn't have a strict dress code. (I'm 8 months pregnant and don't have the widest variety of formalwear) ;)   We decided to try several appetizers, and then split a dinner instead. It turned out to be an excellent decision. The meal starts out with a perfectly prepared sourdough bread, it was so delicious. We had the calamari, I really enjoyed the dipping sauce and found it the batter to be delightfully crispy. My fiancee, didn't agree with the breading, as he prefers the light crispy kind. We also split the steamed mussels, they came in a delicious broth that was savory and delicious. We both agreed, these were absolutely amazing! We followed it with an order of raw oysters, and they were so fresh and delectable. They were a bit small, but the freshness and taste really made up for any shortcomings. We also shared a cup of clam chowder (how could we not?), and via others suggestion used the free sourdough bread in place of the bread bowl. We noticed a bar patron eating some amazing looking sweet potato fries topped with blue cheese, which you NEED to try because they are to die for! Upon further questioning with our waitress, there is a little happy hour bar menu that you should ask for if you happen to get the chance! For our main course, we split the cioppino. It was stocked full of delicious fish, crab, mussels, and shrimp, and featured a savory and thick tomato broth. It was really delicious, my fiancee found it to have too strong of a "fish" taste for him, but that's what made it awesome for me. For dessert we had the creme brulee, and it was perfectly caramelized on top, and creamy thick and fabulous... they really know their way around the dessert area!   The entire meal only set us back about $150 which was pretty awesome for location and the amount of food we ordered. Make a reservation and ask for a window seat, the view is beautiful. If we happen to make our way back to the San Francisco area, we will definitely be back!

3ps0DhIiH6BljSkbTyAM2g.review_text: Considering the restaurant is among the touristy restaurants at Pier 39, I had an idea of what I was getting myself into. Either way, my date wanted Cioppino and this was a recommended spot.  Parking is validated for 2 hours after 6pm, so that helped a lot.  The cioppino comes out in a big shallow bowl.  The maitre d accommodated my request for a window seat (+1 star).    As for the food and drinks, our server recommended a sweet white wine to pair with our cioppino.  I might go for dry next time as I feel it would have been less overpowering.  Nonetheless, it was still good otherwise.  The restaurant offers you crab de-shelled for easy eating for an extra few bucks, which is the first time I've heard that being done.  All in all, it was a great meal.

nicGnkYxQLXQFHAcNp4rsA.review_text: First restaurant I went to during my work in the Bay Area. This place did not disappoint. Many natives have told me that Pier 39 is overrated. I say this place certainly is not and may be slighly underrated. It met my expectations and at times exceeded!   I took my girlfriend here and we both loved the place. We got a window seat that overlooked the bay and the golden gate bridge in the far back. The service was great and on top of that, we checked in to get free garlic bread. The staff are great and again, impeccable service when we were there in February.  Now let's talk about the food. Their sourdough bread to start was perfect.  Definitely recommend the clam chowder IN a bread bowl, and the Crab was amazing. This place has some of the best seafood I've had at a reasonable price for the area. Oh and I forgot to mention their drink menu, amazing. They have amazing mixed drinks and wine selection. I personally even liked their "fruity" drinks that most describe as "feminine".   Do yourself a favor and stop by this restaurant if you are looking to sit down and enjoy a nice meal whether alone or with company.

h500Ce4x1x_hpm_Kzl3FJw.review_text: Great location, right at Pier 39. Decent food with reasonable price. My friends and I had a great time there. The view is also splendid. Make sure you get a table near the window to the sea. Also, make reservation ahead of time!!

hYeZ8eAIWV2DluhxYaIUuQ.review_text: HUGE portions. $17 for fish & chips and fries. It's one of their most popular dishes for a reason. Fish was extremely fresh and the beer batter was crispy and sweet. Our sever was super nice and charged us Happy Hour prices for our second round of drinks even though it was past 6pm. Be careful of their freshly baked sourdough complimentary bread. It's easy to overstuff yourself before your mail dish arrives.

j5_pB7dDxJw-TQYEQsOUnw.review_text: Came here based on reviews. It was tasty! I got the whole crab and my husband got the lobster tail stuffed with crab. Both were awesome. Don't forget to get your fun book of the Pier 39 website for an extra 20% off coupon. Definitely helps because this restaurant is on the pricey side. We will be coming back in the future to try the lobster mac and cheese.

s7amtDNqnO78zdY0SvkpUg.review_text: My boyfriend and I decided to take a day trip to the wharf and decided to try this restaurant out.  He had a mixed seafood pasta that he said was really good.  I had the mixed grill plate with shrimp, salmon and swordfish. It also came with mashed potatoes and mixed veggies.  I thought the seafood was very fresh and delicious.  We both started the meal with a cup of clam chowder and both agreed that we could have eaten a bowl.  It was the best clam chowder that I ever can recall eating.  It was perfectly thick with potatoes and loaded with clams.    Our server was very nice and prompt.  We never had to ask for a refill.  It was a tad pricey, but what isn't on the wharf of San Francisco.   2 cups of chowder, 2 entrees and 2 cokes ran us right about $85.

ElYRDR7d1iPBKPHuoh9sMg.review_text: Ambiance was nice, service was not awesome and food wasn't good but wasn't bad either. The view is absolutely incredible though!  After a long afternoon in the rain at Alcatraz we were STARVING when we got back around 3:30. I looked up trusty Yelp reviews that had been spot on for the last 5 places we ate. Considering this place had 4 stars and a bazillion reviews we thought it would be great! Well... It was just OK.  Our waiter took over 10 minutes to greet us and take our drink orders and by this time we knew what we wanted to eat.. then after another 5 minutes came back to confirm our drink orders and they didn't arrive for another 5 minutes.   Now we've been here 20 min with only glasses of water, did I mention we were incredibly hungry??!   The bread and drinks arrived and literally on top of that was the appetisers. Calamari was nice. However for a place that prides themselves in Crab Season - their crab cakes were shit. From Maryland and I work at a high end seafood restaurant, these crab cakes were not very nice.  Then we had burgers (I know it's a SEAFOOD restaurant but we wanted lunchy food) and they weren't very good. We didn't finish them.   Since we arrived during the lunch-dinner transition our waiter changed, but we got sort of lost in the transition where no one came by to check on us long after we finished. To the point that I stacked our plates myself to let them know we wanted our check!   Now, I am a server, I have high expectations for such a highly rated restaurant but I was disappointed by the service and quality of the food.

RZKArMj_vXzcg5ehdkTlsg.review_text: Eh. We ate here since we had already paid $25 to park for an Alcatraz cruise. The food was ok, but kind of over priced. I wouldn't come back or go out of my way to eat here. It's a large place with lots of people and makes for a noisy environment. Lots of obnoxious kids who lacked parental guidance.

Oi5ITZhtmM1CeZHCNThIEQ.review_text: Our clam chowder came fully loaded with PLASTIC SARAN WRAP in it.  Yummy.  We also ordered the ahi poke appetizer (decent) and the crab ceviche (no flavor).   Service was slow- we waited 10 minutes before they were ready to take our order.  The room was crowded - they packet everyone into one room like sardines even though there were other empty rooms, which made it tough to have a conversation and tough for the servers to move around to the different tables.  After the discovery of plastic in our clam chowder, the waiter apologized and also had the manager come over to apologize (and make excuses for why there was plastic in the chowder).  They took the chowder off the bill, which was the least they could do since we only ate a couple spoonfuls of it anyway.  They really should have offered us another appetizer or more $$ off the bill... but they didn't.  2 stars (instead of 1) for the view and location on Pier 39.

PWvQMoqQDmDyItsVtTDjuQ.review_text: Great place to bring out of town guests. Unlike some of the other Fishermans wharf options, the food is delicious and worth the price. I would highly recommend the lobster mac and cheese!

pv7yUP2F4vN0WanV_kWWnw.review_text: Dropped into the bar for dinner on a Monday evening.  The restaurant wasn't too populated and we were two alone at the bar.  The service was great and friendly and our food came out quickly and was delicious.    Tried the ahi tuna poke which was a nice fresh dish with some great spicy sauce artfully drizzled along the plate.  We also had the calamari appetizer which was cooked perfectly and was definitely more fish than batter (the way it should be!).  Also had the shrimp chili lime salad.  This was a good portio and the salad was good, there were only about 5 or 6 shrim around the edges of the plate - they were nothing special, I even left a few behind.

74JiWH2Uy4LMX-qFuSurqg.review_text: Gorgeous views, friendly service and delicious food!   Location - great location! Conveniently located at pier 39 on the 2nd floor  Service - staff from the host to the waiters were very friendly.  We were seated quickly and at a nice window table with gorgeous view.  Our waiter was nice & thoughtful without being overbearing.    Food - food was fabulous!  We had the grilled salmon, crab stuffed lobster and crab & avocado salad.  ALL of our dishes were completely devoured as they were just scrumptious!  Portions weren't significant, at least not the salmon, but can't complain.  It was all good.

bS2dAwe3z9J2vjQJwMq9BA.review_text: My wife and I went for Dinner.  We had to wait a few minutes for a table, not a long wait at all.  We had a nice view from our table and the waiter was attentive and friendly.   We shared scallops and calamari as appetizers, she had crab cakes for her entree and mine was the Shellfish platter.  The calamari were very good, they were fresh, had a good remoulade and pleasantly spicy batter.  The scallops however, were not good, they're obviously frozen with a thick, greasy unseasoned batter.  The crab cakes were good, with a lot of crabmeat.  The shellfish platter included a half Dungeness crab, 5-6 peeled shrimp and 5-7 clams and mussels.  It's all swimming in an eighth-inch of melted butter, crab juices and garlic.  How can it not be good?    Next time I'm in SF, I'd come back, just wouldn't order the scallops.

O98OvniMRlKF_lllMajzFQ.review_text: Boudin was a cluster so we headed upstairs to FHFH for a snack.  So glad we did.  We opted to sit at the bar and were promptly taken care of.  The chowder in a bread bowl was amazing with a little added pepper and a little bit of tabasco.  The parmesan risotto crab fritters were a tad over fried but were delicious nonetheless.  And the baked oysters - I could eat several dozen of them!

QP_7afgk74UF7NmOLq9TIA.review_text: I had a great experience eating dinner here! Jeremy, who is our waiter did an excellent job, despite the fact that he spilled wine on the table. We all make mistakes, right?  He was friendly and very professional. And had a great smile! We all loved him. The manger also was very accommodating! He gave us a free bottle of wine and a desert :)  Overall, our experience here was fantastic!

hUeApA1vTs0O4no2d7J71Q.review_text: Went yesterday when we were craving some fish and chips - we saw that theirs is made with anchor steam and were sold!  The fish and chips were great, but slightly too salty. The tartar sauce was the best, it didn't overwhelm the fish as most sauces usually do!  Ryan got the angus burger and it was great as well, the bun was just slightly too soft and got a little soggy.  The best part of the meal was the amazing clam chowder!  I will be going back just to have that clam chowder in a bread bowl!

85ioJ7FiiKsYJVYskq0TUA.review_text: I wasn't that impressed.  My wifes Chili LIme Shrimp Salad was greasy,  the shrimps overcooked to hell and just not as light as the name suggests.   My seafood penne was OK,  but I could knock up  something as good with my eyes shut (in fact the mirepoix was way too chunky to extract much flavour and of course didn't cook through).  Daughters fish and chips was good  though as was the Calamari.   Service was good, the view was good and the location of course, but coming from near Marseille in France,  where you can eat great seafood the meal was disappointing.

ZcTzBUuuXyDGmdsVulpl5w.review_text: The most delicious and fresh oyster and yummy steamed clam. Try these you never regret!

WD0pchQWVY5tBbPqRq4zjQ.review_text: This restaurant absolutely NEVER disappoints!!!!! It's in one of the most touristy places in SF, yet it's top shelf!! We went here tonight after a hellious week on public transportation. My boyfriend picked me up from work and we headed to the Fog Harbor. Pier 39 was teeming with tourists but we only had a 10 minute wait. Our waitress was perfect, the meals (we both had ahi tuna) were tremendous and fresh, and we got our favorite window seat looking out over to Alcatraz. Just the perfect evening!!!!! Love love love this place and please: eat the sourdough bread. It's to die for!!  Kudos to a fantastic restaurant! We will be back!!!!!

tcXbDFbFKrEA3Bks_zAm0Q.review_text: I never go to Pier 39 unless I have visitors who want to go and I am so happy to find this gem in the total tourist traps. The food is fresh and of high quality, especially comparing it to all the junk on pier 39. THe chowder was loved by everyone at the table.  The crab cakes were very good and not the disgusting frozen heavily breaded patties with hardly any crab. These were full of crab, green onion, peppers- full of flavor! Everything we had was good, the service was very good and the view was gorgeous!

qbQzH6jARRbBajV0VKLDEQ.review_text: Let's just say that walking all the way from the Powell Bart Station to here... was worth the sore feet.  My friend and I had our mind set on clam chowder in a bread bowl on the pier. When we saw the menu had "Award Winning Clam Chowder in a Sourdough Bread Bowl", we immediately asked for a table.   The boyfriend and I split a Cioppino (delicious), my friend got a swordfish steak, and my boyfriend's friend got calamari. Everything was delicious but I think the clam chowder took the cake. It had big chunks of clam and the soup was the perfect consistency. I notice that a lot of other places put in too many potatoes in their chowder, but Fog Harbor doesn't overpower the chowder with too much. Bread bowl was amazing. My boyfriend is on a no simple carbs diet - but even he could not resist a freshly baked sourdough bread bowl. Crispy, just a little tart, and warm. Hrmm.   Prices are reasonable. Food was delicious. Service was awesome. Would definitely come here again.

fL-4k0fpIqZU4OM4kryFlA.review_text: Fast seating. Exceptional Clam Chowder. The salad left a little to be desired but the calamari sauce was a hit! The crab legs were a tad on the smaller side but very delicious. The view is incredible and the wait staff was very cordual. My friend really liked the cucumber basil gimlet.

Yi8LctBGqLL2ZDfd2jcmqA.review_text: The location is great, with great views from a window seat. The sourdough bread was good, the clam chowder was great, and the oysters fresh. I had the mixed grill for my entree, and the salmon and shrimp were good. The swordfish was a little dry, as was the wild rice.  I had the tiramisu for dessert, and it was much better than expected.  My only complaint was the bar - mixed drinks seemed watered down. Go for the Lagunitas IPA.

mRrbijKHVfbfC2scMyxzbw.review_text: Had the crab legs-  Was ok not overly impressed.  Wouldn't really send anyone here as a go-to place.  Environment was nice and a pretty good view though.

J5Zt-gesMF7ZXPcZziiswA.review_text: We went here for a girls night put dinner. Amazing food and staff! The view is awesome! Our server was extremely helpful and friendly. She made a lot of recommendations and was very attentive. Highly recommend the seafood grilled combination, wedge salad, clam chowder, and seared ahi tuna. They also have fresh complimentary house-made sour dough bread! Although, this was not the best clam chowder I've had (best is pikes place clam chowder in Seattle, Washington) it is pretty darn tasty! I wish I had room for dessert, but I was stuffed already! Great food, ambiance, and great service, what more can you ask for?

n5zHIJwSXmAJQgBi0svsHw.review_text: Great food today for my husbands birthday after Alcatraz tour. Our waiter he was very friendly and trued hard to keep up since they were packed and seemed shirt handed. Hostess passed our name up after we told her we would be at the bar so it took awhile to get our table. Service was slow but the waiter his personality made up for it.   Lucky for us the food was worth it too

PgkSWpPWUTL7ro9gRHEtdA.review_text: Awesome place right on Pier 39 to have the best seafood the Bay area has to offer!  Got a surf n turf that came with a perfect medium filet accompanied by a fresh Lobster Tail. Service was flawless and I was very impressed by the consistency of it given that tourists like me come and go all day long.  I was pretty hungover from the W all night so I didn't get to try the cocktails, but I did overlook the bartender going HAM on the mojitios, so try one of those out for me!  Overall, a must stop when walking the SF embarcadero .. Try it after the GoldenGate Blue Line cruise for the best experience!!

GPjKCPiNVVxdPM_XC3cAgg.review_text: First time trying this place as recommended by our group. They have an award winning clam chowder which u must try! Pretty amazing especially with the sourdough bread bowl! Everything else was also great. Their oysters are by far some of the freshest and tastiest I've ever tried! Our server went above and beyond to make us happy. We were very pleased. The only bad thing I would have to say is that they don't have outlets so if you need to charge your phone they offer portable chargers at $100 added to your table as a deposit or form of insurance, we thought they were joking. Overall it was a great experience and wouldn't mind coming back.

K7RH6M4PnzHNe8AYdApEEA.review_text: 3.5 stars for the food 3 stars for the server service 1 star for the hostess attitude   I went here for the first time because supposedly they serve the best clam chowder according to other Yelp reviews. I got 3 dishes and they were pretty good, but not something that I really want to come back again for.  Clam chowder: pretty good and not too creamy, but didn't have enough clams   Crab & avocado salad: delicious dressing with fresh crab meat. It comes in a HUGE portion so it's basically a main course.  Garlic Chile Crab: the sauce was amazing and it's great for dipping your bread in. But the seasoning didn't sick well to the crab meat.  Our server (Amy) was decent and attentive, but the hostess (I forgot to get her name) was so rude. She asked us to wait for a table so we sat outside near the fireplace to wait for like 15 minutes. She came up to us with an attitude and asked "so are you ready now?" I'm thinking what is wrong with that girl because she was the one who asked us to wait there. While walking to our table, she rudely said "well, I have this one stable for you so you can sit there or like I guess I can move you too if you don't like it. Whatever." I guess certain people don't care about their jobs. I will definitely get her name next time.

YvBvdwVjfSlcVKrOjjPt4g.review_text: I was not that impressed with this place. Don't get me wrong the food wasn't bad, but it just wasn't  4 star worth either. I ordered the sole and the BF had the salmon. The meal wasn't too bad. We weren't  blown away either. All in all, for the price that we paid, we would have expected a better meal.

l0U0PfzzVMm9s4KshP6T0w.review_text: This is a fantastic seafood place with a view of Alcatraz, the Golden Gate bridge and  San Francisco Bay and is easily one of the best waterfront dining experiences I've ever had. The prices are up there because it's a high volume tourist area, but you won't  mind paying for the quality. It's as close as you'll find from ocean to plate.   The dining room is enormous and formal, however there are all kinds eating here. The waitress was fantastic and frequent to check in. There is tons of natural light from the enormous windows and the dining room is immaculate.   The menu features all your seafood staples, but the award winning chowder and roasted jalapenos with scallops are favorites. Make this a destination restaurant, if you're in town.

3l5lrs0_voc3cZz_UiLeZA.review_text: This place was delicious!  I bookmarked this restaurant for our upcoming San Francisco visit and am very  happy we were able to stop by.   We came for a late lunch today after visiting Napa. The place was still quite busy around 3pm.   We got seated by the window so we had a nice view of the bay.  We started off with cup of clam chowder soup and crab and spinach dip. This was probably one of the best clam chowder soups we've ever had. The dip was alright.   For our main entrees I ordered the seared ahi tuna with mashed potatoes and veggies. It was excellent! The soy ginger glaze, in addition to the other sauces I can't recall, worked really well with the dish. The presentation was sooo pretty I didn't want to eat it.  I was extremely satisfied with the dish :)  My mom got the mixed seafood plate (swordfish was yummy!) and my sister got the seared halibut with quinoa and arugula (very tasty as well).   Too bad I'm not a San Fran native otherwise I'd make repeat visits!

0rixSfaeisfQn92w3xiP_A.review_text: We celebrated my husbands birthday here this weekend. Dinner was very fresh and fun right off the water. We had a beautiful view of Pier 39 and the sea lions. The shellfish platter comes piled high with crab, shrimp, mussels, and clams, in garlic butter.  I highly recommend the platter and it was fun to eat and very fresh! The clam chowder was delicious!

k3dbwpzE_70xaVC1g-JKYA.review_text: Ok I'm giving this  resto Two Star for their food! Had high expectations before dining at this resto but now....  The Salmon and Linguini with clams that I ordered DIDN'T TASTE FRESH at all. Total DISAPPOINTMENT! Definitely needs major improvement on food prep...  Would give Charlie (our server) 5 star for being so attentive!  5 star for the view and location of the restaurant. Its in the heart of Pier 39.

zy1DpD7pC4dzrSecLZ8cKg.review_text: We were disappointed. My wife's salmon was tasteless. My fish and chips were average at best. Especially given how good San Francisco food can be, we feel that we made a mistake coming to the Wharf.

CBG3um4DlmwtSphCo5ENBg.review_text: This is probably one of the nicest restaurants on pier 39. The ambiance appeared very classy but there are so many casual patrons that it didn't feel too uptight.   There was about a 30 minute wait on Thursday night. They have a nice cozy fireplace to sit by while looking over the menu. There are no buzzers so you have to wait near the restaurant to hear your name called out.    Once we sat down, we got a lovely view of the pier with the sea lions. The fresh sourdough bread was delicious! Crusty on the outside but soft on the inside.   I ordered the clam chowder in the bread bowl with a side caesar salad while BF had the swordfish. The clam chowder was tasty and definitely not salty. That's always been my biggest problem with clam chowder. The caesar salad was forgettable... it was served on the whole romaine hearts. I would prefer if the lettuce was already chopped for easy eating! BF enjoyed his swordfish and the portion was generous for the price. We definitely did not leave feeling hungry or guilty!

uojZ2-O3HHCBZ0sGT_Eeiw.review_text: If yelp can add negative stars I would! I mean the place is supposed to be formal and professional right? I mean after all we're paying for a pretty expensive food. With market prices. I don't mind that but when you have a server with a sarcastic attitude that's when I mind. It was my friends birthday and wanted to make the night special for her but she ruined it! If you have issues on your own personal life then deal with it at your own time !  Manager if your reading this her name is Katie and maybe you should do something about that before someone experience such bad service again!

ldwJGT7KAR_d-0kAZ0R54g.review_text: Sat down at the bar right away, recieved prompt service, order the ultimate dirty martini-- delish and my gf ordered the basil cucumber gibblet--pretty refreshing.  We order fries to snack on and the came out immediately.  My gf and I were chatting and mentioned charging our phones and the manager gave us two portable chargers.  Great service, friend staff. The only reason I didn't give it a 5 is the bartender didn't entertain my joke.  Hahahah! Will come again to taste their main entrée.

4Do6WKxYC8L_hsk0QsQ6lQ.review_text: This is a lovely restaurant with a beautiful view by the bay. My bf and I came in around 8pm on a Thursday. We made reservations, but was seated 30 mins prior to our reservation.   We got sat down and was instantly stunned by the different selections of seafood plates. Before we ate we got a beer and cocktail and ordered our food. While we waited we sipped down our drinks and ate some bread and butter. We got the baked oysters, seafood cioppino, and seafood combo.   As we got our food we were amazed of how big the dish was. The first dish we tried was the baked oysters. Must admit that it was pretty good! My boyfriend had calamari, fish, and fries. My dish consisted of clams, mussels, fish, shrimp, and crab. I was also looking forward to the pasta part. I wish they added a little more noodles to the dish. Other than that, it was great and fulfilling.  The service was okay. I know they tried their best to go above and beyond for great customer service, but I felt like we were waiting more than we had to.

8Qo6HgnVxYeD5K3N-6FxmA.review_text: We at pier 39 and decided to have clam chowder since it was a chilly day in SF. This place is always good. My clam chowder was a little cold but the manger fixed the problem in 2 minutes and I was able to enjoy my chowder. It's a nice restaurant with great views try to get a table by the windows. I also had crab cocktail which was delicious. My friend ordered the seafood ciopino and had them make it spicy, that was bomb I would recommend it that way if you like spicy. Enjoy

Ry1Rctmgp2jfBxtmc0NQyg.review_text: Food -Can I just say that everything we ordered today was delicious?!! Everything was freshly prepared. You can tell that you're not being served premade food that has been sitting there for a while.  -Fish & Chips ($17): YUM!! Very fresh. This reminded me of a 10x better version of the fish in McDonald's filet-o-fish (I'm a huge fan of that fast food sandwich). It came with a generous amount of fish, french fries, and cole slaw.  -Crab Roll ($19): The sandwich was a bit smaller than I expected, but it was amazing! The bread part reminded me of the outside of a grilled cheese, and the crab part was kinda like a dungeness crab salad. It also came with a side of sweet potato fries + more crab. -Clam Chowder in Sourdough Bread Bowl ($10): Comparable to Boudin's but I might like this one even more. -Garlic Roasted Crab ($19): I didn't try any of my dad's entree, but I'll include a pic of it. He said it was very tasty. -I also loved the free bread that we got before our meal. It was still super hot, fresh, and crispy right from the oven. WIthin 5 minutes, our table already finished the first basket of sourdough and had to ask for more.  Ambience -Right next to the water at Pier 39. We had a great view of the ocean, Alcatraz, and also the sea lions. -Cute, simple, classy -Nice fireplace outside in the front of the restaurant  Service -Great!! The servers here are all very friendly and helpful.

l6g90Ia5xFtcE3D6HeDuvg.review_text: Came here for happy hour at the bar and we were not given the happy hour menu. Nor were we informed there was happy hour going on even though the hostesses claim there was one. It was not until the couple next to us asked for the HH menu did the bartender presented them with one. By that time, we were almost finished with our food.... Oh well. We should've asked ourselves. Additionally, the bartenders, while pleasant and personable, were not very attentive even though it was not very busy. Bustling doing other things than tending to their customers. Or maybe we were not given attention due to our low orders of alcohol. That could be it.   The food, nevertheless, was very good. I ordered the Salmon "Club" Salad after seeing the diner next to me eat the same dish. The salmon was moist and not too dry. I would definitely order it again... that is, if I decide to go back. Good service leads to re-visits. Take note, managers.

CPPBdwW6EuEAXFklbUc7qg.review_text: Got sick from the Fish and Chips or the Beer?! Careful

XBx9Q09VUk5Fd9sHaEDJhA.review_text: Beautiful view of the harbor. The service was  professional and inviting. This trip the food was good but not out of the ordinary. We had the market price Salmon and Mixed grill. The presentation was acceptable but not exciting to the eye. The taste was just not over the top. Absolutely no wow factor. I also got the clam chowder. Again the taste was good but not great. If you want an awesome view inviting ambiance and welcoming attentive service. This is your place. Mila, Thanks for a your wonderful table service.

GDaelIjovMulp3KmaybX3A.review_text: Great restaurant. We were recently in the Pier 39 area - had just finished a tour of Alcatraz and wanted to check out the seals and grab some food. After a quick glance at all the menus, we finally decided on Fog Harbor Fish House.   The menu is pretty pricey, but the food is pretty good. Fresh warm sourdough bread was complimentary, which was surprisingly delicious (Note: I am a sourdough snob).  We ordered the following: beet and blue cheese salad, california crab and avocado caesar salad, the soup and salad combo (caesar salad and a clam chowder bread bowl), and the crab roll. Didn't get a chance to try dessert, but the dessert tray they had looked amazing!   Great views of the Bay and the seals!

L_zNp9X95z9NERL2vzGiwQ.review_text: We didn't have a reservation but were told they take walk-ins so we called as we got close to the restaurant and they said there was no wait time but once we parked and walked to the restaurant they had filled up in a matter of 10 min max and told us the wait would be 45 min- 1 hr long so we waited. An hour and a half later we were still waiting. Someone in our party finally complained and we were seated. By that time 2 hours had passed and mind you we had kids in our party. They comped a few drinks but we ended up getting ripped off when we had to pay $24 for parking because only 2 hours were free with validation and that was the time we were waiting for our table. Food was ok but we shouldn't have had to wait 2 hours when they said 45-1hr. We could've gone somewhere else but we had already waited for so long! They should've comped us more for having to wait as long as we did and not tell us there's no wait without considering parking time and walking to the restaurant.

J9BPdPum6yOEiOoag--UDQ.review_text: Great food, like really really great! Wonderful atmosphere and staff. Also have out of this world aged manhattan, must try it!!! Only down fall was server didn't come by often enough and we sat a long time

-WgI2su8Qa-zatW1i_TC8Q.review_text: The food was good but the service was BAD. The waiter didn't refill our drinks,  food took awhile to come out, and got one of our order wrong. When we asked for our ticket that even took some time. The people next to us said the same thing.  Only thing was the food.

2c46Ds6WvOJTl6d2hmTRvQ.review_text: The wait was about thirty minutes, not bad for dinner time. The food pricing ranges from about 12-35$ per plate. It was amazing food, service, and had a great ambiance. My server was Jason, and he recommended the best dish and was super kind and helpful! I'll be back for sure!!

K9RFAFSaZUY2InwIun7fbA.review_text: I was on the ferry back from Alcatraz and wanted a bowl of clam chowder especially on a cold rainy day. I walked in around lunch time and it wasn't busy and sat at the bar. The restaurant is all windows and has great views if you sit at a table. I ordered the soup and salad combo and also if you check in on yelp you get a free bleu cheese garlic bread (!). Everything I ordered was really good especially the garlic bread. If I ever go to fishermans wharf again i'd def come back and recommend the restaurant.   Also, my favorite part was the customer service, the two bartenders were friendly and attentive. I'm traveling by myself and a friendly conversation was a plus.

uaBQ9Tvfe4vNj09ao5VHiw.review_text: I'll be honest, we came here to get our parking validated and we only had clam chowder and the crab/mango ceviche. As already noted, this is a typical touristy restaurant but I'll highlight a few of the positives:  -Fresh and free sourdough. With that being said, skip the bread bowl with your chowder and use the free bread. -Good views of the water from almost any table. The whole place has wide windows that ket in natural light. -The table cloths have paper on them, I have no shame and asked for crayons. Who doesn't love doodling before dinner? -Friendly staff  Overall I have had better chowder and the $16 ceviche was pretty average. Oh and it came with literally five tortilla chips on the plate. Five...not to be negative but I was not sure if that was the restaurant being fancy or cheap.

WcuGUc953j9w0PDx3UwNAw.review_text: Super busy on a Saturday night at 6pm. We were able to get seated fairly quickly though.  The calamari appetizer we ordered came fast and the dip that came with it was the highlight of the dish. Crab stuffed lobster was next.  The lobster was delicious but i wasn't a fan on the crab mixture which was strange since i love crab.  I also didn't like the garlic mashed potatoes either,  they just tasted strange to me.  My dinner companion thought they were delicious.  Now the best part of the meal. .... dessert.  I happened across a chocolate cake.  I don't normally go for chocolate but it was the best dessert option.  You know the fudge inside a molten lava cake?  That's exactly what it tastes like!  The entire thing and it doesn't have a cake texture,  more like a thick pudding.  Worth every calorie and more.  I honestly believe it's the best thing I've ever eaten,  in my life! It's a must have,  I may go get another today!

z20FNsqFmnL45AAggYLXeA.review_text: During my trip to San Francisco - my friend and I stopped here on a Sunday evening. I'm grateful we did!  We sat at the bar after we put our names on the list to be seated. The drinks I had were excellent! I had the Lombard Lemonade and the Lipstick Lemondrop...mmmm. I also liked that they had "lower calorie drink options" on the menu. (Since I was on vacation - the calories didn't count - but just in case for another time where I'm on perfect diet behavior)...  Once we were seated, our server was very attentive and provided excellent service. The complimentary bread was delicious - or maybe I just love sourdough. For my entree, I had the mixed grill -  which was perfect because I couldn't make up my mind on what kind of seafood I wanted. It was plenty of food, but I didn't finish the meal miserably full.   The ambiance of the restaurant was pretty nice too; I liked our view of the bay.   When I come back to San Francisco, I'd love to eat here again!

1VL37A_wk_t67j-WdDecpA.review_text: We had a light lunch here on our last day in San Francisco and thoroughly enjoyed it. I had the Red Chili shrimp which was very spicy and very good. The sauce was so flavorful that even though I usually skip the bread, I used it to get even more of the sauce. Hubby had the clam chowder bowl and thought it was solid and second only to the chowder at Scoma's during our visit this time. It was fun to watch the sea lions while we were having lunch and then to walk around on the pier after eating.

PudHHX-t2zpxkRgDrHsnyA.review_text: very clean, great food and service. Worth the money!

wvB9Rzn3BHzUUMUzLL4u2w.review_text: We had an early dinner and a nice view of Pier 39.  For appetizers, we had the dungeness crab cakes and our daughter had their award winning clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl.  Hubby had the pacific sole with fingerling potatoes, spinach, peppers, tarragon & capers.  I had the mixed grilled salmon, swordfish and shrimp, with citrus buerre blanc, wild rice and steamed broccoli.  Our daughter had the kids meal fried shrimp & french fries.  The food was delicious, and we were too full for dessert. A couple of hours later, we were able to enjoy the fireworks display over the bay.

rHgT6lBbZ2PaHt0UWfTMtw.review_text: We came on a Monday evening and ordered 1. Clam chowder in a bread bowl - 9 2. Fish and chips - 16 3. Seafood Penne - 18 a couple drinks for 43 with a 20% coupon from the coupon book from the Welcome Center  - You're on the 2nd floor so you get to see a wonderful view of the Pier. We came during sunset, so we got to see a gorgeous view of the sun near the horizon.  - Nice service. Quick with refills and condiments.  - Clam chowder was rich and creamy. generous portions of clam. My favorite part is eating the bread bowl when the bread absorbed most of the clam chowder soup! Nom! They Claim being the best. I can attest that it's good!   - Fish and chips pretty average. No better than ordering from a fast food fish and chip joint - Seafood penne had a lackluster taste. Don't recommend.  - Overall, very pleasant meal with a wonderful view of the Pier at a discounted price!

Ru9W4oeGaRfBvVLLUzR_Hg.review_text: Fog Harbour has the best service, food and atmosphere on the Wharf.  I highly recommend that you give it a whirl when entertaining your family, friends and loved ones. Superb clam chowder and cucumber basil martini.

4jr4z3ZpKpAWEN1TT6D_ow.review_text: I like this place a lot. I had a shellfish for two shared with my husband. It was delicious but don't eat dessert. Your server brings you samples and they all look terrible...our waiter even recommended other places for dessert.

qJTDoQFAKKg2bH-B5tLsXQ.review_text: The food is off the chain!  My favorite is the swordfish with the delicious potatoes!  I also have my favorite desert, the chocolate cookie with ice cream....

fM_UsuFAYu2TVUqJiYAKsg.review_text: Enjoying a few short hours in this fantastic city via a cruise ship...looking for that one fantastic seafood meal, we ended up here thanks to a glance at Yelp via cellphone before the battery expired.     Encouraged by 4-star reviews, and in need of dungeness crab we walked up the stairs to this restaurant and were promptly seated.  Then we waited.  For a long time.  Finally a server appeared and she was very friendly and informative.  Unfortunately I didn't take her advice.  Wanting easy dungeness goodness, I ordered the dungeness crabcakes. We ordered chowder to share, and husband went with fried shrimp platter.    DON'T do what we did.  We soooooooo ordered wrong.  After a couple trips to the restroom which enabled me to see all the awesome food here, all I can say is DON'T order what we did.   Order ANYthing ELSE.      Chowder was okay, decent and husband's fried shrimp was okay. My crabcakes were two giant FRIED cakes of lots of filler. Sooooo NOT what I wanted.  But again I blame myself.  The server had steered me in a different direction and I (stupidly) didn't listen.     Sadly, we left feeling like we had totally ordered wrong, had not had that terrific San Fran seafood experience, and must come back and redeem ourselves next time.    Do try this place...most importantly DO listen to the server for recommendations, and follow their advice.  Otherwise, you might have a pricey ($62 before  tip) lunchtime mistake like we did.

oa8ryTDdohg7HlYfF38Owg.review_text: Parked in Garage across from the pier, walkway above street was nice and they validate ,sweet. We were seated right away.  Waitress made our night and the Manager was super wonderful, just checking to make sure all was to our liking.  Food was yummy. Good Evening with Family.
